name: Santa Barbara Shellfish Company
text: Great location but the place is very tiny.   You sit arm to arm with your neighbors.  Food is ok and I love the view.

name: Red Hot & Blue Restaurant
text:
WARNING: HORRIBLE!

I absolutely love BBQ and southern food. With that said my family and I decide to try this place for take out since it was brand new. First of all, there is a $3 charge for any order over $40 which isnt that bad but you would figure the there wouldn't be a charge for large orders since we're spending a lot. 

Never the less we took our dinner home excited for our new found BBQ place. We got a half slab, a chicken crisper and rib platter, a brisket platter, and a Tennessee triple platter. Starting with the slab, unbelievably dry and the sauce was ketchup with Worcestershire sauce. They have this coating that I've never seen and I'm assuming it's because they were smoked, however it made eating them almost impossible. The chicken was dry and had gristle which was surprising since it was pulled. The sauce again, ketchup and Worcestershire. The brisket...the worst I've ever had. 

Besides the horrible food, I've never been to a BBQ place that didn't serve Mac and cheese. One star and I will never give my business to this place again.

name: Landmark Americana
text:
I stopped in for dinner and a drink & was thoroughly pleased! I rarely order a burger when I go out to eat, because why order "out" what you can make easily a home, right? Well..... when I go back I'll have a hard time NOT getting another burger. Oh, they also have a decent beer selection and the wait staff/bartenders made me feel very welcomed too.  My food was prepared exactly as I ordered and was served quickly.  The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the restrooms were clean.  All in all I was very happy!
.

name: Bareburger - Midtown Village
text: If you're looking for fresh spins on the classic burger, this place is for you. Huge fan of the firequacker and the onion rings. Oh and did I mention their milkshakes are incredibleeee! The service is quick and the food is fresh every time! This place is fire.

name: Schnucks Telegraph
text: We purchased the 8 piece fried chicken from the deli at 5:45pm. We assumed the chicken would be fresh since it was dinner time. Wrong!!  It was the smallest pieces of chicken we have ever seen and it was all dried out. One wing was so small that it only had a piece of a bone.  One thigh was dried out and was missing the crispy skin. It was just a piece of almost black dried meat.  We couldn't eat half the chicken it was so bad. Apparently there isn't any quality control in the deli. Very disappointing.

name: The Drafting Room Tap Room & Grill
text: Unfortunately, this visit wasn't as good as the last.  We had an appetizer of nachos.  The fresh salsa was excellent, the cheese flavorful and plentiful.  I only wish they had an option of adding some kind of meat to the nachos.  For dinner, my daughter had the Jerk Chicken special, my husband had the crab cakes and I had the gumbo with a caesar salad.  The Jerk Chicken would have been good but it was a bit too heavy handed on the pepper.  The pineapple salsa was good but couldn have benefited from fresh pineapple. The crab cakes had a TON of lemon dumped on them (by the chef, not by us), so they were very acidic.  My gumbo had vinegar in it...so much so, that it was inedible.  I have cooked jambalaya and gumbo at home.  I have NEVER used vinegar in it.  It was overpowering and soured my stomach for the rest of the night.  I am sorry Drafting Room...you missed the mark this time.

name: Three  Flags Tavern
text:
Not only is this place delicious (brussel sprouts, fried chicken and brisket burger were ON POINT), but the owner?/host? guy is super accomodating--lit up a fire for us out back even though no one had been out there and the weather would've advised against it.

Definitely recommended.

Oh, and those pickles. Get as many of them as you can.

name: La Creperie Cafe
text: Just getting around to writing this review.  We went on Valentines day.  It was real nice with the French atmosphere.  I liked the savory crepes better than the sweet.  We had the Gyro Crepe and the Asiago Crepe, both were delicious.  We didn't try the Nanza but we will go back for that, they are flatbreads on iIndain Nan bread they sound great.  Wee ended on the Crepe suzette.  The service was excellent.  We will go back.

name: Citizens Bank Park
text:
At this stage in my life to finally get to see a ball game at a stadium was a big deal. Husband scored some primo seats in a suite - he knows someone who knows someone type of thing. So we got free parking and just had to walk across the street into the stadium. We Ladies had our bags checked and walked through security. Not knowing where to go the greeters were so friendly and helpful. They let us know that our tickets included a private wine and cheese tasting event before the game. Then as we are walking towards our suite we were approached by servers with appetizers that were delicious.

The food served was great - hoagies made with prosciutto and good Italian salami. Everything to make your own Cheesesteaks. Hot Dogs. Chips. Delicious cookies and cupcakes. Beer, wine and soft drinks.

We had our own server and bartender. There were about three other families in the suite and there were plenty of seats and room to walk around freely. Our own bathroom which was very clean.

Walking through this stadium I could tell it was a special place. Clean and easy to maneuver through. 
Lots of places to buy food and souvenirs.

Can't wait to go back!

name: Lulu' s Pet Grooming
text: Outstanding!!  I have a German Shepard that sheds, sheds, and sheds.  They did such a good job that I have not had to vacuum everyday.  They said she could be bathed about every 6 weeks, so look out I will be back with my fur ball.  haha.  They also did a great job on my yellow lab.

name: Murph's Bar
text:
very chill atmosphere, good selection of micro brews, 2 dollar pbrs, great place to hang, live music.

Not much space however, tough to relax if its busy

name: UV Nightclub
text: Terrible. Do not go here. $10 cover to see a bunch of ghetto thugs show each other their guns. The 10 cops always outside is your first clue.  If all you want to do is dance and have a few drinks-there are plenty of other cool places on broadway.

name: Boostin' Bowls
text: Very pricey for a small amount. The acai was a little watery and I did not enjoy whole hard chocolate chips in the acai bowl.

name: Surrey's Café & Juice Bar
text: If you beat the crowd you're in. Small but that's the only negative. Everything I've tried on the menu is AMAZING! They even have vegetarian/vegan items. I always get whatever french toast special they have. I always take people who stay with me for Mardi Gras here for breakfast before we hit the parades.

name: Haveli Indian Cuisine
text: Good Indian buffet with fresh to order naan/garlic naan.  More vegetarian options, better food, and better service than India Garden.  Only, $6.99 and they have coupons on their website that knocks another dollar off the price.  Loved the egg curry!

name: Izenberg's Catering & Cafe
text:
Absolutely LOVEEEE diners and Jewish deli's and this is a jew diner. 

Highly recommend the pastrami sandwiches. They put a lot of twists on them, I got it over Latkes and the latkes were perfectly crispy. This place is decently priced.

I would give it a 5 star except that the decor was still like the old ownerships, except for the Easter themed counter. And that it doesn't include a free salad bar or dessert.

name: I.C. Sharks Seafood Market
text: A truly great FRESH seafood place. My favorite is the crabcakes and Royal Red shrimp. Hogfish is fresh and amazing and I used the clams to make Clams Casino on New Years Eve. So good!!! Service is great and the seafood is yummy.

name: Flying Pie Pizzaria
text:
Went on Tuesday night for the gourmet pizza night! 

Cost my husband and I $20 for all you can eat pizza, drinks & salad! Not too shabby!

It was fun trying the different flavors of pizza they had available!
Salad bar was fresh clean and had a good selection of toppings! 

The only complaint is the Samoan pizza needed to be cooked longer some of the cheese on top wasn't melted all the way... smh! Other than that everything & everyone was awesome!

name: Compère Lapin
text:
They had me at the copper bunny...vodka, pineapple jalapeño tequila, lime juice and sparkling wine in a beautiful copper bunny (it packs a wallop). Don't try to find one to buy...they mold and make them just for the restaurant.
Starters included fresh chilled gulf oysters and crispy conch fritters with pineapple tarter sauce.  We then proceeded to two tuna "small bites:" sushi grade hamachi lightly tossed with a guava curry and papaya, and more traditional tuna tartare...they couldn't have been better.  We were a little scared to try the curried goat but it was
incredibly tender and the curry paired perfectly with the melt-in-your-mouth sweet potato gnocchi.  No room for dessert but we can't wait to come back to NOLA and Compère Lapin!

name: Crown & Bull
text: Really good cheeseburgers try the hell burger if you would like a spicy burger definitely recommend breakfast as well

name: Rescue Spa
text:
I've been here about a half dozen times to get a full Brazilian wax (or Lotus as they call them) done.  I've had all ranges of service here from extremely poor to fairly good.  Their lack of consistency between estheticians always makes me hesitant to go back.  I only go back if I can't get an appointment at my regular spa and will only get waxed by Connie. 

One of the worst waxes I've ever had was at Rescue Rittenhouse from a woman named Jennie (I think).  As a very experienced waxer (I've had 50+ brazilians in my life), she gave me by far one of the worst waxes I have ever had.  The experience lasted no more than 5 minutes and was extremely painful.  She ripped very large areas of hair, was rude, and left me bleeding and bruised.  Yes, I was bruised from the wax!!  I have a pretty high pain tolerance, but this was just awful. I immediately got dressed after the service and went outside to pay.  I was shaking from the shock of the whole thing.   As I go to pay, I complain to the receptionist, who only took $5 off my service!  She wouldn't budge with her price and tried to make up excuses as to why it would hurt so much.  What a freaking rip off.

name: Dosa Hut Indian Grill
text:
Hankering for South Indian Dosas?...this is the place. There are good Indian Restaurant alternatives to this hole in the wall, however, my taste buds bring me back here. It is the only reason for the 4 stars. Tardiness, Service are out of left field. Especially the bathrooms need attention!

I really can only attest to some of the appetizers and the DOSA's!....AND, their GARLIC NAAN's have always been perfect.

Choose your Dosa's and enjoy the food...not the surroundings!

name: Buddy Brew Coffee
text:
Quick Read: Aside from the parking and occasional crowds -- this place is fantastic.

Thankfully, Buddy Brew is expanding -- a move that I hope will relieve some of the terrible parking issues. This place is a must-try in Tampa. The baristas are friendly, knowledgable, and efficient. The breakfast and lunch options are solidly tasty. The coffee is roasted with a level of care that I'm glad to see in Tampa. One of my absolute favorite places on the planet.

name: Mood Cafe
text: Just so you know, I now eat a chicken chaat from Mood Cafe at least once a week. They are so amazing and unlike anything I have ever experienced before. I would attempt to describe a chaat as "Indian Nachos". It is crispy chips, chick peas and potatoes topped with fruit, nuts, sauces, fresh herbs and chicken. The flavor is ADDICTING! :) The samosas and lassis are also fantastic. Thank you Mood Cafe for introducing me to my new favorite food!

name: HotBox Pizza
text:
I love HotBox, but this location can't seem to match the service quality as other locations. Deliveries always seem to be a problem, with delivery times double what is estimated, and constant parts of orders missing. So tired of getting my pizza but not my sauce, and having to wait for another 30 minutes for them to deliver it, when it should have been included the first time. 

Hopefully the management takes notes, finds out where the misses are occurring in your process, and fix it.

name: Best Buy Downingtown
text: Downingtown don't even bother. Only 5 4k 49'. Not impressed.  Very disappointed. Guy came out have out wristbands. By the time he reached the 20tj person no more. I ask how many they had he stated 5.

name: The Turning Point - Cherry Hill
text: Service average. Food average. Atmosphere average. Meh describes my whole experience.

name: Tacodelphia
text: What a gem!!!!! I love a good shrimp taco!!! These are definitely an authentic shrimp taco. Im usually not a huge fan of corn tortillas but these were actually very good!!!! I love how you can select your own toppings and the pickled onions were such a good choice. The jamaica was good too. Staff was very friendly as well. If I lived in Philly this would be my good to place

name: Crooked Eye Brewery
text: Never would have found this place but I had a groupon so I tried it out. Such a great little place. Got to meet the owners who are fantastic. Great local business to support. I'm not a beer drinker at all but I did enjoy the white tail ale. The sangria was fantastic. Wednesday's are trivia night. We had a blast. Perfect date night experience. Go! You won't be disappointed...

name: Sage Yoga & Wellness
text:
Sage Yoga and Wellness in Boise is amazing!  I am a yoga instructor & health and wellness coach currently living in Washington D.C. and was looking for a studio to practice at while visiting family. I stumbled up this studio and decided to do a walk in, and I was pleasantly surprised beyond words. The instructors are FANTASTIC! They are interdisciplinary and positive energy and compassion just radiates from them. The over all space is great: They have lockers, showers, and even a massage area. The practice space is cozy and warm. 

All levels of practitioners, beginners to instructors will find a wonderful practice here. Lulu Lemon show room is just a block away too. 

Sage Yoga Also offers a community class on the weekend. If you are interested in yoga try a lot of studios and find the style the resonates with you. Come with an open heart and try Sage Yoga and Wellness :)

name: The Pancake Pantry
text: For the amount of time we had to wait youd think service would be a little better. Im not complaining about the wait at all, we knew what we were getting into, but the waitress we had was imcompetant to say the least. after we sat down she took our drink order ... never to be seen again. She came back to take our food order and thank god there was water on the table. She brings the food, its wrong. She brings the check and low and behold charges us for the drinks we never received and is literally mind blown when i ask her to take them off the bill. As some one who has worked in the service industry i know what its like to work a busy shift, but come on...

name: Ava
text: Bummer! This restaurant is in a great location with nice outside seating, but the food and service was no bueno . Pizza came out cold and with burnt crust, salmon was salty, and they forgot our app.  Not worth it :/

name: Chick-fil-A
text: A terrific place to grab a quick bite to eat. Friendly, fast and reasonable prices for the quality they serve up. It the best chick-fl-a I have ever gone to. Most likely because of consistent service of their staff. The manager "Chris" is always working his tail off to make sure everything is running as normal. I must say to "Chris" thanks for all the support thru the years....you are the best. You have the cleanest, friendliest, all around best restaurant that I know is always there for our family to get a perfect meal...fast!

name: Domino's Pizza
text: My pizza was delicious and quickly delivered! Only reason I give 4 stars is because I asked for them to write a joke on the box and they didn't.

name: Tortas El Guero
text:
All I can say is.......wow! I came here because my friend told me how good the tacos were and I finally dived in and gave it a try. We pulled up and I was shocked of how small the building was. I am always looking for some type of seating or outdoor seating but this is a grab a taco and leave type of establishment. 

We walked in and immediately I knew 2 people in there lol. I was thinking oh this food must be good!!! I ordered the chicken, shrimp, and steak taco and when I say it was good... honey..... it was good lol! The tacos were seasoned well and the meat was tender. It was just perfect! 

Be careful with the sauces they throw in the bag. It is super spicy and I am not a fan of that. I love the limes and cucumbers that they give us with the tacos too. Very fresh and yummy! 

The quesadilla was EXCELLENT! Def will be back.

name: Frisco Train Store
text: This is a hidden gem for all kids that love toy trains.  They have just about every imaginable wooden train set and accessory i available for purchase.  Even better than that though, there is a LARGE, custom built wooden train layout that your kids can play with for no cost so that they can try before you buy.  the owners are super nice and always have a smile to share with you.  They frequently have special events for little or no cost.   I know our family really enjoys this unique kids adventure.

name: Hollander Hotel
text:
Hubs and I enjoyed our 4 night stay at the charismatic Hollander.  Some thoughts:

The goods:

+ The staff is great. Everyone was friendly and helpful and I felt truly welcome my entire stay
+ The location is convenient. You are right near the highway but can also walk to downtown
+ The porch/lobby/bar/pool is funky and fun.  There are always people to socialize with and the decor is very interesting (check out the grand piano frame mounted to the wall)

The could use improvement:
+ Parking is shared with the hotel next door and often has you circling looking for spots/parking in sand. It's also one-way in and out, which can be a tad annoying depending on your navigation direction
+Sound proofing of the rooms to the hallway isn't very good, so people walking by your door talking will sound like they are in your room
+Shower temperature fluctuated on us the whole weekend going from nice and hot to slightly cool

The good out-weighed the bad for me if you're looking to stay at a place with some character!

name: Han Dynasty
text:
Went here for lunch - was told that the lunch portions were 60% the size of the normal entrees and 60% of the price.  Well, these portions were SCANT - not even appetizer sized.  We got 6 shrimps!  That's almost $2 per shrimp!  Now, I've been to the Han Dynasty in Old City and what we got was probably 30% the size of their entrees.  Price-wise, both Sang Kee and Peking are closer to me and more affordable for lunch so probably I will not venture here anytime soon.  I feel like for 2 people to get full, you need either 4 lunch portions or 2 dinner entrees.

Also, we did not get the second entree until we had mostly finished the first one - thank goodness we were sharing!

That and the whole atmosphere is weird.  I understand not changing the Midatlantic decor much for cost reasons, but playing ambient electronic pop?  I'd expect that maybe for a frozen yogurt shop or some new age vegetarian restaurant, but not a Szechuan restaurant, and certainly not Han's restaurant!

The only reason this did not get a lower rating is because the food was still tasty - what little of it there was.

name: Roselena's
text:
I'm not too proud to admit that I've never had an Italian cream soda. I am however, proud to admit that my first was at Roselena's. And it was damn good. It's creamy. It's sweet. It's refreshing. It's worth trying if you're like me and didn't grow up around here eating monkey bread and 'wuder' ice 'down the shaw'.

We were out last week checking out our hood since the weather has finally opened up a bit. It was a Friday night at around 11 and Passyunk was pretty busy. Not much was open but this quaint little tea shop slash old school ice cream parlor. They had tables out on the sidewalk and everyone had a plate with half-eaten dessert of some sort left on it. We decided to stop and have a bite. 

Along with the Italian cream, we ordered the Passyunk S'more and man, it was outrageous. And aptly named! They piled up this super rich chocolate and graham crackers in what seemed like 6-7 layers. Top that off with a mound of marshmallows that they fire right at your table with a blowtorch. You basically extinguish the flames when the mallows are charred to your liking.

Not only did everything they had look tasty (we wanted everything), but I couldn't help but notice a sign that says "$1.00 coffee - any size". Sure enough, I was there at 7 the next morning for that. How can you go wrong with gourmet coffee that doesn't taste like it's been burning for hours for $1.00. That kind of thing just doesn't happen these days. I've since been there at least once a day - and sometimes twice. They've always got a great selection and it's always fresh. 

I have so many yelps to write, but this morning I went for my coffee and they had an Ethiopian Yirgacheffe which seriously made my day. So as I sit here savoring it, I felt compelled to come out and say how much I love Roselena's.

name: iDope Philly
text:
My iPhone 5 was having trouble charging. I had tried cleaning the connector myself, but the problem was getting worse and worse. 

I assumed I needed a new dock connector. I had read that the connectors were easily damaged. I call several iPhone repair places. Most quoted $60 or $70 for the repair. iDope quoted me a very fair price of $46. 

Once I arrived, the technician did a thorough cleaning of the dock connector. He pulled out all sorts of dirt and fuzz that had accumulated from a few years of living in my pants pocket. He plugged it in and voila! It was charging again!

He handed the phone back to me.  No charge!

Thank you to the honest and fair, iDope!

name: The Independent Hotel
text: I love this hotel. I would stay here agin if I came back to Philly and recommend it to anyone coming in. It has lovely hardwood floors and huge vaulted ceilings making it feel like I'm staying in the lap of luxury. Bathroom works for me. It has a microwave, fridge, and Keirug and the offer complimentary continental breakfast room service. It's also in a nice neighborhood close to lots of restaurants and bars. Noise was not an issue for me.

name: Wawa
text: Probably the cleanest Wawa I've ever been to. Fast, polite service. There is a gas station as well. Not busy here at all too! Wish Philly had one like this.

name: Gusto Osteria
text:
Gave Gusto Osteria a second try.  First experience was awful, especially the long wait to get our food from the kitchen.  This time we decided we will not be in a hurry to come back and give it a third try.  Foo foo phooey Italian food and too expense with poor value.  
Cute hostess that greeted us was very friendly, held the door, and seated us immediately.  The service was excellent this time... our dinners came out of the kitchen quickly (although the restaurant was pretty empty except for a large party of 40 for a private affair dining on the patio), our server Jordan was attentive, and the busboy had a great sense of humor and constantly came by to check on us and refill our water glasses, BUT the Alfredo sauce was the worst we've ever had (very disappointing) and the although the homemade sausage was plentiful, just okay if you like Italian sausage (not too spicy... though we would not get it again with Fettuccine Alfredo).  The Cannelloni with chicken had a better tasting sauce, very different for an entree.  BUT overall, the prices on this menu are too high for a la carte or a weekday dinner, and we ordered the least expensive pasta entrees.  Not a vegetable or a small dinner salad are served with the entrees.  No linquini with clam sauce or spaghetti with meatballs, no lasagna, no traditional Italian dishes, and most prices are $15 and up, up, up.  Olive Garden is a much better value with a larger selection of entrees and all the soup or salad you can eat, or even Zona 78 nearby is better (that is probably why they were packed and there was a 45 minute wait for a table).  And the hot bread we were served when we first sat down was just plain weird.... nothing special.  
The chef came out of the kitchen to visit with a celebrity diner (Jim Click) for a long time, and when he passed us (the only other diners in the restaurant in that area) on his way back to the kitchen, he did not even acknowledge us, or say hello, or ask if every thing was okay.  Kind of rude.

name: Dinardo's Famous Crabs
text: Yea.. So this place is terrible. I don't know when they became "famous", but it tastes like it was a long time ago. Floating objects in our drinks. Some in the original drink brought out and in the one they replaced it with. Along with lipstick on the brim of the other glass. The food was meh. Crab soup and buffalo shrimp for starters and garlic crabs for the main course. Oh and they're kind of expensive. Don't waste your money.

name: Cafe Ponte
text:
WOW. Spectacular food!! 

Hosted a large private dinner party here in their private room. Although we were only given two waiters- the food was absolutely phenomenal. Highly recommend the filet and fish dishes! Looking forward to going back.

name: Famous Sam's
text:
RAIDER NATION FOR LIFE ~~ RN4L

This location of Famous Sam's is the Die Hard Raiders Booster Club Tucson Chapter's home base and because of that simple fact, I get a tug in my heart, a tear in my eye...awww hell, I get all verklempt. Raider Nation, baby!!!

So yeah, I'm going with 4 stars because the owners basically hand this place over to Raiders fans on game day and their staff works EXTRA hard trying to keep the sea of silver and black happy and for the most part they truly do keep all the patrons happy. 

As for the food - it's fair, probably above fair. The wings are average - the "hot" isn't really hot at all. Chicken strips are fantastic - meaty, moist and BIG!! Steak fingers are just okay. The Jalapeno Bottle Caps are pretty good if you like spicy. Most places seem to use very mild jalapenos for a lot of their dishes like nachos so I was expecting to be bored with the bottle caps. WRONG. They're spicy little battered and fried sliced jalapenos. Delicious! And I've always been a fan of Famous Sam's pastrami sandwiches. It's been years since I had one and they're still as tasty as I remember them. Mmm, mmm, good. 

I must say that Famous Sam's fails in the French fry department. Despite numerous attempts, every time we order fries or they are included as part of our meal, they come to the table limp and undercooked. Recently we ordered fries with nacho cheese sauce and the fries were literally uncooked in the middle. Had to send them back after explaining the raw potato product and our server brought us a new plate. Excited to finally get the fries and dip them, L & I each took a bite and the look of disappointment appeared on our faces. They were just as bad as the first helping. We explained to our server that the fries were inedible but we did not wish to send them back again. She checked on us a few more times throughout the game for beer and water and even mentioned the uneaten fries and how she knew they were unacceptable. But when our bill came, guess what was still on there? That's right - the fries. A quick talk with the manager fixed remedied the situation and all was right with the world again. 

How could it not be? After all, the RAIDERS WON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Pia Esthetics Day Spa
text: This is my favorite Day Spa in the area. The staff is wonderful, and I am never disappointed by the services. Nayla especially always does a great job with my eyebrow waxing, getting the shape perfect every time! My eyebrows are the defining feature of my face, so I need someone who I can trust to shape them and she is the best woman for the job! Although, I have been waxed by other ladies here and they are all just as thorough and friendly. You will get taken care of here!

name: 500 Degrees
text: Two words - Truffle....fries! They are really good! A pile of skinny fries spritzed with truffle oil and salt equals awesomeness. I also enjoy their sauces. I would like to end my review there, but I guess I should write more. With the order of fries, you do get a good amount to share with friends. The basket of fries are about $4. They are also open late on weekends after the bars close. I have not yet had a burger, but my friends have had their milkshakes and they come highly recommended.

name: Jackson's Bar & Bistro - Nashville
text:
My first experience with Jackson's was back in March, when I was traveling to Nashville for the first time with a bunch of friends who were Vandy grads. They love love love Jackson's from their time in college, and therefore it was literally our first stop of the weekend -- and it was wonderful. I wasn't sure what to expect, since it was a favorite from college days -- but the food was simply delicious.

It has a low-key easy vibe inside, with art from local artists for sale, and the Bistro description is perfect to describe the food. Not heaping portions, but I was stuffed at the end of the meal, and absolutely satisfied.   We started off with martinis which were delightfully strong and full of flavor, and headed for lunch at a table shortly thereafter. Since it was a celebratory weekend, we started with appetizers, and the spinach dip, and the pigs in blankets with the amazing spicy mustard went in seconds. All very flavorful, I just wish I could have had another bite -- and take gallons of the mustard home with me.

Heading to lunch, I got the Rio Panini, and since I do love the standard thick bread one would think of for a panini, I was slightly sad to see white sandwich bread. It was a great sandwich, as were the fries, and the chips that I tasted off my friends plate. I think next time I'll go with the Rio wrap instead -- had ordering envy of my friends who went with that selection. But was in no way dissatisfied with my choice.

I was back again in Nashville this weekend, and stopped again with a large group for lunch. I expected a wait, as the bistro was packed with World Cup fans, but they easily worked with us, and found us a table quickly. Again, each person in the group constantly remarked on the quality of the food, and each had a different drink -- mine, the misery & gin -- pear cider, st. germain ginger liquor, and Tanqueray, was light and refreshing -- perfect for a hot day.  This time, I got this shrimp wrap, and the chopped salad, and ate every morsel off my plate. The shrimp had a slight kick to it, and it had so many flavors in each bite, I savored it until the very end.

I can say without a doubt that every time I'm in Nashville, I will absolutely be back for another boozy lunch at Jackson's!

name: Maria's Ristorante on Summit
text: After so many wawa soups you almost forgot how nice it is to get a real meal. The chicken escarole soup was excellent. Great cheesesteak also. The bar has good seating and a nice selection of craft beers. Prices are good also. They have a friendly staff as well.

name: Boise Bicycle Project
text: Anyone who claims to have had a bad experience here must have a chip on their shoulder or misunderstand what the BBP is. The shop is like a thrift store for bike parts, and the membership is an amazing community of volunteers working to empower people to ride and understand their bikes. Sure, sometimes things don't work perfectly--they are used (and a deal)! But help is always swift, friendly, and genuine. This is one of the institutions that makes Boise wonderful. Long may they keep patching tires and giving away bikes to kids.

name: The Bricks
text: How can you not like this place? Fresh water upon arrival followed by healthy food with a twist. The service has always been exemplary so no complaints there. This is one of the few joints in Tampa that can appease an array of crowds - hipsters love the decor, drink selections, etc.; geriatrics enjoy the healthy food portions, friendliness, etc.; and out-of-towners relish the overall uniqueness of the place. This is beyond highly recommended.

name: Cafe Con Leche
text: Cashier was very rude fat Hispanic girl at the airport location. Very very rude. Half the menu wasn't even available.

name: Steak-Out
text: just shocked best burger of my life. best steak tips.of.my life obsessed it's tye best food best delivery just wow ya you might spend $35 or 40.bucks for.4 ppl but it's better than a sit down place it's delivered it's amaizng

name: In Style Hair Studio
text: Really nice  hair salon with caring and professional staffs. My husband and my son all come here for their hair cuts and color.   Best hair salon in the area.

name: Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews
text:
I love a good burger and Red Robin makes a fairly good burger. But I have trouble giving a restaurant that serves its food in plastic baskets and charges 10-12 dollars a meal more than 3 stars. 

I ordered a burger with a special set of toppings and it came out exactly as ordered. My wife the vegetarian even was able to get a vegan burger (made by boca) with avacado and other toppings. The food was delivered almost to quickly. We were barely able to enjoy our drinks before they arrived. 

Overall we had a good experience and we just wanted something cheap and quick so it is a winner for that reason.

name: Sole II Soul
text: I did not enjoy my food here. The fish was fried so hard I couldn't eat it. My rice taste like some boil n the bag rice. I was not impressed at all.

name: Judge Bean's BBQ
text:
Always love to visit this hidden gem when in Nashville. It's a great choice for BBQ in Brentwood. 
Pretty small but tasty !!

name: La Creperie Cafe
text:
Service OK; crepes were bland, but acceptable.
The staff was observed exchanging unpleasantries, which is not a good sign.  Especially when only two tables were occupied and no stress situation was in effect.

name: Gullifty's Restaurant
text: Great place to meet outside and have some drinks with friends. Beautiful outdoor deck, lots of IPAs and beers on tap. I've been there three time, twice to celebrate my kids graduations with a large group, which were served well and seated quickly and once for dinner with my husband. Great selection of food, not a 5 star restaurant but the food was decent. A few things I noted, their wedge salad is a steal for $5.50 and very good, their salsa and chips is served with sour cream and only what I could call taco sauce. Probably the most bland "salsa" I've ever had, reminded me of the packets of taco sauce you get in a taco dinner box. Their fajitas were very good as were the burgers. Definitely best for pub type food or lots of apps/small plates to share with groups of friends.

name: Sierra Car Care - Village Service
text: I wish I could give more than five stars. These guys help you out in a jiffy. Super friendly good work.

name: Red Owl Tavern
text:
I like this place a lot. I stopped in once with friends for drinks and was eager to return for food. We finally did over the weekend. 

The ambience is very nice -- somehow ideal for both a fun date as well as for a beer and sports crowd. 

I love the open kitchen. 

Great beer selection. 

I'll definitely return for the rosemary fries, and my fiancée will return for the very good house burger.

name: Cafe Napoli Restaurant & Pizzeria
text: Nice place in a very busy shopping center.  Restaurant is fairly small.  Expect to bring home enough for a couple extra meals per entree.  The food is pretty good - not really that creative or trendy, but more traditional pasta dishes, pizzas and sandwiches.  I have been pleased with the food and the service each of the times I have eaten here.

name: Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza
text:
I love Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza, and this location lives up to the chain's standards. My friends and I decided to eat here to watch the Gators game. They have lots of indoor seating, but since it was so nice outside, we decided to sit in the open air patio. They have a bar that serves beer and wine, that has televisions on both sides to watch the game. The service is friendly and fast.

We ordered the Paul and Young Ron pizza, which has meatballs, sausage, ricotta cheese, and your choice of sweet or hot peppers. Three of us split a small pie, and we were all full.  They put HUGE portions of meat on the pizza, and it's baked to perfection. I ask for the pie to be left in a little longer because I like the crust extra crispy.

This location is quite popular, because by dinner time, the entire restaurant was packed with people. I'm a big fan of Anthony's, and we had a great dining experience here.

name: Spirit Salon & Day Spa And Mobile
text:
Booked last minute services for bridal party...hair styling, make-up, massage and nail services. The bride is a make-up maven herself and very, very particular about her hair as well. I was worried she'd walk out with a stiff newscaster look or worse but OMG - gorgeous, perfection.

Make-up was done by Kylyn - false lashes as well. She looked flawless and every wedding photo was beautiful - just took her natural beauty to the wow level and it lasted all day. Hair by Julie - we asked for a "Downton Abbey", turn of the century, romantic up-do with loose french braiding and curls - she knocked it out of the park. Other guests also had up-dos done by Julie and were equally thrilled.

Massage by Jocelyn also met with raves.

I can't believe this is the last place I called! All the independent wedding stylists, either didn't return my inquiry, were busy or wanted astronomical fees. I'm so glad they were able to fit us in.

name: Howards In Soulard
text: Above average pub grub, live music, low key neighborhood bar.  Clean, nice architectural features, nice staff.

name: Three Carrots Fountain Square
text: Had a great brunch here. Seitan on the biscuits and gravy is awesome. Probably would've been too plain without it.

name: Mammoth Espresso
text: This coffee is actually good. Properly roasted and extracted coffee. I was beginning to think this town only looked drip coffee. 5/5 beans.

name: The Saint Hotel, Autograph Collection
text:
We stayed at the hotel for one week...when we went in we were looking for the frig to put some things in.  it was missing one item and we didn't touch any of the items due to the high price...we purchased our own.  We only had maid service once, we wanted to prevent any theft.  when we were leaving we checked the frig and there were 3 more item missing.  I was charged $42.90 for drinks and things were didn't use.
The room was clean but not enough lighting.  It didn't have a coffee maker in the room but down in the lobby you could get coffee for free.  the bathroom need towel racks, it didn't have any.  
I was disappointed that I was charged because someone came in the room and drank the booze!!!!!!
We also only got one wash rag to wash with and hardly any towels.  I wouldn't stay here again....because I was charged for nothing.
Also, the TV in the elevator was on all the time, annoying.

name: Bruno's Pizza & Restaurant
text: Everything I order is perfect everytime. Pizza's are incredible, sauce is full of fresh basil.

name: Heads & Tails Beauty Boutique
text: Amazing blow out with Erin.  My hair looked amazing when I left the salon and the next morning looked just as fantastic.  Will be back again!

name: The Hideout Coffee House
text: This is exactly type of Saint-Petersburg (Russia) coffee places I miss so much here. Chill music, nice choice, no salads, only coffee and tea and small amount of bakery. Nice stuff, fast service, delicious food, stylish menu and look. Thank you!

name: The Blue Duck
text: First off, the noise level is off the charts. There is no dress code, each guy walking in came in sweat pants and flip flops. Turn off. We ordered shredded duck pappardelle and prosciutto wrapped duck breast in balsamic glaze. The duck breast was cooked perfectly and was juicy and delicious.  The sauce on the paperdellle pasta was so salty that it was as inedible.  I like salt on my food but I could not stomach this entree. It was a major disappointment after hearing glowing reviews. I will NOT be going back..

name: Sunset 44 Bistro
text: What a nice change of pace, from the likes of the Joey B's and even others in Kirkwood.  Steady as a rock, good food, and very good pours.  My last several visits have been in the somewhat more casual bar.  Still the same great food, Johanna is a refreshing delight, a real gathering place. Bob has long given the area, a fine dinning experience.  No, patio is not like J. B's and some of the other "patio centered , resturant/bars , just no space, but still nice enough. And guess what, in the dinning room , you can still hold a conversation and be heard.  Bar, well that of course is a gathering place,  Bob makes the rounds, saying hello. (find that at some of the other places)     Visit the bar/lounge, you will soon become a regular. ( oh and no I did not get paid for the review, just have always like it , we go back to the Watson road days.) oh and prices, certainly comparable to restaurant a couple of blocks south, where you cant even hear yourself think, on a busy night.

name: Khyber Pass Pub
text: i heard it was bought by puck from the real world and that's how it got ruined. then he sold it. so, now they're trying to do shows again... only upstairs. not the same. oh well.

name: 312 Pizza Company
text: It really wasnt worth the wait for me. Personally, I would rather have Little Chicagos. They have buffalo chicken on the menu but you have 2 options, dry rub, which I didn't care for because it was sweet and sriracha, which I don't like at all. No hot or mild options. We were told that it would be 45min for the deep dish. The first round of chicken came out probably about 15min before the pizza so that sucked. Our waiter wasn't that attentive. It wasn't busy. I've never been to a restaurant where the entire staff sits at a table and converse and prep and chill while they're waiting on their customers food to get ready. It was...different, but like I said, it wasn't busy. The pizza was...ok for me. Compared to where I always go, this place comes in second and it's just not worth the wait.

name: Ooka Restaurant
text:
sushi was really good. the fresh wasabi was really hot.

pretty expensive but tasty nonetheless.

name: The Little Lamb
text: The food was good, prices good and the server was really sweet. Will definitely go again. It's small inside so you feel very cozy with your neighbors. Hope to get seats at the bar next time.

name: Two Chicks Cafe
text: Food was good overall. Not sure why we had to wait 30 minutes till we got it. Took way to long.

name: Eatalia
text:
I will first start by saying that the service here is some of the best I've ever had. Friendly, knowledgable and there for anything you ask for immediately without being over bearing.
Now to the food, we started off with the antipasto, a weekend special, and it was amazing. Prosciutto, mortadella, sharp provolone, stuffed peppers and many other thing, marinated in a delicious oil, it was perfect. 
I got the porterhouse steak special next topped with Gorgonzola and an amazing steak sauce. Cooked veggies and mashed potatoes on the side, it was perfectly cooked and everything went perfect with the next thing. My girlfriend got the lasagna which had the best mozzarella cheese I've had, and the sauce was also amazing. 
We got the Tierra massou finally and that was perfect as well. 
Between the perfect food and the great service I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

name: Sandy's Tailor & Alterations
text: I first used Sandys three years ago for my wedding dress. I had the arms let out because they were a bit snug.  Great job! I have also had a zipper fixed and and pants shortened. All turned out wonderful. No problems here!

name: Mike's Ice Cream
text:
Not only is the ice cream del kilos but hey have unique yummy flavors.

I got the dipped waffle cone with three scoops: 

red velvet: tastes just like red velvet cake

Caramel cone; swirls of caramel and chunks of waffle cone 

Mocha caramel pecan: coffee ice cream with swirls of caramel and crispy pecans 

Can you tell I like caramel?! 

And yes I shared....

name: Pete's Car Wash Express LP
text: Issues at this location both times I've gone and now I'll never go back. First time they were so rough with the car it sucked off my magnetic car sticker (never ever had that happen in any other car wash). Went back to get it and they were gruff and kind of rude about returning it. Not to mention the whole car still wasn't clean after all that trouble. Went this past Fri night, had to uturn to get there and then the man saw me and put a cone in my way and waved me away!!!! After all that to get there! Others were going through car wash and vacuuming so I'm sure he just felt like closing early and now he's lost a customer for good!

name: David's Bridal
text: This is a review of this particular store, not David's Bridal as a whole. We purchased bridesmaids gowns here bc of convenience and price; but the staff in this store is blatantly rude. We've been in here three or four times - and each time was more unpleasant. If you can find another store, I would.

name: Kinsmen Sports Centre
text: Woohoo! Yes its that good, I am an avid simmer so the swimming facilities are perfect..the olympic pool is good, the issue could be during summer hours cause schools out and theres usually summer camps and such, so it can get pretty full. I have swam at other places like Millenium in the park, but Kinsmen is by far alot better. I have used the gym there also its smaller but gets the job done.

name: Preservation Hall
text:
Jazz was the best we heard in the french quarter (also went to Fritzels and Maison Bourbon). For that alone, you should go. All the players were amazing and had great flare and showmanship. The whole experience was unusual. You line up to be let into a small room that looks like it hasn't been changed/renovated in years. The place feels like it's slowly decaying. The room is so small and decayed that you feel like you're at the crossroads between a secret jam session and a private performance. It's the traditional NOLA style jazz but doesn't feel like you're marching down the street. I'm not a jazz connoisseur but I like jazz.  

There are a few seats in the front if you get there early enough. The rest of the space is standing room only. I would hate to imagine what it's like in summer humidity.

The show is only about 45 minutes so standing should be doable for most ages. Also - they let in all ages.

If you are in line in front of the Pat Obrien's sign, you are "guaranteed" to be let in.

name: 312 Pizza Company
text:
Big fan of 312!

My husband, being from Chicago, was super excited about a Chicago pizza place opening up within walking distance of our home. Upon going to 312, we happily discovered that it's not just a Chicago pizza place, but a great Chicago restaurant, bar and new neighborhood staple... Right here in Nashville.

The deep dish pizza is beyond good... The corn based crust was to die for and the sauce to cheese ratio (crazy important, promise) was perfect. Their ingredients are brought from Illinois and it shows. You can get a pizza at a price much cheaper than you'll ever find in Chicago itself. One small pizza will feed 2 people for at least 2 days. (Isn't pizza for breakfast just the best?!) 

My husband loves the Italian beef... I'm a fan of the dogs. We both love the risotto balls and mozzarella sticks for appetizers. 

The place itself is comfy, unassuming and modern. The staff is super friendly and so proud of their true to Chicago fare. 

Go and enjoy!

name: Texas Wieners
text:
I was here the other day, nice south philly gem. 
Very old school, luncheonette style. 
Got the six pack of dogs, we mixed it up. 
The works (mustard, greek sauce and onions) 
Texas Tommy (wiz and bacon) 
the Texan (hash brown, onions and peppers) 

They're served on club rolls, just enough to fill you up.
Decent prices, quality stuff.

name: Budweiser Brewery Experience
text:
BEER BEER and oh yeah BEER!

This was an impressive fun, and free tour. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly for this large site tour. We went around Christmas when everything was decorated and dolled up. They have quite the light show and people come from miles around. It's always fun seeing their horses, too.

The best part? Drink as much as you want at their bar when you're at the end of the tour (just get a DD). Not a fan of Bud? Well, it tastes far better from their tap, TRUST ME. Also, you can taste all the Euro brews, now that they were bought up by a European Brewery.

I highly recommend this to any tourists in the STL area.

name: Le Rendez-vous
text: Their food was excellent! I was surprised it was fairly empty. Tuscon, you are overlooking a gem!

name: Tom Jones Family Restaurant
text:
I stumbled upon this place many years ago while traveling for work, decided to come back with the gf since we love cheap eats and homestyle cooking.  This time around, the food was not as good as I remembered.  Don't get me wrong, nothing else will be as cheap and filling as this cash only place.  

The blue ribbon special consists of 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 sausage patties, 2 bacon strips, coffee, and juice.  All that was offered for $4!  How can you ever beat that price?!?  Sadly, the sausage were burnt, the pancakes were undercooked, and the drinks didn't come for over 10 minutes on a slow night.  I ordered the NY strip and western omelette since I was craving meat.  The steak was completely well done even though I asked for medium rare.  This didn't upset me though since you can't expect short order cooks to watch a steak that well.  The problem was how salty the sauce was that came with it, almost made it inedible.  

Come here for cheap breakfast items, which is served 24/7, but don't expect amazing meals.  You will save a lot of money by coming here, that's for sure!

name: MOXI - The Wolf Museum Of Exploration + Innovation
text:
The MOXI museum is a bright and open place in three stories for kids to explore and play right in downtown Santa Barbara. There are hands on exhibits highlighting science, art and technology with similar exhibits as other museums in Northern CA, such as the Exploratorium in SF and tech museum in San Jose but in a smaller, less in depth scale. There's a nice rooftop play area (which is really sunny) with water play and musical instrument displays, as well as, view of the Santa Ynez mountains on one side and Pacific Ocean on the other side.  There is a short, 15-20 minute movie in the theater on the second floor which runs about every 30 min (schedule is posted there). We arrived at the opening time and the kids, 5 and 8 years old, played for about 2 hours. We may have been able to stretch it out for another hour but not the whole day. 

I did find myself wishing there were plaques with blurbs explaining the science behind some of the less self explanatory exhibits. There are several guides walking around offering help but they are not always there. For example, the Mind Ball exhibit. Two guides walking around gave variable responses about what was actually being measured (one talked about alpha waves and another just said a blank mind is better). Another example, the drum on the roof. It appears that you complete the circuit with your hands with the drum beat corresponding to your heart rate. 

I would recommend a hat for the roof as it is very sunny there, as well as, snacks (no cafe or snack bar). Check out the movie schedule on the second floor at or near the beginning of your visit if think you want to watch. We tried to go towards the end of our visit and didn't know where it was located, then got there when the auditorium was full. We left without watching the movie because we didn't want to wait. We did go to Rusty's for pizza afterwards which is also kid friendly.

name: Marathon
text: I like their salads, tea, and french fries! The servers were great...I've been here a few times and I'd come back!

name: Bicycle Hospital
text:
I couldn't have asked better service than this place. I love places that still have a old bell on the door. My old bike needs big love up, but they were not trying to upsell me to anything not needed. They knew more about my 20 year old bike than I can google. I wish I could part with  Specialized for a nice new Giant.

It's small but packed with Giants in the center and many choices on the sides. Some cool Schwinns and cruisers. My kids really enjoy going one to another saying cool! They will get their new ones from this place I guarantee that.

name: Tavern
text: I really enjoyed this place. Very interesting menu, great drink selection, loved the decor/ambience and our kiwi bartender was great. I will definitely come back next time I am in town.

name: Fellini Cafe of Media
text: AMAZING food. Make sure you make a reservation for the weekends. This is a BYOB and the wait is worth it. Their pastas are sooooooooo good. I LOVE the gnocchi Fellini but I get it w/ Linguini. One plate of pasta will fill up two people w/ leftovers.

name: The Saint
text: Best bar in New Orleans.  Walking distance from the hostel we were staying in, and the coolest staff we met.  The photobooth was best, and fits approximately 12 people.  The band playing was great music.  I had no complaints.  I'll be back.

name: HipCityVeg - University City
text: One of the best sandwiches I've had anywhere!  I had the Disco Chick'n, and it was amazing - great flavor and texture in the whole sandwich. The sweet potato fries with the Sriracha aioli dipping sauce were perfect too. As an omnivore concerned about the environmental costs associated with food production, I'm always trying to be more conscious about how often I eat meat, and HipCityVeg is a great choice for lunch for anyone, not just vegans.

name: Hey Guys Comedy Club
text: I attended a comedy show on 8/12 with Johnny Behner as the headliner! This was my first time at this specific comedy club. The atmosphere was stunning with painted portraits of comedians throughout the walls. The service was excellent, and the food/drinks were not overpriced. The owner spoke to the audience, and he was gracious, humble, and hilarious! This is a gem in Southern Illinois. Johnny Behner was incredibly funny and natural. He interacted with the crowd in a sweet/charming manner. I highly recommend taking in a show at Hey Guys! It's a great venue with awesome and inspiring talent!

name: HMV Superstore
text: I really love this place. I probably go here an average two times a month for the last ten years. I like that they carry vinyl records and rare import horror flicks (even though they're a bit pricey). The only thing I hate is how they have two stations playing music within the lower floor at the same time. You stand near the jazz section and you get blasted with two different crappy songs. I hate that. Anyway, for someone that hates Top 40 and is into B-Movies this place is as good as it gets.

name: Golden Triangle
text: Great lunch specials for $6 or $7, entree soup and rice. Lots of variety for dinner with most entrees under $12. The food is excellent. Service is attentive. The restaurant is clean, modern, very pleasant. Enthusiastically recommended.

name: Gourmet Pizza Company
text: I don't know how I'd never had pizza from here before, but I don't think I'll ever have pizza anywhere else now! We ordered from Gourmet last night because it was on the UberEATS app. Without a doubt, the best pizza you will ever eat, including the gluten free options. The BLT pizza is incredible. The prices are very reasonable. A Tampa prize!!

name: The Silverspoon
text: They put the D in Delicious! Their food is a culinary delight and very savory. The food is masterfully prepared and presented. I am not from the area but I will surely recommend this restaurant to anyone and revisit them the next trip to this area.

name: Sushi Minato
text: Yummy sushi! Try the hangover and the caterpillar. Pot stickers are good too! Will be back!!

name: Tropical Isle Original
text:
I didn't spend much time in here but only to grab a road Hand Grenade. You can get it with or without ice.. I opted for ice because it was hotter than my body could handle, and was happy. You have to try one of these since they're advertised all over Bourbon.

My advice? Get 2.. but not 4 :)

name: Five Guys
text:
First of all this was my first time at any five guys burger place.  

With that said I enjoyed it very much.  When your craving a good burger this is the place.  Also the milkshakes as well I tried one.  It was a mix of Oreo and peanut butter.  It was very good as well.

Only weird thing is they didn't have ranch dip.  But they told me to go 2 places over to a pita place and they would give me some ranch.  So while they are making my burger I went over and got the ranch and came back.  

What makes guys burgers so great is they make your burger for you fresh right when you order,  no heat lamp food waiting around all day.  You order they say 7 1/2 minutes and it will be ready and it was. The burger was great I got the cheeseburger with a large fries.  Large fries was a little over kill.  I could of gotten a small and been fine or share a large with 3 people. 

Everything was great for sure trying again maybe next time a different burger.

name: American Thrift
text:
A friend took me to this place in search of pieces for a costume, and I was in awe of the selection.  Personally, I think this place is untapped by most of Philly's hipsters (due to being so far out of the way on Wolf street), and thank god for that.  Like the second mile in West Philly, which I reviewed earlier, you've got to DIG, but the finds are well worth the effort.  

They also have some really wacky housewares and toys.  It's definitely worth the trek for those in search of oddities.  In fact, that whole neighborhood is quite odd, so it's an interesting trip down there overall.

name: Surrey's Café & Juice Bar
text: Delicious! Short wait, but the food was more than worth it. Good decor, nice staff, all together a great experience.

name: The Gyro House
text: Are they closed?? Every time we stop, their sign says open but they are closed. Bummer

name: Prep & Pastry
text: Amazing service,  food, menu and people.  Bacon pastry has no rival....  Simply amazing......

name: Capitol Cellars
text: The new patio is a great addition! The breakfast is fantastic! Logan was a great host and offered great service.

name: Bagelicious - King Of Prussia
text: The vegtable cream cheese was good.. Large chunks of real crunchy vegtables, but the bagel was everything short of spectacular! Considering there are not many bagel places in the area, I guess this place will have to do.

name: Pub & Kitchen
text:
I can't even think of giving this place less than five stars. As I am terribly sad that my favorite restaurant is all the way in Philly. 
Came here for my second time last nite, on a trip to see a good friend and celebrate her engagement. I couldn't exactly remember what I had on the previous visit, but I knew that it ended in an orgasmic banana bread bread pudding... I mean come on, delicious. 

So, I knew I would be back.

This visit included: A wait of one hour (actually only 45 minutes or so) on a Saturday night around 8 pm. We got drinks at the bar, luckily snagging some stools in the packed area. You know if everyone around you is also choosing to wait the hour... it is that good. 
After a few glasses of wine, and a cosmo for me, we were led upstairs to a nice and much quieter dining room. 

I ordered a chicken skewer appetizer ($8) and my friend ordered a beautiful and delicate looking wedge salad ($9). My chicken skewer was very flavorful, and she loved her salad. 

Main courses: She ordered a lamb course ($22), which she raved about, but I wasn't brave enough to try. I got the pulled pork sandwich ($12), which was very good... slightly spicy for me- but I am a spice baby. It came with a simple side salad that I couldn't stop eating. And I ordered a side of mac and cheese with pork belly ($9). In hindsight, I wish I had ordered two or three mac and cheeses and called it a day.... it was so amazing!! 

And then as full as I was, I had to hear about the desserts. Which ended with a chocolate bread pudding with caramel sauce for me, and a passion fruit panna cotta for my friend. I believe they were each $8. I fortunately and unfortunately ate all of mine!! ha. I was extremely full.... but it was sooo worth it. 

As far as the service goes, I found all the waitresses and hosts very kind and helpful. They seemed to sincerely care if you had a good evening... and that is always appreciated. 

Now, do me a favor, add up the total that I spent (on just food!), but keep it to yourself.

name: Cask And Ale
text:
Great place to grab a cocktail or a beer. The atmosphere is very similar to Mandarin hide but smaller.

Great variety of interesting cocktails or various beers including craft beers and the drinks are creative and soooo tasty.

We decided to try out a few of their menu items. I was pleasantly surprised. I'm not to sure why but I never thought the food would be that great, maybe because of the size of Cask and Ale or maybe I just viewed it as a cocktail bar. Needless their food is really good. 

We ordered the truffle mac and cheese, who doesn't love truffle mac and cheese, also the chicken Flatbread and pork belly sliders. I'm not sure which item I liked the best, my two friends said the pork sliders but honestly I liked everything. The pork belly sliders had great flavor and a nice kick with the jalapeño , the mac. Cheese of course had the right amount of truffle flavor and a nice cheese sauce with a great topping that added a lovely  texture. The flat bread was also good, crisp, a lot of chicken and lots of flavor.

Service was just as good as the food and drinks, the bartenders were personable , very knowledgeable and the food came out at a reasonable amount of time. Cask and Ale was a winner in every area so I will definitely be back.

name: Desire Oyster Bar
text: Was good, but not great.  I thought the gumbo was too salty for my taste.  Oysters were good.  Their Desire hot sauce wasn't bad either.

name: Moto Cucina + Enoteca
text:
Wondering if some of the previous Yelp reviewers actually dined here.

On a rainy night, the valet service and coat check was greatly appreciated. We were a little early for our reservation but were immediately greeted and seated. As one of the staff filled our water glasses, he greeted those in our party having a birthday. Again as our waiter, Megan, first came to our table, she also identified our birthday companions. A very classy touch from both Moto employees. 
We began with two very good martinis. Then the burrata with beets and a pistachio pesto and an order of mussels with fennel and garbanzo beans in a lemon flavored sauce. The mussels were the best we have had in years. The accompanying bread was first rate, as well. Looking across the table, the burrata was gone. 
Next we ordered three pastas- the pappardelle, the gnochetti and the pomodoro-and the pork chop. We accompanied with brussel sprouts and the al forno potatoes.  
The chop was a beautiful plate, perfectly cooked. My pappardelle went quickly, as did the pomodoro. The gnochetti with gorgonzola and truffle oil
was tasty but too rich for my wife to complete. Both the brussel sprouts and potatoes were great versions of themselves. Our wines-the Primitivo, the Nero d'Avola and a Coppola cabernet-were all excellent. We finished with a Lemon Budino and a Chocolate Mousse Cake. Both were good but the Budino was a star way to finish our meal.
We couldn't have been more pleased with both the food and service we received. A perfect birthday occasion for the four of us.

name: Baileys' Range
text:
We are in the middle of a coast to coast road trip, and spent a long day in St. Louis with 3 small kids, so I was grateful to find this place on Yelp.  It was near our hotel, and was a perfect mix of tasty food and kid-friendly in a grown-up environment. Saw lots of couples on dates as well. 

The full-sized power salad was huge and tasty, kids' chicken strips were made from real white meat chicken (and were delicious), and the burgers were amazing. Fries and sides were creative. Service was prompt, friendly, and very welcome after a hot, exhausting day. Ice cream was home-made and creamy. 

Perfect!

name: Tony's Luke
text:
I hope this isn't what Philly Cheesesteaks are supposed to be like. It had very dry steak and the cheese whiz had very little flavor. The roll wasn't to bad but again it was what was inside that clearly was a miss for me.

I have to assume that because I am at an airport that this is probably not the best place to go for a traditional cheesesteak here.

name: Zio Pizza Palace & Grill
text: This place is next to where I work on the weekends which makes it my go to place to eat at. I love their pizza and onion rings! The staffs are very friendly and service is great too. A pizza slice is pretty big and it's affordable! Definitely looking to come back (:

name: Han Dynasty
text:
So after many dinners at Han Dynasty, I've determined that the best way to experience this restaurant is the tasting menu option. Offered to groups of 8 or larger, this fixed-price-per-person option brings out a plethora of dishes that can be highly customized to the needs/wants of the group (vegetarians, food allergies, spice preferences, etc).  Rather than deliberating between an order of noodles and entree, you can have both (and probably 6-8 other dishes besides). And don't be wary about the sharing component as the portions are large. The wait staff even kindly packaged up the portions left on the lazy Susan before the next round began. As always, they give a quick and obviously rehearsed description of the dish (cheesy but appreciated nonetheless) when they bring it to your table.

Some must haves for the tasting menu-Spicy cucumbers, cold sesame noodles, and hot sauce style *insert protein of choice here*.

Since its a popular venue, it can never hurt making a reservation.

name: London Grill
text:
the food was delicious..service great..and the place is lovely.
would highly recommend the restaurant..It was Valentine's Day..but the service and food were still perfect.

name: Fireside Lounge
text:
Cool place if anyone would wait on you.  Hung around for 15 minutes and watched the bartender and wait staff chat at the bar.  There's plenty of places to drink in the casino.

I find it strange how Peppermill prices identical food and drink items differently between establishments in the casino.

name: Potito's Italian American Pastries
text:
Sure, they make good cannoli, but the problem is.......you cannoli eat so many ;)

Lame jokes aside, I've always been impressed with this place.  Nice people. Fair prices. Delicious strawberry shortcake.  What's left to be desired???

name: Flowing Tide Pub 3
text: Probably the worst cioppino I have ever had in my life. So disappointing that I paid $16 for it

name: Osteria
text: We were pretty impressed with this place. We had the cauliflower "risotto" , grilled octopus and a margarita pizza....all of it was delicious. Our pizza took longer than it should have but our waitress was wonderful and on top of it and they gave us a free appetizer, which was so very nice but they didn't need to.  We did not have a reservation so we had to sit at the bar...it all turned out though. We will go back!

name: Blu Fig
text:
I have dined in at Blu Fig twice and carried out twice. Each time, the experience has been outstanding. Let me lay out a typical visit for you...

When you enter the restaurant, you'll be greeted by an enthusiastic and energetic staff. If you want to dine in, you'll be motioned to a table. Go up to the counter for carry out. You'll be presented with a menu full of Mediterranean treats: gyros, falafel, and hummus are just a few items. They also have delectable drinks: fruit smoothies, bubble tea, and their special fruit tea. I can attest to the bubble and fruit teas, which are made with fresh ingredients while you wait.

The food might take a while to get out to you; keep in mind, this isn't really "fast food." Your meal is made AFTER you order it, so you know the food is fresh and hot. When your food is ready, a staff member will bring it out to you or get everything packed up nice and neat so you're ready to go. They'll check on you throughout your time there, making sure you are satisfied and have everything you need.

Every item I've had at Blu Fig has been delicious. Here's a list of what I've tried:
* Hummus with Pita Bread: The best restaurant hummus I've ever had. Seriously. It's extremely smooth and flavorful, served with a drizzle of olive oil and a couple of black olives in the center. 
* Gyro meat and chicken (in pita and as a platter): Very tender and tasty. The meats are pulled from a rotating vertical spit and sliced thin. In a gyro, the meat is placed on a bed of lettuce and tomatoes, topped with a tzatziki sauce. As a platter, it is served over saffron rice pilaf with side of pita bread and seasoned chips (extra thick and crispy!) or a salad. 
* Falafel (in pita and as a platter): Crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. I have had falafel elsewhere (in Chicago) that is softer than Blu Fig's on the inside, which I prefer, but Blu Fig's falafel has a good texture--not dry and not cakey. Their falafel isn't greasy either, so it seems healthier than some others. 

I would still like to try Blu Fig's baklava and other favors of bubble tea (I've only had the mango so far). Honestly, I would stop by here every couple of weeks if I had a chance--the food and the friendly atmosphere entice me to keep coming back. And I pass it on the way home from work, so it's alway tempting!

name: Sahara Sam's Water Park
text:
I am here right now and I will tell you this. Either get here early, or don't bother trying at all. If there are no parking spots, that should be the first indication that inside is cramped AF and OVERFLOWING with people. If there is a line outside extending so far back that you could see it as you approach the entrance, I'm sorry but no. To validate what you will probably be thinking, no, it won't be worth it. There were no lockers upon entry which is understandable, but either make enough lockers so that it could accommodate the maximum capacity, or SET a maximum capacity, and when you REACH that capacity, inform visitors that tickets are sold out, or that they can hang at the arcade until people leave, at which point that line may enter. I honestly think that they just sell tickets until there are no more people to sell it to, and you'd agree if you were here right now. People are looking for seats. The pools are tremendously overcrowded. There are teenagers running around everywhere bumping up against people, and not enough lifeguards to maintain them. The toddlers area is way too small (and that's right, crowded), and there aren't enough accommodations for them when its jam-packed like this. 

Maybe I'll come back during the colder season, but I'll definitely have to make sure I plan it so that we arrive when the doors open so that we get a spot for the car, a locker, and enough time for the baby to get some rides in. It's cheaper than Kalahari's but for a reason.

name: Padaro Beach Grill
text: This place can be perfect. You have to just go for the right reasons. Family and kids this is perfect. Ocean view, burgers, drinks and place for kids to play and have fun. Where you finding that, here. But this place is not just for the Fam. Go at Sunset, get a Draft or glass of wine and ask the manager to turn on the fire pit a level up and away from the kids and kick back. Good eats, drinks, and a view to cherish with good friends. Love this place, we've been going here years. Enjoy.

name: Farmhaus Restaurant
text:
Farmhaus is everything I like in dining. First class locally sourced ingredients prepared to perfection, with the individual elements allowed to shine. This is food how it's meant to be!

 I've been to Farmhaus three times now for dinner and each and every time it's been outstanding. The ambience is classy but laid back, plenty people in suits, plenty in shorts and flip flops. 

The menu is not prepared in the classic style with appetisers and entrees but just an assortment of meals of various price. Everything I've had has been good but showstoppers like the Roasted Ozark Forest Mushroom Salad, the Farmhaus Butcher's Plate and Porchetta Bao cannot be missed. Recently they had a lemon tart with toasted marshmallow and pistachio crumble that was divine, best dessert I've eaten in St. Louis. Only downer for me is the post dinner coffee. They haven't offered espresso when I've been there and their drip is average at best.

Still, overall this is as good a meal as you'll eat in St. Louis and for a bit cheaper than the other high end offerings in the city.

name: Hellas Restaurant
text: We had lunch today at Hellas & it never disappoints..one of our favorite places for years. Tried the flaming Oopa cheese..very tasty..& the best Greek salad anywhere. Service shines with young waiters who are there when you need them. Their adjoining bakery has a wonderful baklava cheesecake that you will remember a long time.

name: Donut Drive-In
text: Best apple fritter in StL!!! Awesome prices & friendly folks. They had a very impressive selection to choose from. Next time I'm going to try a jelly donut!!!

name: Zorba's Taverna
text: Food was delish and tasty, but more importantly - service was superb! We asked if the restaurant served wine, and they told us it was BYOB. So a few minutes after sitting down, hubby and I got dressed to go out and get smthg in nearby bar - that's when owner told us he found a bottle of wine and gave it to us on the house! That was so nice, genuine and thoughtful! Excellent, cozy, yummy place for lunch, with warm hospitality -highly recommend!

name: Café Jems
text: Horrible customer service off the bat you have 3 girls who Have no idea what they are doing but are pretty nice and a women who I believe to be the boss who yells at then every time I am in there  . Prices are different every time , and food portions are for toddlers compared to the price which like stated is higher everytime I go . The soup is great and the smoothies are pretty good , but don't dare say you don't like something the "boss lady" will not be accommodating in a friendly manner . The sales floor is nice though and I have found some great buys in there with friendly cashiers .

name: Venzo's Pizza
text:
Well, since it was right next to Scoot Over, I had to give it a try. and Venzo's delivered BIG TIME at lunch.

The lunch special, offered between 11 and 3 (but at any time to students and military personnel) was a fantastic value serving up a ridiculously huge amount of food. For two bones you get a huge, New York slice of cheese and a soda, for three bones, it's two slices and a soda. For better or worse, I went in for the two slices because it was so inexpensive, and put away both of them. Lesson learned: one would have been MORE than enough, and I've got a huge appetite.

The crust was nice and thin--truly New York style. I had hoped for a bit more spice in the sauce, but it was still solidly good, not too sweet. Again, for the "dough" you've invested, the value can't be beat.

As for the ambience, well...don't go for the ambience. It's a no-frills, eat-your-slice-and-be-on-your-way joint, just like you'd expect in NYC. So if you're looking for a quick lunchtime stop that'll get you in, filled up, and out quick without hitting you in the pocket, go-go to Venzo's for a slice--New York-style. Share the two-slice lunch with a friend.

name: The Gypsy Saloon
text: Super disappointed. Ordered my food through caviar but it was not cooked well. You can tell it was rushed. It's a shame this place was one of my favorites. Clearly to go orders are not a priority.

name: Fox & Hounds Tavern
text:
This is a struggle on this one. The interior is amazing it's 5 star cozy lodge feel with nice fireplace. So much potential but really fell short...here is The Good The Bad and The Ugly.

The Good- as mention the interior is amazing, makes you want to back and relax all night long. Fish and chips was solid.

The Bad- Soooo... I have never had to eat a burger with a knife and fork... why did I have to do that you may ask? (See pic) the bun was so dry it crumbled into dust as I held it and took a bite. It was brioche bun that was way dry and appeared to have an egg wash on it which just made matters worse. I will say the burger meat, with bacon and English cheddar if eaten all at the same time was great, though burger meat by itself needed season.  

The Ugly- the coleslaw straight up had turned, it smelled like rotting vegetables in fishy water and tasted the same. I literally spit it out it was that bad.

I am sadly seeing a food quality issue here, borderline need health inspectors to visit on that coleslaw.

Also side note if they had more local craft beers other then 2-3 on draft, an extensive bourbon list this would make a killer spot for drinks and drinks only until food quality is resolved. Wishful thinking as well but would be great if this was a cigar bar as the atmosphere is prime for that.

PS- other people bitched about pricing but we felt it was very inexpensive. $51 for 2 meals, 3 drinks.

I really hope they make some of these suggested changes sooo much potential for go to spot.

name: Target
text: Minus one star for the jerk (or overly zealous employee) who swiped our cart. It had stuff in it. Luckily no personal items. But there was a one-of-a-kind clearance item we couldn't replace. Otherwise, I've got no complaints about this Target. They have some flavors of Naked juice that I haven't seen anywhere else. If not for lack of luggage space, we'd likely have snatched up some of the clearance deals we found. Still mad about that cart...

name: Starbucks
text: I give this Starbucks one star. Never has COLD BREW when I go in here! Today it was 8:56 am. Whoops! Sorry no Cold Brew. You're kidding. Girl at counter wasn't very receptive. Barely gave me my oatmeal with what I asked for and I told her light ice on iced coffee. Did not happen!

name: Padaro Beach Grill
text:
Delicious!  Not sure what the bad reviews are about, but I thought the prices were pretty decent.  You can get a plain burger (Prime) for under $6, and my California burger had roasted red peppers, red onions, and avocados on it for under $8.  Hubby got a huge Cobb salad with a ton of chicken and avocados for under $9.  Then we split an order of sweet potato fries that were HUGE, toasty, and yummy.  The kid got chicken tenders for under $5 with a side of applesauce and Horizon organic white milk in a cup.  She did not like her chicken tenders, so we ate them for her.  They were good!  More like fat chicken balls, tender and juicy inside.
