I might try again since I like the other locations.

name: Jones
text:
This is a review of Jones as an after-work cocktails and appetizer spot.

And as you can see, it's not a good review. Jones has the potential to be a hip, go-to place in the Market East area (near the federal courthouse), but it falls short. Come on Jones, give us a happy hour special at least! Let us know that you care.

Also, the atmosphere is kind of... dead. At least around 6 or so. On the flip side, this means that a large group could go, find seating at the bar, and actually hear each other talk. Silver linings, etc.

Also, I had the turkey club. "Meh." I've heard mac & cheese is good, so maybe I'll go back for that sometime.

name: Double D Lounge
text:
This place is alright. If you want fun karaoke, definitely go here. But if you're looking for a great bar where you can drink a craft beer and enjoy good pub food, this is not your spot. The pizza is meh and the beer selection is meh. Happy hour prices are awesome, though. 

Moral: if you're aching to belt out tunes ranging from Cher to Rage Against the Machine in a divey kinda bar while clutching a cheap brew, go ahead and check out Double D Lounge.

name: Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant
text: Great service! Really knowledgeable staff. The beer is awesome and so is the food. The crowd on the bar side is a little tough to get through if you need to use the bathroom. I feel like people just don't want to move because it is a sign of weakness. I still go to the bathroom OK, however, I did have to kinda push  my way through which I am not comfortable with doing. I am a lover, not a fighter. Well, unless you try to fight me ... then I am a fighter. Despite the bathroom barrier... 5 stars to this location!

name: Elevation Burger
text: It was... not good.  We got there late-ish on a Sunday, and the service was such that it was obvious nobody there cared.  Burgers were super dry and overcooked.  Fries were cold and soggy and too greasy, not to mention only half filled.  We've been wanting to try this place since moving here a year ago, and we will not be going back.

name: Luke
text: My wife and I visit New Orleans regularly, and every time we're there, we go to Lüke every day for Happy Hour. Their oysters are stellar, and at half price, I eat four dozen at a sitting. We have tried quite a few of the items on their menu, and my wife recently had their Ragout of Wild Boar and loved it. I tried it too, and it was a fantastic treat. Their Crab Bisque rocks, and it's a decent sized portion. We've also had the Flamenkuchen, which is like a flatbread pizza with bacon and onion; it's quite tasty and crispy. We've had their giant Lüke burgers and loved them too, they're fantastic, and prepared perfectly. In fact, we brought their burgers back on the plane last year, and they were delectable. They serve a bevy of beers, whiskeys, cognacs, wines and other spirits, all of high quality and drinkability. I actually drink the Mountain Valley Sparkling Water most of the time, with an occasional beer or wine, which are also half price for Happy Hour. The servers here are great, and we drew one of the same friendly waiters, Kyle P., that we had last year, for a couple of our visits this year. He was exceptional and warm, as well as genuine. The service is fast,  but not rushed, and the manner is warm and professional. The atmosphere is upscale, but not pretentious or haughty, and the dress is from business, to t-shirt-casual. The prices are not cheap, but the food is outstanding. Owner John Besh runs a tight ship, and we owe our lovely friend Marci for turning us on to their Happy Hour. Thank you Lüke for making our afternoons between 3 and 6pm in New Orleans, oyster-packed, comfort-food-filled and very enjoyable.

name: Opry Backstage Grill
text: I came here with intentions of wanting a good ok' Southern breakfast. It was more of a lunch and dinner joint. They were more than accommodating and offered to make me some eggs, bacon and Texas toast with my coffee. Long story short, I went for the wet Tennessee ribs with garlic mashed potatoes and some amazing beans! The food was delicious, in happy I stayed and the service was good ok' Southern love! Hope you enjoy your meal and the pecan pie!

name: Sicilian Pasta Kitchen South
text: We usually get takeout from here, so despite reviews saying the service was bad, it's worth doing takeout as the food is very good.

name: Beck's Cajun Cafe
text: Pretty good Cajun options in the middle of Philadelphia

name: Surrey's Café & Juice Bar
text: This place deserves a special mention.. it's not really on the heart of the city (for tourists), but it's definitely a place you should mark down for one brunch at least...shrimp n grits are hands down the best we've had in the city....the juices were fresh... and for a person who has a hard time eating Omelettes, Surrey's has converted me for sure.. the lump crab omelette with the sauce was just the cure for a dull grey rainy morning...! Word of caution-the place is always full, so make sure you get there at least 30 mins before you really want to eat, just to make sure you don't starve over the delish smells that keep on wafting out

name: Soy Bistro
text: I love this place! For one, the customer service is amazing. Second, the food is fresh and delicious. I have tried most of the menu and haven't found a single thing I don't love. The rice bowls are particularly good and the tacos are generous and flavorful. If you haven't tried Soy, I'd absolutely recommend it. You won't regret it.

name: District Donuts Sliders Brew
text: Great donuts, great atmosphere.  Very good service.  The variety is fun and ever-changing.  Never made it for the sliders or brew, but maybe next time....  They do a really nice job of utilizing social media too....

name: Danny's Baboquivari Restaurant & Lounge
text: What's more to say about this place then yassss. This is a little gem of a dive bar with movies outside, chiminea, pool tables, drink specials, great staff and the jukebox is the shit! Love this place.

name: Martin Main Line Honda
text:
After 2 verbally abusive salesMEN on the phone, asked for the manager and never got one. Too bad, bec i was interested in the car. But they know no other way to talk to women than bullying, which is clearly more important than getting my money. Such nasty men.

Update: Samantha from the internet dept (I think) called to see if she could smooth things over. She referred me to Mike Mermane. Good suggestion. I didnt wind up liking the car I went to see, but Mike was straightforward and polite. I would recommend dealing with him. Roman also went out of his way to try to be helpful. The watchword is to be very selective about which salespeople you work with, at any dealership, and definitely test them out over the phone, first.

name: Kien Giang
text:
Decent Vietnamese food considering it's in an area with a small population of Vietnamese people.

Service - first pho restaurant I've ever been to where they don't hover around you for you to order. We had to flag down the waiter. 

The spring rolls had too much basil in it and were a little on the small side. Plus the sauce was more sweet than savory. 

The pho was good I think. The broth was well balanced and flavorful. I could live in Nashville and be happy with it. Also the pho is probably on the of the most reasonably priced items. Some items are probably more difficult to make. I saw Banh hoi for more than 12 bucks. I thought that was crazy, but obviously Nashville is not a huge hub of Asian people.

name: Ted Drewes
text: The prices are a little high for ice cream that tastes about the same at the supermarket. I only got the cookie dough concrete and I will be sure to try something a bit more exotic next time to see if the ice cream is worth it's price tag.

name: Iris
text:
I had heard Iris can pour you up any number of specialty cocktails, so I was disappointed the bar did not have the ingredients for my drink of choice, the bourbon cobbler. The mixologist had a little something special up her sleeve though and poured a creative, yummy apricot bourbon substitute beverage. All in the group of seven were pleased with their cocktail selection, with the exception of the dry martini. The food, however, was a bit a let-down. 

As what I'm learning is an unfortunate theme in this town, it was a bit expensive for the quality of the meal. My eggplant lasagna was warm at best with very little flavor to it. Fortunately (or unforuntunately, depending on how you see it) I had gorged on the cheese plate(s) and was already too full to have more than a few bites. My fellow diners agreed their meals were okay but not would probably not come back and order again. 

Conclusion: I would come back for the charming ambience and creative cocktails, but not stay for dinner.

name: Queen of Sheba
text: Never before, we have eaten Ethiopian food so we cannot compare it. Before we made the order, the owner explained what the dish is. She also told how to cook them. Food had very interesting flavors. Interesting, two dishes were serve on one plate separated by vegetables. The restaurant itself is very colorful with many Ethiopian accents. Good prices, good service.

name: The Pancake Pantry
text: Arrive right at opening (early AM) for quick service without the line.  Quality breakfast, but I wouldn't stand outside for more than 10 minutes to wait for it.  I had the Tennessee Ham & Eggs with a side of Pancakes.

name: Art of Acupuncture
text: A family member highly recommended and referred me to Art of Acupuncture. When entering into Art of Acupuncture, you'll quickly notice the relaxing ambiance and welcoming office space. All the staff members in this office are pleasant. The woman who typically works the front end of the office is friendly, professional, and willing. I have met with both Dr. Emily and Dr. Brian, and I highly recommend either of these DOM professionals. Dr. Brian is genuine, truly passionate & knowledgeable about his work, and eager to work with his patients & explain the process each step of the way. Dr. Emily also shares this enthusiasm for her work and is another fantastic practitioner that I have seen in this office. Overall, I highly recommend Art of Acupuncture to anyone, whether it be those that are interested in holistic medicine for their first time, those that are very familiar with this medicine but are looking for a new office, or anyone seeking acupuncture services.

name: Ascendant Books
text: This is a great store when your looking for all your alterntive religion needs. The staff is very nice and they will help you to the best of their ability.  The selection is huge due to the size of their store.  Theres lots of room to move around and one can look at their goods without them hovering over you or bumping into people. They have a large selection of books and even some used books.  If your looking for Dryad Design staues this is the place to go.  Overall I love this place and recommend it!

name: Moto Cucina + Enoteca
text: I recently went back to Moto after a rough visit and was able to thoroughly enjoy a fantastic meal and exceptional service. We received a very warm welcome and were made to feel at home and comfortable. The manager and waiting staff ensured that we had an amazing experience with them, and really went above and beyond. To the point where our waiter helped us get a cab in the snow! I'm definitely looking forward to dining with them again!

name: Zorba's Taverna
text:
Zorba's is one of those Fairmount staples. I prefer to go there when I can get an outside table, or when I visit with a particular group of friends who also share in my sentiment of fondness. Now what the heck took me so long to experience Zorba's delivery?! Shame on me. It's the same delicious food, just in my pajamas in front of my TV. 

Having experienced a day that could only be fixed by delivery, my husband handled all of the order details. I believe he placed directly with them, as we were able to pay in cash when the delivery guy arrived. The wait time was standard- I don't recall it arriving early nor do I recall being antsy about its whereabouts. 

I'm no stranger to the Imam Baldi. I think every time I have this eggplant in red sauce soufflé, I go on the record that this dish can turn me into a vegetarian. It came with the standard sides of rice, veggies and potatoes, all separated by little dividers as to not mingle. 

We were first timers to the Skordalia. Think extra, extra whipped mashed potatoes with extra, extra garlic. Move over (already fabulous hummus), you may have just been replaced in our repertoire. Okay, I kid. We'll just get both and have leftovers.

Speaking of leftovers, we totally were able to split our order into two meals. Score!  

Love that fresh bread they put on the table? Don't worry, you get that too. 

I'll still visit their actual location, but it's really good to know that I can get my Zorba's fix in the comfort of my own home.

name: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store
text: My personal favorite restaurant. Nice atmosphere and the staff are kind and resemble intelligent human beings as well. They have a little store in the restaurant too if youre a bumpkin.

name: Indy Massage Company
text:
We did a couples massage after work on Friday.  It was a great way to start the weekend.  Alli and April are both very friendly, amicable, and obviously know their trade well.  Even at 5:30PM on a Friday (when the rest of us would be pissed if we were still at work) they were still smiling and welcoming.

The massage was very relaxing, and they make the room into a very serene setting. They made it a point at the beginning to ask good questions to determine what we were looking for from the massage as well as to discuss any areas that we may not want massaged (i.e. feet, hands, face, etc).

We opted for the Swedish massage, but I know they also offer deep tissue and a hot stone/hot room detox massage (which sounds amazing).

name: Bareburger - Midtown Village
text: I'm obsessed with Bareburger. There is literally something for everyone on the menu. When I visited, we had someone who was vegan and someone who was gluten-free, and they both found plenty of options on the menu. The have multiple veggie burger options and a very decent tap/bottled beer offering!

name: Creole Creamery
text: With flavors like Buttermilk Drop, Doberge Cake and Red Velvet, Creole Creamery is amazing. Their Cafe au Lait is my favorite. The line might look long but they move it fast. Tip: don't park in the parking lot across the street that belongs to he drugstore or you will get hassled.

name: Milk and Honey Nashville
text: Great Brunch spot !!  I ordered The Liquid Gold Juice a great mixture of Pineapple, Mango, Orange and Ginger....Mmmmm!!

name: Tastee Restaurant
text: Everything about this place is amazing the donuts are excellent and defiantly the best I have ever had.  The selection of donuts is huge they have so many things to choose from.  They have Reese peanut butter cup donuts, butterfinger donuts, m&m donuts. This place is awesome. The food is just as good as the donuts. I love the breakfast, the hot plates and kastleburgers. This place is among the few restaurants that really do made to order food at a good price and with out a long wait. I absolutely love this place.   Try the gumbo it's amazin!!!!!!

name: The Blue Duck
text: Food is amazing, wait staff is great but please do something about the noise.  The acoustics are insane and ever noise carries.  I was there this past saturday and I could hear every conversation from every table.  It made it almost impossible to talk to my wife who was directly in front of me.  Maybe look into sound baffles for the walls and ceilings.

name: Philadelphia Auto Body
text:
Great job fixing my car. Excellent work and excellent customer service. 
Staffs were friendly and approachable. Definitely highly recommend this place!!!  Great deal of discount as well! Definitely the place to go for auto body repair.

name: Save-On-Foods
text: My local supermarket of choice. I have shopped here consistently since 2000. It is a very busy store with a lot of walk in customers. Self-scan is convenient for small orders. It now carries a lot more selection of local products. The busiest shopping day of the week is generally Sundays.

name: Izenberg's Catering & Cafe
text: so we ordered brisket sandwiched from here waited forever for it to arrive and when the food came they had run our of brisket and given us roast beef instead. They never bothered to tell us that and some of the order was wrong completely. we called them and said they would remake the wrong items not the roast beef and they wanted the food back. the staff were very rude

name: Penang
text: Very busy, popular and loud.  Place is a little dingy for the prices. Not much atmosphere. $5 beers, main dishes $ 16-26.  Food was just OK. We ordered 5-6 plates of food and there was nothing I had I would want again. $16.50 "Fried chicken" ended up being a bunch of thin chicken fingers hot spicy sauce. Not good especially for the prices.  Could have gone to Mickey D's for same.  Hate that they tack on the tip for you and put a spot for an additional tip.  Not impressed. Wouldn't be missing out if didn't come back. Much rather eat at Lee how fuk around corner. Have been to much better around Chinatown. Disappointing.

name: Top Hog
text:
First of all if you carry have it on you.
No parking and no handicap parking.
Got there and was crowded and could not get on a waiting list.
I tried to ask the waitress`s and just got ignored.
And as far as the customers that were all ready there I think if i waited any longer i would have seen some nose picking.
VERY, VERY NASTY place.

name: Dorignac's Food Center
text:
I want to make clear that my review is based only on the sandwich bar (deli) at Dorignac's. I went there based upon the 4.5 star review hoping for a great little sandwich place in the Metairie side of town. The grocery store looked pretty great, but the sandwich bar on a Saturday at lunchtime was abysmal, and the worst place I've paid money to eat since moving here several weeks ago. 

The service consisted of "What do you want?" followed by the staff contuing their conversation and offering no help at all. The turkey sandwich my wife bought was shaved lettice and tomato on a plain white hamburger bun. Hardly worth the $7 we paid. My "hot sausage po boy" was some kind of pressed mass of orange meat with more shredded "lettuce".  The only redeemable thing about the whole meal was the package of cole slaw that made it edible. If you're looking for a grocery store, definitely check it out; but if you're looking for a sandwich or a po boy, pass it by. It's an amateurish half-hearted attempt.

name: Village Whiskey
text: The service was uninviting and made my group feel unwanted.  When we arrived it was towards the end of the brunch on Sunday.  The host was not friendly and gave the feeling of us being a burden to them. Once pointed to self seating and having a seat, the waitress brought waters but we were left without menus.  I went to the front to inquire about menus but the waitress has jumped in front of me after over hearing my wife ask me about the menus.  I apologized and told her we didn't know if we were suppose to get our own menus or if they would be brought to us.  She just stared not indicating anything.  I just walked back to our seats with her where she handed us the manus and then walked away again not saying anything.  After sitting for a few minutes my wife and I didn't know if we were suppose to order at the bar or with the waitress and at this point I was annoyed with the service and decided we should just leave.  I will never go here again!

name: Smokin' Out
text: My first time there today! We got the pulled pork sandwich meal with collard greens and corn on the cob. It was fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!! Will definitely be back.

name: Preservation Hall
text: Wow. Had to get that out there. This place is literally a time machine. Just off Bourbon, Hall houses the most authentic jazz experience you can find. Seated on the floor of a cozy, dimly lit room dressed in 20's decor, you're serenaded by a 5 piece old school jazz band. They will take you to church, the jazz funeral, and back. Fan yourself, sway, and sip on your whiskey in a to-go cup as the husky melancholy in the lead's voice takes you into the last century. Thanks for that NOLA.

name: Jean Madeline Aveda Institute Salon
text:
I love this place with all my heart. I have been here three or four times for haircuts, twice for brow waxing, and just had my first spa pedicure and aromatherapy massage/wrap (AMAZING, btw). I have never once had a bad experience - not with service, result, or personality.

While it's important for your time-planning to know that they do take a lot of time, I really can't see it negatively that they are thorough and precise about everything they do, and since they work calmly and happily, it's really a very relaxing atmosphere - even the waxing! I actually got a little irritated by the girl next to me having a pedicure, watching the student intently with her arms crossed. I guess she had to go, but I was like, Geez, can't you relax, this is awesome! And you know, I'm not going to complain about taking some extra time on an aromatherapy massage at ALL.

Whenever I've been there, they've seemed to strike a fairly good balance between talking to you and knowing when you just want to be switched off for a while. Which is hard to recognize - I noticed another reviewer wasn't happy the girl didn't talk to her, whereas I prefer not to have to talk much at all. 

I can really speak more to the atmosphere than the precise results, since I'm not the kind of person who gets anything fancy done, but I've always loved their work despite me sitting there going, "3 inches? Maybe? I always misjudge. What are layers again? You can blow-dry it more than one way??" Altogether awesome, I just wish they all didn't have to leave!

name: Free Will Taproom
text: This was our first time visiting the tap room. We have been at the main brewery once before where there are twice as many taps, however the selection here is just perfect. Very cool place to sip and chill...bar area, second tier and lounge with leather couches are a wonderful setting to enjoy a few beer samplings. Enjoy!

name: Peppermill Reno
text: We had the pleasure of meeting Security Officer Art Moon at the Peppermill during Hot August Nights and were more than impressed.  We briefly spoke about the car show and weather and thought him to be professional, friendly and approachable.  But more impressive was the fact that we then watched him: pick up trash, talk to many people with a large smile on his face, help get a food order to a missing customer, all while clearly scanning everything around him and without even a hint of badge-heaviness.  If this is typical of they type of security the Peppermill hires, they are to be commended.  Thanks for your service, Mr. Moon, your work ethic and cheerful disposition are something to be aspired to.

name: Polly's Big Slice
text: Huge portions at a great price.. Huge menu so everyone can order. Wonderful place. We love Polly's.

name: Gold Coffee Pancake House
text: This is a double restaurant. During the day it seems to be a brunch place and in the evening they are brazillian steak house (a la fogo de chao but cheaper). I ordered the chilaquiles for breakfast and they were really good. They came with pancakes or toast (i got the pancakes because pancakes are awesome). The decor is rustic with wood everywhere. Our server was on top of things and made sure our needs were being met. I would definitely go back.

name: El Charro Cafe
text:
Oh El Charro, you used to be a favorite of mine but the last few times the servers could never get my order right. I mean there is a big difference between corn and flour tortillas and they never gave me the ones I asked for.

However, being Cinco de Mayo, the wife and I decided to give it another try.  It was 2 for 1 Patron Margaritas ($10) and $2 Coronas.  I ordered the house margarita and the wife ordered a strawberry flavored one both of which were very good.  El Charro has always done right by their margaritas.

This time around I did not allow El Charro to mess up my order as I ordered the chicken elegante burro ($11.99).  The burro was stuffed full of chicken, avacado, bacon, onions, cheese and had chipotle ranch that added a little flavor and messiness that really made this burro. 

The wife ordered the chicken flautas ($10.99) and she was pleasantly surprised (that's what she said!).  Both of us were stuffed and happy after this Cinco de Mayo trip and El Charro definitely redeemed themselves!

name: Cafe Beignet on Bourbon Street
text: This is my first time in New Orleans and I had to come here to try their beignets. They are delicious!! Very messy with the powder but that's expected.

name: Andre Richard Salon
text: Barbaranne did a great job of cutting my hair, and making me feel comfortable. I had a GroupOn for a haircut and a Phyto deep conditioning treatment. The conditioning treatment made my hair much softer, and seems to have made a lasting improvement.

name: 500 Degrees
text: The food - fantastic. Can't knock their burgers or fries, the topping selection, the taste or quality. Everything else? I've stopped going here. The people who work there are rude, indifferent, and sullen. I've had experienced where I've waited several minutes at the register for the cashiers to stop texting or checking Facebook before they ask me for my order. It takes forever to make your food. The quantity does not match the price (I swear every order of fries gets smaller and smaller). With the hundreds of other places, dozens of them within blocks of here, to get an equally, or arguably better, burger for less, faster, and with better service, the only reason to eat here is if you have no other options.

name: Plat 99
text: Great atmosphere but service is far from being acceptable. The waitstaff hangs out at the bar talking to themselves rather than serving their customers. Hard to say I'd return when customer satisfaction is far from their goals.

name: Penn Therapy & Fitness Cherry Hill
text: Awesome practice!!!! They are like a machine, all moving parts move perfectly!! You never wait very long and doctors give you as much time as you need!!!

name: Speedy's Cantina
text: What a little neighbourhood gem! Amazing espresso drinks, friendly staff, and if you follow their tweets you can salivate over your iPhone as you read about their daily breakfast/lunch menu. Yeah it's a little as small but I've only done takeaway. Planning to eat in really isn't an option in the winter without the patio space.

name: Bliss Nails
text: This is my third experience at Bliss Nails. The first two times I got pedicures and I was happy with them. This time I got a pedi and gel nail with the chrome and I love it! Really friendly nail techs and the lady that did my pedicure was really friendly too. I'm very impressed with this salon.

name: Sam's Brick Oven Pizza
text: Sam's brick oven pizza has a great atmosphere and delicious food. I really like how I can see their brick oven pizzas cooked in front of me. All of their pizzas are good (I've tried many of them) but my favorite is the prime rib one. Their specials are always diverse and delicious as well. Great drink selection and karaoke and trivia nights are fun too!

name: Nothing Bundt Cakes
text: Everything about our experience here was top notch. You can tell everyone that works here enjoys their job and is passionate about the quality of their product. The chocolate cake was amazing, the frosting was amazing, and the gluten-free option was a crowd pleaser. Support an outstanding local business the next time you need a cake. You won't be disappointed.

name: B&B Breakfast and Lunch
text:
Highly recommend!  I liked my sandwich best of all I love that the portion wasn't OVER DONE, which can happen at various diner spots around Philadelphia We've noted since moving from another State,several months ago 
It's clean too which is nice.  Check it out definitely!

name: honeygrow
text:
I've been to both locations, here and Center City. The only difference I noticed between the two was the music at this location was obnoxiously loud, but the important thing was the food was consistent. Below is my review of the Center City location, really don't have anything different to say:

"Very hip vibe. You order either a salad or stir fry meal via a touch screen monitor (just like at wawa, for those familiar). I like to build my own, but they have several standard options to pick as well. 

My only gripe is it was a bit light on meat. You can add more meat when ordering, but I would have liked a bit more with the regular order. Speaking of which, be careful when adding veggies on the build your own, after 3 you incur a $0.35 charge. Not a huge cost, but it can add up if you don't pay attention. 

All the produce is local, which is great, but wouldn't necessarily bring me into or keep me away from a place. I just like that it is good, fresh, healthy food. Will definitely be back."

name: Jiffy Lube
text:
Just wanted an oil change. That's it. Never in my life have I paid over 70 dollars for an oil change. I can check my fluids. I can put air into my tires. I can clean my own windows and do it better. Why do I have to pay for what you call a courtesy? It's robbery. Then at the end when I said I told you I just wanted an oil change.. the kid says I have to specify as soon as I pull up that I want the VALUE oil change. You have to literally say the word value or they'll charge you for their "courtesies". 

Never going back.

name: Malvern Pizza
text:
Malvern Pizza doesn't make a traditional hand-tossed New York style pizza, but what it does make is easily the next best thing. A large pie here is closer to a medium from most places, so if you eat a lot, consider that. They have beer/cider to drink with dinner and also sell six packs to take home, something that helps them to stand out a bit. 

Their crust is the most identifiable feature of their pizza. Very crispy, but as someone who doesn't ordinarily prefer his pizza that way, still good enough to want to eat again more than once. Their dining room is nice as well. Hip place on a picturesque street in Malvern.

name: PDQ Riverview
text: I came in tonight and it was very busy but the manager had it running so smooth with a smile on his face. I noticed after the rush he went and patted the employees on the back. A little appreciation goes a long way. The food was excellent and the customer service is always amazing. I was here last week also and left my wallet and the sweet girl Elma that was wiping down tables came running out to give it to me. I can't say enough about this place I'm a forever customer.

name: Rosemary's Grill
text:
Rosemary's Grill is my favorite resaurant.  My wife and I take my Mother in law to Rosemary's Grill often for many reasons.  Their menu is extensive.  You can get Classic American food in many categories prepared fresh and delicious with great care and attention to detail that is lacking in common chain restaurants.  You can also get traditional Turkish cuisine that is the very best kebab that I ever had.  Rosemary's is a family owned business and they treat you like you are part of that family.  We are making Rosemary's our Saturday night place.  last weekend my wife and I took my. Mother in law to Rosemary's Grill for dinner.  It was even better that the time before.  I tried the Mixed grill kebab platter.  Lamb, Chicken, Adana, and gyro kebab meats, so tender and expertly spiced and grilled, along with a shepherds salad, grilled half tomatoes, rice, and of course flat bread.  The Adana kebab was particularly tender, juicy, and tasty.  I had never had Adana kebab before and will be ordering it again.  I shared a taste with my Mother in law and she loved it too!  mom in law had crab cakes and she enjoyed them very much.  My wife had the French onion soup, which she raves about and always orders.  She also had the roast turkey, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce, and corn.  She loved everything on that platter.  She commented that the gravy was especially good.  The portion sizes are huge and we love to have the left overs again at home.  I have honestly not been to a restaurant in the area that has such good quality in all there entrees, sides, salad bar, and drinks, and you have to try the rice pudding.  We have eaten a few times here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and it continues to be our very favorite place.  The waitstaff and owners make you feel right at home and are warm, welcoming, and friendly.  I can not say enough good things.  

Sent from my iPad

name: Boizao
text: I have been in many Rodizio's restaurants around the world, including tops in Brasil. Boizao is on my top list. The lamb chops are superb... Job well done!!!

name: Roundabout Grill
text: fantastic brunch today.  dishes are thoughtfully put together.  French toast was to die for.  just the right lightness in the brioche.  dads special with corned beef hash another highlight.  bloody Mary bar has pickles made by the chef and was fantastic.    the chef Steve was superfriendly.  as was our server angel.  really not a thing to improve and while the restaurant is not cheap, we got excellent value for money.

name: Edmonton Craft Beer Festival
text:
This is a really fun event for those who enjoy beer in all its forms. The drinks themselves were relatively cheap ($2-4 for a 4 oz. sample. Most were $2, some were $3, and very few were in the $4 range), however the food was really over priced ($6 for a small cup of fancy macaroni and cheese? really?). For the beer lover, however, there is a wide variety of tried and true along with the new kids on the block from local, national and international lines. Also, if you like what you tasted, you can buy it on site, with a Sobeys/Safeway liquor store right on site doing specials on the sampled brews. 

We went VIP for this event, however I don't think it's worth it. What you get: a glass mug instead of a plastic one, a beer and food class ($2 value) and a beer seminar ($2 value). If you do it all, or really value the glass mug, go for it! But for me, who just did the beer and food class, it wasn't worth it. 

My only complaint is for the venue, but for an event that size, you need the space. $16 for parking on top of your entry fee (though I guess most people would cab or Uber it there so you don't have to have a designated driver), and then you have to buy sample tickets on site. It gets quite expensive.

name: Blaze Pizza
text: Just opened so staff not fully trained. Although it was busy, and they lost my pizza it was surprisingly good. Will return when they get the kinks out. A good addition and value to Reno's marginal pizza offerings.

name: Luke
text: Amazing food and service. We walked in on Sunday afternoon and was greeted by the fantastic bartender, Steve, who helped us pick out our meal. I was excited about all the fresh seafood, unfortunately the stone crab claws were on display, but not available. We did get delicious oysters, watch out the horseradish is spicy. Had the blue crab soup also delicious and because Steve told the chef we wanted to see what the restaurant offered, he sent a complimentary gumbo that was fabulous. For our main entree we got something that was not on the menu, but Steve told us was a great dish to show off the restaurant, a pork shank with onions and potatoes and sauage and then a little hidden secret pork belly. All of it was wonderful. The skin on the pork was crispy and fatty and the meat fell off the bone and eating with the hidden pork belly made it more delicious. We will be back!

name: Aloft Philadelphia Airport
text:
Very nice for an airport hotel! Room was large and spacious, very comfortable bed, and the television was quality. The bar and outdoor area are beautiful and modern. Shuttles to and from the airport were timely, and the staff was exceptionally courteous. Perfect for a quick or extended stay! Highly recommend for travel for business as well! 

My only complaint is that I called down to the front desk many times about an issue with the toilet and there was no response. It was late at night, so I'd give them the benefit of the doubt.

name: Jack Patrick's Bar & Grill
text:
***Discriminates against disabled*** Let me start off and say if I could give this place zero stars I would... I'm a disabled Air Force combat Veteran and the guy behind the bar whom claimed he was the owner is out right discriminant. I came in with my service dog (had her lay down): then I  approached the bar, in thought of ordering a burger and a drink. I came over From the Omni Hotel which I was a guest and referred by. Upon reaching the bar and even before being seated the supposed owner rudely and with a raised voice asked if I planned to sit outside because they didn't allow dogs at all inside. I explained she was a service dog (which she was clearing marked a seizure alert dog in her vest)and that n 7o I hadn't planned on sitting outside(which the current temperature was 48 degrees). He again repeated that they didn't allow dogs at all inside. I then informed him that I did have a service dog card and also would be more than happy to share the outlined law on Service dogs along with the phone number if he wanted to call if he had questions or concerns. He than said I was being rude and for that reason he had a right to refuse service to me. However, I at no time was rude. He just out right discriminated against me as a disabled persons and refused me services. I will personally be boycotting this establishment along with my Veteran friends and encourage anyone reading this to, along with any veterans or people with disabilities. PLEASE SHARE. NO ONE DESERVES to be treated different because they are disabled  but some places like this are bullies. 
Oh there is a funky smell as well as you enter the door. ***(2017) My hopes is that they have learned the law and are treating everyone fairly with the dignity and respect deserved.

name: Marrakesh
text: Food was awesome, friendly staff, and fun for groups!

name: Bourbon & Branch
text: Cute spot. Had fish tacos and house pickles both were delicious. Had house old fashioned which was okay. Not as good as a bourbon place should be. Service was friendly

name: Morrow's
text: Although the food is great, this place gets 1 star because of the incredibly long wait and disorganization of the hostesses. There has to be a better system to get people in the door. It's just ridiculous. After over 2 hours in line,  we get to the door, just to have our name taken to be put on a list and told we have an additional hour and a half wait (ended up being less than an hour). Do better!

name: United Apparel Liquidators
text:
I went there last weekend, and walked away with a great deal on a lace skirt, a denim dress, and a beautiful long, white cotton dress.

The sales people are nice. It caught me off guard to have such cheery, nice people offering to bring me tons of stuff, since I'm used to sifting through racks of musty old clothing at Goodwill and such, but the service is certainly very... friendly. While most of the stuff is very affordable, they also have the more couture stuff, perfect for very formal events or when you have money to spend on a truly designer dress. At the least, it's fun stuff to look at.

Ultimately, I was very pleased. I find the whole process of shopping retail so frustrating, so that mostly accounts for the 4, and also the selection was more trendy that avant garde, perhaps... at the least, this place is one nice step forwards towards Nashville being a fashion-forward city.

One cute thing, heard a girl say: "I haven't seen such great clothing since I've been in Paris!"

It is that kind of a place. Rave reviews, doing a great business, friends love it, yadayada.

name: Sonrisa Old City Dental
text: I have been to so many dentists, and Sonrisa is by far the best! No judgment, awesome little tips (like which tooth to start on when you're brushing), and Dr. Velez is so warm and kind. I used to get nervous and flake out on dentist appointments, but never with Dr. Velez! If you are ashamed of your cavities, to to Sonrisa, and you will feel better!

name: Southern Candymakers
text:
I've tried a lot of various pralines around NOLA (boxed and candy shops), and I can confidently say that this place has the best pralines in town besides Leah's Pralines.  Southern Candymakers uses halves of pecans instead of crushed up pieces, and the candy part just melts in your mouth.  Good combination of brown sugars and flavor.

Wow, I need to go get some more!

name: Genoa Pizza and Grill
text: Tried this place the other day the pizza was not very good at all the place before this one was so much better all home made food with it would've stuck around

name: Bar Avalon
text: Love, love, love the new place!  We have dined at Avalon a handful of times including the Downingtown Boro one when it was open.  Chef John continues to impress, not only with the great space they now have but with his amazing menu.  We were there a couple of weeks ago without reservations during the Christmas parade when my sons and I decided to have a sit down dinner while watching the parade since it was raining out.  John and his staff were so accommodating and found us a great seats close enough to the windows to watch the parade go by.  We ordered several apps and then some basics.  Each plate was better than the next.  And our server really knew her wines.  Im making reservations for next week for my husband and I and some friends.  Cant wait to go back :)

name: European Wax Center
text:
I've left a previous post about cat before, who has since left EWC. My new wax lady is also great. But this review is on their receptionists.

I find them cold, rude, unwelcoming, and generally uninterested in anything I'm saying. Some of them are great, but it seems whenever I call into the store I'm greeted by the same girl who always makes it sound like I'm annoying her by asking a question. She actually has no warmth or friendliness at all when talking to you, and it actually pisses me of and makes me want to frequent a different wax salon. This is a service industry, so when you expect a certain kind of service and you're met with abrupt and rude service, it leaves a bad taste in your mouth. Once my package is over, I'm not sure I'll be buying another.

name: P.F. Chang's
text: PF Changs is a pretty good place for a date, but the food is nowhere near authentic Chinese and the price is up there. I do enjoy the honey chicken, but for $15 your just paying for the atmosphere of the establishment. Service was fast and friendly

name: Harry & Izzy's
text: Food was excellent! We started with the famous shrimp cocktail which was fabulous. We both ordered the surf and turf, one of the specials for the night. I had Brussels sprouts and my husband had fried green tomatoes as side and both were great. The bread pudding with bourbon poured on it sealed the meal. Highly recommend this restaurant, the service was fantastic.

name: Pikpon Thai
text:
Admittedly, I think of take out joints as less than "real" restaurants. In Pikpon's defense, they do have four tables, but it is primarily a take out. 

Pikpon has totally obliterated my feelings on take out places. Their food is excellent, not greasy and not salty. My fingers did not swell to the size of grapefruits like they do after nearly all other take outs--primarily Chinese and including pizza places.

We ordered the Chicken and Shrimp Shu Mai (steamed), Tom Yum Soup, Chicken Pad Thai, and Red Curry with Tofu. Nothing let us down. The Shu Mai was simultaneously dense and delicate, with a sauce that rivals any other dumpling sauce I've had. The Tom Yum Soup had the most potent of lemongrass, giving it an excellent Spring-like flavor. 

My partner cannot eat spicy food, so the Chicken Pad Thai was perfect. The noodles were done perfectly and the seasoning was perfect--you could really taste the crushed peanuts. We will be headed to Thailand later this year and I'm sure he will order this dish every chance he gets. 

My Tofu Red Curry was just the right level of heat, without burning your throat (or anything else)...just a nice spice in your mouth. The sauce was not really creamy, but nonetheless it could not have tasted any better. What was impressive was the firm and browned tofu. If I could make tofu like this, I'd probably make the leap to vegetarian because it was every bit as good--if not better--than any chicken dish I've ever had. What I also found best was it is not noodle based but bamboo shoots taking their place. I remarked to my partner that I could see using these as a vehicle for spaghetti gravy. So it was great to have such a tasty dish without the carb overload.

One of the reasons I consider take out subpar is because the texture changes in the take out containers. I'm unsure as to why we did not have this problem with Pikpon. I would say in my case, it could be because of the bamboo shoots replacing the noodles, but the Pad Thai had noodles and they did not become altered by the containers.

Thankfully, Pikpon is local to our residence. I can see becoming a regular visit here since the price is quite reasonable for the elevated level of their food. I had stopped eating Chinese food a while ago (mainly for health purposes), but I've missed it. Now I have a far superior alternative to that.

name: Blondie's Coffee and Wine Bar
text:
Love this place. The location is probably the best thing about it for me, not that any of you care. Calling in my lunch order and picking it up takes a grand total of about 15-20 minutes. Awesome. 

Their brunch is great, with lots of different options to choose from. My hubz loves the Bloody Mary bar...just wish it wasn't so pricey. 

Dinner options are decent--a "small plate" will usually fill me up, along with a glass or two of wine. Try their margarita flatbread--yummy!

Great ambience, always exceptionally friendly servers, and delicious food. I'd like to see the menu change up a little bit more though...or maybe I should just stop going there so much.

I'm really looking forward to some warmer weather so I can try out the patio scene!

name: P & S Ravioli
text: Every time I'm in Philly I make a point to stop here for a sub, some chicken cutlets & their famous ravioli! I suggest calling ahead to order because it can be a little bit of a wait sometimes, but I promise it's always worth it. Their Italian is out of this world and everything is fresh as could be with a perfectly baked Italian bread to complete the wonderful (and generous) meat assortment.

name: MexiPhilly Food Cart
text: Delicious chickpea burritos! I've only had the chickpea burrito and the "go go burrito" from here but the experience has always been a good one. Flavorful and filling.

name: Hickory Kitchen
text:
Returned today for lunch at 12:30.  

The small dining area was crowded, but I found a deuce in the corner nearest the work area and settled in after ordering their Apple Sausage Special.  

It arrived about 10 minutes later, a small, but tasty Apple Pork Sausage with Maple Chipotle BBQ Sauce, Grilled Onions, and a boatload of fries.  While it was a very good lunch, a couple of observations need be made.  First, the roll of a potato hot dog roll, which was not as good as a crusty French or Italian alternative would have been.  Second, there were a lot more fries than sausage.  They were good fries, but made the sandwich seem even smaller by comparison. 

Still, I liked the ambiance, service, and overall brightness of the place, and did not mind that they made some presentation decisions that detracted from what could have been an exceptional lunch.  

Certainly worth many returns.

name: El Camino Real
text:
They would have gotten 5 stars if it weren't for the margaritas

Seriously this place is BOMB.

I've been here a few times now and tried a bunch of different things. A MUST GET is the Veggie Wings appetizer. I'm not a vegetarian, but SHIT these things will rock your world. It's seitan and it's just a little crispy, awesome wing sauce and your choice of blue cheese or ranch.

The pickle chips (fried pickles) -- awesome as well! They come with this spicy mayo dipping sauce. And they're so so worth it. 

The menu is split up into texas-style and mexican-style. I've had stuff from both sides. Pretty much can't go wrong.

The tacos were delicious. I had the carnitas (YUM), my friend had the vegetarian cactus and sweet potato (she said they were amazing).

The service is awesome. They're friendly and fast without being pushy. Great people watching.

The only bad thing are the margaritas. Not sure what it is about them, but not my favorite. But definitely not a deal breaker, next time I'll just get a beer!!

name: Sierra Car Wash
text:
Metro car wash is The only automated or drive-thru car wash ill use. I've been here many of times with a wide array of vehicles and never had any issues. 

Personally I park and wipe down my vehicle immediately after exiting the dryer portion of the wash. The dryer actually does a really good job but I don't like having any water spots on my vehicles after I wash them. 

After my OCD is satisfied, I use the free vacuum and if time permits and there is no one else waiting for my spot, I'll do a quick detail of the inside. Other times my detail time is cut short by some derelict next to me that thinks the whole block needs to hear their music. Other than that this place is pretty awesome. 

If times were better I'd probably have Mr. Magic wash my vehicles every time but hey, it is what it is.

name: Lee Roy Selmon's
text:
We went here on a whim and the service was really great, my food was really good, but the rest my party was not too thrilled with their meals. For reference, I got the Twisted Southern Chicken. The chicken was perfectly cooked, the corn and potatoes were really great.

Two people in my party got the Short Rib Mac N Cheese and it wasn't really what we pictured when brought out to the table and the feedback was that it was really greasy and neither of them finished their meals, which says a lot, since they're both guys and finish everything. I can't even remember what the dish was that we ordered, but the same thing was said about that. Too greasy and it wasn't finished. 

Personally, I would give it a shot again, but I don't think anyone else would.

name: Corks n' Crowns
text:
This is not a winery but don't let that put you off. It's a better wine tasting experience than a lot of the places in the funk zone.

It was very lively inside which made for a great atmosphere.

It was our servers first day but she did a very good job of serving us and giving us info on what we were drinking. Everything we drank was good!

The only odd thing was the fire in the corner which was on for some reason, in May. I'm sure it's useful in the cooler months but it was a little too hot for me.

name: Brownies Pub
text:
Gotta love the dive bar scene! This was the second stop of our fateful Old City bar crawl and it was a pile of fun.

There's not too much space downstairs and smoking is permitted, so keep those things in mind if you're with a big group. The bartenders were friendly though--they even gave our group a bunch of yummy cookies that were leftover from a party earlier.

The upstairs is great. Complete with a jukebox and pool table, it's guaranteed to be a riot. Our group was the only one who discovered the second floor, so we had it all to ourselves. Much fun! 

My biggest complaint is the price. For a dive bar, they sure know how to rob you dry. Our round of vodka shots was comparable to what you might expect in Rittenhouse Square. Not cool. But if you stick with beer, it's not too terrible.

All in all, I suggest coming here if you're already tipsy. It's pretty rough around the edges, but who doesn't love a classic Irish Pub?

name: Stefano Greek Italian Restaurant
text: This is my second bad experience in a row at Stefano's. Tonight, I waited over 45 minutes for a call-in order they said would take 15 minutes. Then they were out of Greek dressing and told me they'd "been out for a while" - how does a Greek Italian restaurant run out of Greek dressing?

name: Village Pub & Beer Garden
text: First time in Nashville, our group stopped here for lunch. great experience! They are knowledgeable with what beers that have to offer & what you are looking for. The food was served hot & fresh! Hopefully we will return before our visit here is over.

name: CD Roma Restaurant
text:
Awesome lunch!!!!! I haven't been here since they moved from their old location--- I've been missing out!

Walked in and were seated promptly by a sweet girl. Ordered water and breadsticks with marinara sauce. Bread was fresh and piping hot!!! Their menu is huge and meets all price points. 

Ordered kids cheese pizza (kids eat free Wednesday nights)- pizza looked AMAZING and my daughter loved it! It was huge for a kids menu item. Perk for having leftovers another day. 

I ordered their steak and cheese sandwich- it was huge and delicious. Served with a side of pasta. I was full after eating the sandwich and brought the pasta home for leftovers. 

My mom ordered the Italian stallion sandwich- which she raved about and was also huge. She ate half and brought home half with her side pasta. 

Our server was really nice and prompt with refills and service. I can't wait to come back and try more off their menu!!!

name: Culver's
text: This culvers is always busy, and hasn't gotten an order wrong yet. Its pretty good, like the same as any other good culvers. The service is nice too, I think they might leave their cheese curds out too long- not always fresh. But I'd reccommend.

name: Mystickal Tymes
text:
I was lucky to find Eric at Mystickal Tymes!  I had inherited some loose twin pearls from my grandmother and didn't know what to do with them.  I brought them to Eric to see what he thought. Eric did a design on the fly and I was amazed at what he came up with.  He then sent the pearls and his design to a very talented jewelry maker/silversmith/amazing artisan and I could not be more thrilled and pleased with the end result!  If you have broken family heirloom jewelry or jut loose stones you don't know what to do with, I offer you some good advice when I say you should stop by Mystickal Tymes and let Eric take a look.  It's a guarantee he will come up with something beautiful.  FYI:  My profile pic is of the two pieces of jewelry made.  A gorgeous ring and a fabulous matching pendant!

Great shop.  Great Atmosphere.  Don't miss this place if you are going to be in New Hope, PA.  Best shop for spiritual needs I've ever found and I've lived all over.  Eric knows his stuff, is friendly and very down-to-earth.

name: Meun Fan Thai Cafe
text: The people here are very friendly, pleasant and polite.  Food always very hot and good quality.  Fast and efficient service too.

name: Mena's Palace
text: Great breakfast and the friendliness of the staff was spectacular. Thanks !  it. We always make this quaint location one of our many stops when we visit The French  Quarter!

name: The Blind Tiger Cafe - Ybor City
text: We had just come from a terrible experience at El Molino down the street, and saw this place and decided to take a chance on them, and boy am I glad we did! Very professional and friendly, dressed to the nines (they had some sort of news team recording while we were there), these peeps know 3rd wave coffee! I had a perfect cappuccino, and delightful convo with the dapper dude at the bar. Probably the best coffee experience we had in Tampa, highly recommended!

name: 21st Amendment at La Louisiane
text: The cocktails were delicious and a great atmosphere!  The music was alright.  Definitely worth checking out again!

name: Sabrina's West Street Kitchen
text: The ambiance is pleasant, welcoming, and clean. Sabrina's is a stylized balanced blend of modern and eclectic decor. The service is timely and inviting. Hands down a must stop for delicious food on any road trip or just a hungry night out. Definitely meets up to the 5 Star rating!

name: Taqueria Guerrero
text: Amazing tacos. Chimichanga. Menudo. Green sauce. Everything was so delish!!! And horchata so good!

name: Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen
text:
I can't even count how many times I've been to Cheddar's, butI don't think I've ever been disappointed once.  

Sometimes, the place is pretty busy, but its understandable.  You really get the bang for your buck here.  

Good food.  Huge portion sizes.  Super decent prices. Friendly wait staff.  

Some of my favorites are:
Buffalo Chicken Wrappers
Asian Shrimp Salad
Apples &Yogurt
Honey-Butter Crossaints!

name: District Donuts Sliders Brew
text: Great coffee, great donuts, great place. There was a line the whole time we were there which is a good sign.

name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
text: I once went to this Gavi and it was fine.  Second time though it was mostly empty, sat down, waited 15 minutes without service and left.  Haven't been going back and have been telling everyone I know not to go there.

name: Three Muses
text:
Had the best time at 3 muses! Made a reservation (highly recommended as this place is small and BUSY). When we got there, our table was almost ready so the hostess asked us to wait at the bar. We got a drink while we were waiting and the bartender happily transferred our tab to our table. They had a specialty house drink which my boyfriend and I both tried, it wasn't my taste but he loved it. There was a band playing that night, and our table was close by. The band was wonderful, played excellent jazz!
The food is served tapas style so it comes out as it's ready. We started with the fries, topped with feta cheese which were perfectly crispy and delicious. We got the bulgogi rice bowl which was flavorful but could have had a little more meat and vegetables to go with the rice. We were still hungry so we got an order of the mac & cheese and the bruschetta which were both phenomenal, I recommend getting each. After my house drink I had one of the beers, the fire ant, which was delicious. At the end of our meal the hostess came by to ask us if we minded moving to the sidebar table as they were behind on the reservations. It was a little offputting to be asked to move after spending $80 on a meal, but I understood and we happily moved. I read reviews that the servicehere was lacking and the bartenders were rude, but this was not our experience. The server was attentive, and the bartender was extremely friendly and helpful in ordering and was happy to transfer our tab for us. We will happily be back on our next visit to New Orleans!!

name: Topa Topa Brewing Company
text: Topa Topa is a cool bar located in an old converted car garage. The space is very spacious with tons of tables and plenty seating around the bar. Delicious beers on tap which you can purchase by the pint or growler. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Food is also available for order in the hallway to the right. Stop in for a refreshing brew!

name: Johnson's Corner Farm
text: Picked up some brownies and pecan pie around 5:30 yesterday.  It would be a good idea for the management to taste these items at this time of day.  The brownies were blah and stale.  And guys, you have got to have a better recipe for pecan pie!  The pie was below average and we didn't get much bang for our buck.  We brought these desserts to our relatives for dinner and now wish we hadn't.  Love a lot about Johnson's Corner Farm.  The desserts do not match up.

name: The Burg Diner
text: Great breakfast, will be back! Very friendly staff and owner very welcoming. Lots of variety on the menu as well.

name: Wok On the Wild Side
text: The customer service here is TERRIBLE. The lady working the front acted irritated and ignored my questions about the menu. She was on her phone the entire time and never once looked at me in the eyes. I was severely irritated and wanted to leave but since this is the only Chinese place in IV I was stuck. Even if the food is good most likely will not be back. She offered absolutely no help, would not recommend her at all !!!

name: The Garden Brunch Cafe
text: What a great find! Well worth the wait. Small home turned into restaurant. Service was excellent! Everyone was so friendly and just a great casual atmosphere. Servers yell out "OPA!" everytime they pop a champagne cork. Food was delicious. Was in town for an event and would definitely go back!!

name: Escape
text: This is the BEST place ever! Super helpful and nice people. The atmosphere really enhances the workout. Not for one second did I feel out of place or embarrassed at my level of fitness. LOVE these people

name: Lisa Nails & Spa
text: I came here today after purchasing a groupon for a gel manicure & a pedicure. I'm glad I got it because I didn't know about this salon. I had a great experience and plan on going back. I would recommend to anyone. Great prices and my nails look beautiful.  Thanks!

name: Jones
text:
In my opinion, you cannot go wrong with good comfort food and Jones delivers.

I have been to Jones twice for dinner.  The most recent occasion was a Friday evening for my dad's birthday before seeing a play at the nearby Walnut Street Theater.  It was early-ish for a Friday (around 6pm) so we were seated right away.  I really like the atmosphere in Jones.  It's very open and the decor is fun, yet soothing.  I love the fireplaces.

My dad picked the wine so I've never looked at the list, but what he chose was good.  We ordered the pierogies as an appetizer and for my meal I had the Texas BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich.  Dessert was the peanut butter pie with some of the excellent homemade ice cream on the side.  I don't remember what my parents ordered but everything was delicious and everyone was happy with their meals.  Good sized portions although the app only came with four pierogies which wasn't enough for three people...but maybe that's just me because I love pierogies and could have finished the entire plate myself...

Our service was excellent.  She was very friendly and knowledgeable and helpful in making choices.

It's a pretty casual restaurant.  I'm sure on weekend evening especially you will see most patrons dressed nicely but my first time dining here was before a Phillies game in jeans and a sweatshirt and I didn't feel uncomfortable.  I would definitely recommend everyone gives Jones a try.

name: Seminole Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Tampa
text: Lots of slots, you have to pay to park, the cocktail waitresses aren't cute, drinks take forever, and everyone smokes in there..... I'd still go back though

name: Frost Gelato
text:
Best gelato we have ever had. The staff is always friendly and courteous. Very creative and delicious combo of ingredients. They have flavor combo you will not get anywhere else, never had a flavor that was not perfection.
The bubble gum has hard gum balls I would caution for kids. The dark chocolate is to die for, combined with a fruit of your liking it was just amazing.

name: PureBread Deli
text: Super reliable spot for breakfast or lunch. Sandwiches are fresh and all their muffins are baked fresh daily on site. Can't complain.

name: BK Tacos
text: Just returned from a visit to Tucson and had a delightful dinner at BK Tacos. The Carne Asada tacos were excellent. The meat well prepared with a great selection of toppings available. Service was excellent as well. I would highly recommend a visit if you are in the area.

name: Short Hills Restaurant & Deli
text:
The restaurant is handicapped friendly. Bless them.  

We love it here!  Breakfast is the best!  They have weekday specials.   The soup bowls are gigantic!  

One thing you should know:  The deli doesn't open for business until 8:00 a.m.   I keep forgetting and getting there too early.  It is one of the few non-Chinese restaurants open for Christmas.   Business was brisk, but well-managed on the holiday.

name: The Children's Museum of Indianapolis
text: After several years of membership, this place never ceases to amaze. My family of 3 makes frequent visits throughout the year from North-Central Indiana. We always enjoy the planetarium, carousel, and the current exhibits. This past weekend, we made it to the Black Hat Bash, which is the grand opening of the Haunted House and sponsor gala. Great food, drinks, and fun the entire night. Can't wait for next years!

name: Koizi
text: The food/price  is pretty decent. The service on the other hand is ridiculous. I have been in 3 times, and each time I find myself completely annoyed by the immature "playing" that goes on with the entire staff. It's obnoxious, and definitely not someplace to come to enjoy a nice dinner. There are less childish activities at Chuck E. Cheese. Twice now, I have received food before receiving my drink because no one is here to "work." This place will not last.

name: Hampton Inn & Suites New Orleans Downtown
text:
Not much to add to the other reviews; they're accurate (heck, that's why I stayed here)!  A few additional things to mention...

No, they didn't award Bill F. a pack of M&Ms and a water bottle to apologize for not having the room ready on check-in.  My room WAS ready when I arrived, and it included a Snickers bar and a water bottle.

The room had more power outlets than any hotel room that I've ever stayed in.  Truly an amazing thing; if you've read any of my other hotel reviews, you'll note that I'm frequently griping about such things.  My six-outlet power strip (which I *always* carry with me on trips) never came out of my suitcase while I was here.  Wow.

Parking is costly.  I don't have my bill in front of me, but I believe it was about $25 or $26 a day.  But that's "the going rate" for any hotel in this part of town, so I mention it only to forewarn you, not as a complaint.  It's 100% valet parking, not self-parking, because they use another building's parking garage half a block away.

name: Taco Bell
text:
This is the worst Taco Bell there is, and sadly, the only one open past 10, and sometimes 9 depending on how the others feel that day. I guess it's just a Nevada thing, or a Reno thing, but the Taco Bell's here are a joke and this is the worst. Been sitting in the drive-thru for 10 minutes only to be told the item I wanted isn't offered anymore, even though commercials are still playing for it. They've forgotten our food more than once, and I personally won't eat here (wife is the hopeful for it because she loves Taco Bell) because it's given us both food poisoning.

Go to Del Taco, same food poisoning, but you'll actually get your food in a timely manner, probably.

name: Penca
text: Really unique menu, the food and service is fantastic. Make sure you make a reservation before showing up though, waited about an hour and a half to be seated. Overall great experience!!

name: Federal Donuts
text: I mean this in the most positive and reverent way when I say that some day at my funeral, the words that will be spoken in hushed tones by everyone, will be ," spicy peanut chocolate donut".

name: Alston Stucco
text:
We've had NO LEAKS in our bedroom after several heavy rain storms since Alston stucco repaired our chimney & roof.
My husband and I give a 5 out of 5 star rating to Zach and his team at Alston stucco. Simply put, he did exactly what he said he was going to do. He called to confirm our initial appointment, gave an honest assessment of our roof and chimney condition, and got the job done the next day at a reasonable price.

He also provided some preventative maintenance advice for areas around the exterior of our house. 

If we need any stucco work in the future we will contact him again for sure. Thanks again for outstanding service.

name: Top Shop Automotive
text: I went there today to get my headlight fixed. I came in near closing time, but the staff was friendly and very willing to help. Everyone was very helpful and I was done in 20 minutes. It was a very positive experience and I was really happy after I left. I reallly recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Bank of America Financial Center
text:
Easy in and out, tellers are great. Generally, don't have a problem with them talking endlessly to customers while there is a line. But sometimes the customer is not prepared or they want attention and they try to stand there and chat even when there are people waiting to do business. Lori is great and I enjoy doing business with her. She has been excellent in helping me close my mothers estate account. She gets MORE than FIVE STARS.
But be aware that most things other than taking money our or putting money in the bank require an appointment. Many times I have walked in thinking it was something simple just to find out I need and appointment and appointments get double booked.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
text: This location is absolutely filthy dirty. The food is cold and the employees are extremely rude. I I don't know why people continue to come here and how they can stay open in this condition.

name: Ferrel's Chiropractic
text: I am an amateur athlete. I first met Dr. Ferrel when I was playing softball. He was watching my game when I was severely injured.  He treated me on the field by relocating my ankle and then told me to come to his office for treatment. I told him I could not afford that as a single mom on a teacher's salary. Instead, I saw a physician. He said it would be months before I would play again. Depressed and without much hope, I reached out to Dr. Ferrel again. He did treat me as he promised. Not only did he treat me, he healed me within weeks instead of months. Over the years Dr. Ferrel has worked on me with amazing results each time. He will always be my hero...

name: Luke
text: Best fried oysters ever. And best brussel sprouts ever. Hands down. No question. We wanted to get more food but weren't starving so we decided on fried oyster salad which came with a generous amount of oysters and were perfectly fried and with a perfect texture! The shrimp and grits was also just perfect and the brussel sprouts....I need that recipe- some magical honey balsamic vinaigrette w almonds and cheese on top. Will need to go back again whenever we're back in New Orleans.

name: Om Eyebrows
text: Found this place on my way to the dollar store and boy was I happy to find this place!!!! The wait wasn't long, three people ahead of me. I threaded my eyebrows and upper lip both which took no time at all, considering my eyebrows were a mess. I gave complete trust to the women threading my brows and she delivered 10/10 would recommend!

name: Surya Namaskar Yoga & Massage
text: I booked a massage here with a coupon . When I got there, it didn't even appear anyone was there. No one was in the building except a male massage therapist. I filled out the paperwork indicating I was having shoulder problems. At no time during the massage did the therapist do anything for my shoulders. It was only a back massage, and was the worst massage I've ever had. Would not go back there, or recommend. I've had better massages from students at massage schools. On a positive note, the place was clean, in the therapist didn't talk all thru the massage. That's the best I can say for it.

name: Home Wine Kitchen
text:
Three Dog Night had a popular song that hit number 1 on the charts in the 70's. It was appropriately called "One". In the lyrics, it stated, "One is the loneliest number that you'll ever do". That may be true in love, but when it comes to dining sometimes you just want to dine alone.  If you do, avoid HWK. 

Not once, but twice I have been turned  away when wanting to dine here as a single person. The first time when I called to make a reservation, the young lady who answered informed me they preferred not to sit single diners at tables and that I'd have to eat at the bar.  At first I was content with that arrangement, but then she continued to tell me that  those eating at the bar can not select from the entire menu. At that point, I decided not to make the reservation.  I wanted the true HWK experience. After all the reviews have been amazing. 

The second time, I stopped in for early lunch while shopping the main drag in Maplewood.  Once again, I was told I'd have to sit at the bar and order from a "limited menu". When I asked if I could be seated at one of the hightops in the window, she told me she needed to save those for parties of two. The kicker came when I asked if they were already reserved and she said, "no".  I ate else where that day. 

What I do not understand, is why can I go to Chicago dine at such top restaurants such as; Girl and the Goat, RL, The Pump Room, Table Fifty-Two, The Purple Pig, Frontera Grill and The Publican and be welcomed with open arms. Many of the chefs at these restaurants have been on Top Chef and published cookbooks.  How is it that their establishments are welcoming to the lone diner, yet a small Maplewood restaurant is not?

I understand they have a small space, but if you are going to sit single diners at the bar, let them order from the entire menu. Before posting, I shared this review with other friends who are single diners and being women, they said for them they would not feel comfortable eating at the bar and would not eat here if a table was not an option. 

Disclaimer: I did dine here as a couple opening week and was not impressed. I contributed that to opening week jitters and wanted to give them another chance. It is a shame that I have not had that opportunity.

name: Advanced Urgent Care
text:
I can't stress enough NEVER GO TO ADVANCED URGENT CARE. 

Over a year after I was seen there, I received a bill.  I called my insurance company and they have no record of any claims being filed and they only accept claims within 365 days from the visit. 

I tried calling the number on the bill to straighten this out and it goes directly to "you've reached the automated voicemail box of Advanced Urgent Care. This mailbox is full. Please hang up." so you can't even talk to a person OR leave a message.

I worked with my insurance company and this is now taken care of, but I can't stress enough the stress I went through.

name: Cafe Soleil
text: Very friendly atmosphere and excellent food and service. The Claude sandwich is my favorite.

name: Samurai Sushi
text: Hands down the BEST sushi in town. Mr. Choo makes you feel like a star and the sushi is out of this world real. Try the volcano, Iron Miss, or Yum Yum. I can't decide what is better. Give this hole in the wall a chance and you will NOT be disappointed. I will be back time and again.

name: Santa Barbara Shellfish Company
text:
(only a three star review because we were only able to try the crab cakes and the clam chowder, so it's not fair to give this place too high or too low of a mark)

quickly:
Crab cakes - tender and crumbly. They don't taste like "crab" which is what I prefer. The crab cakes come with a side of gianormos onion rings (i loved those).

clam chowder - pretty standard. it didn't blow your mind, but it also wasn't too "fishy" which can happen with clam chowder.

We saw everyone ordering crab and lobster, and we just salivated at the thought - we had dinner plans later that day so we couldn't try any of the big shellfish items. They definitely looked delicious!

some notes: 
-The indoor seating is limited. It's a small "shack" at the end of the pier. It was cold and windy the day we were there (yeah, can you believe it?) so there was more of a wait to sit inside.
- not good for big groups indoors
-parking is free with validation

name: Italian Kitchen & Cafe
text: This place is authentic Italian. It's just the right size and isn't loud inside. Waiter was fantastic. Very enjoyable to dine here. Food is fabulous.

name: Mellow Mushroom
text: Yuuuuuummmmmmm!!!! Want to actually enjoy your pizza night? Order from Mellow Mushroom! Staff is prompt and informative, menu has a ton of variety. Huge beer selection too!!

name: Lee's Famous Recipe
text: This use to be one of my favorite places for livers & gizzards, But now their food is too too too salty. It's like are you trying to give people high blood pressure with all that salt. Maybe corporate can initiate some changes.

name: The ScyFli Smoke Shop and Glass Gallery
text: I've stopped here a few times for papers and small stuff. Their location is convenient, but the staff is rude and the items are very over priced. I go to Frolic for any substantial purchases, it's worth the extra drive.

name: Heads & Tails Beauty Boutique
text: I learned about Heads & Tails from a friend who went there for a bikini wax and raved about it.  Naturally, I decided to check it out and had a great experience.  The boutique is cute, simple, and clean.  The prices are unbeatable and Jenne did a great job!  I will definitely be back for all of my waxing needs!  Definitely check this place out!

name: Biggest Little Baby
text: Love love LOVE this place!!  We moved to the area from out of state shortly before I got pregnant, so I was really hoping to meet some other local pregnant women.  I've been doing the prenatal yoga classes and they are amazing!  Abby is a fabulous instructor, and all the women who work at the facility are really friendly and helpful.  I felt welcome the second I walked in the door.  I've also been taking their Lamaze birthing class which has been great.  Rachel teaches with a perfect mix of "natural" but also giving us a lot of useful medical knowledge.  I've been able to meet a lot of other great pregnant women throughout these experiences and I'm so grateful!

name: Edley's Bar-B-Que - 12 South
text: I pick Edley's over any BBQ place in Nashville. No it's not like Kansas and no it's not like Texas but it's to me the best Nashville offers on the BBQ side. Even though ribs ribs ribs the brisket is everything. A tips:  the brisket usually sells out after the 12 noon rush.

name: Livery - Indianapolis
text: I would say that Livery is one of my favorite top 5 restaurants in Indianapolis. The decor, the food, the atmosphere, the service, all top notch. I haven't had anything I didn't like here. I would say their Pork Pastor is one of my favorites, along with the Red Drum. You can't go wrong with any of their sides or desserts. Always leave room for their dessert! The flavor of all the food leaves your mouth full of flavor. I love their patio. Their drinks are good as well, and you don't feel bad spending money on them because they all are made well.

name: Sushi Bar
text: This is my favorite Sushi restaurant in Indy. I frequent here too much to admit, but its always good. Try the Tiger Roll!

name: Stargate Diner
text: Favorite diner in the whole world, and I'm from NJ, where you can throw a rock in any direction and hit a diner. Their pasta sauce is awesome, the fries ate perfectly crispy, the food is made quickly, and the staff is frienfly. The manager remembers everyone's name the next time they come in...not sure how he does it...I can't remember his name, kinda ironic. When I place orders on the phone I call in as "Mr. Awesome" (nickname given to me by nieces and nephews, not self-appointed), and they don't question it. Love this diner!

name: HipCityVeg - University City
