text: Ok so I lied. There is no falafel here. Went back and got the ziggy burger (eh), crispy chick'n sandwhich (amazing!), quinoa chili (yum), udon salad (eh), and sweet potato fries (pretty good). It's nice to have the option of a vegetarian fast food place because who knows what some of those places put in the mean.

name: The Skin Studio
text: I was really happy to find this place on Yelp and discover that it measured it up.  Christine is sweet as pie and really seems to be extremely knowledgeable about skin care.  I'd recommend it to others.

name: First Watch
text: First visit for breakfast. Location is convenient in a small strip mall with Trader Joe's and Starbucks.  Place is clean and servers are friendly. I ordered bacon avocado omelet which came with toast and a side of potatoes. It was ok but I expected more for the price. I also had coffee and creams were prepackaged. I am used to real cream. Overall it was your average breakfast and prices were ok. I am giving 4 stars mainly for location and service.

name: Harbor Seafood & Oyster Bar
text:
There should be a law that every visitor to NOLA who rents a car needs to make Harbor Seafood their first stop after leaving the airport.

This is a locals' favorite that serves outstanding seafood. Boiled crawfish -- amazing. Twist, suck, and pinch. Yeah you right!

Fried stuff is fantastic. We got fried pickles and fried calamari. You think fried calamari tastes like rubber? You'll change your mind here.

And not only is the food great, but the prices are sick. The crawfish were $2.99/lb. The specials board had mouthwatering complete dinners for $10.95.

For beer drinkers, they have interesting loca brews like Abita Satsuma (which I didn't find out about until we had finished our meal, goddamnit).

Just go!

name: Pep Boys
text: Scheduled an oil change on line. Chose the special they had advertised for 49.99 for their rewards customers. The oil change included up to 5 quarts of synthetic oil and oil filter. The only fine print on the page was about shop materials and extra time and costs for hybrid and electric vehicles. When I arrived I was told that since I have a Volvo it would be more expensive. I needed an extra quart of oil and the service writer said that the oil filter included with the special wouldn't work with my vehicle. Uhhhhh it said nothing about only one model of filter being used for the special. One model of oil filter? You should advertise that the oil change is only for one model of car. Now the oil filter my vehicle uses is just a cartridge. It has no metal housing like the standard spin ons used on most vehicle. Sooo its typically fairly inexpensive. He quoted me $90 for the service. Then after I laughed at him he said it would be $20 off making it $70. Which is still $20 more than it should have been. One extra quart of oil is not $20. I have spent a lot of money at this store in the past. I used to be a service writer here and continued to use this location after I left. I actually used to bring our fleet vehicles here. Now that none of the original techs are here and they chew through writers due to corporate decisions &policies  this store is terrible. I will no longer be spending my hard earned money here. I went to the dealer instead and spent $330 and was out under 2hrs and they washed the car for me. The oil change was only $60 but I had them do a few other things since I was here and leaving for the poconos for the weekend. So Pepboys lost more than an oil change by screwing around with their pricing.

name: Foothills Barbers
text: Awesome place!!! Great atmosphere, very good prices, quality barbers! Highly recommend this barbershop!

name: Cuenelli's Peruvian Restaurant
text: I went with the chicken,  cilantro rice, and salad due to previous reviews and was not disappointed!  It was absolutely delicious!  I liked the green sauce best (it was spicier).  The rice was amazing,  too!  My friends got yuca and chicken salad as well as coffee and ice cream truffles.  One of my friends said it was the best coffee she'd ever had!  We were all really happy with our food.   The place was packed,  too, and we all got fast service.

name: The Human's Mechanic
text: The most amazing massage I've ever gotten hands down. I was suffering from major neck pain caused by falling off my motorcycle and urgently needed a massage. He was able to see me that same which was so awesome. I felt that Benny truly was not only knowledgeable but has a gift for what he does. i felt so great when i left and then next day i was feeling even better than before the accident. I am excited to go back next week :)

name: Ron's Original Bar & Grille
text: I picked up lunch here while on a work trip and loved the oval!! The pizza dough was very tasty! Others in the group got salads and said they were very good as well

name: Pep Boys
text: In short, these guys were great. I don't usually spend time writing reviews but I felt this experience warranted it. At the counter Sean and Kirk were cool and knowledgeable guys who saved me money everywhere they could. And the tech Christopher did a great job at the hands on part of taking care of my truck. I'll definitely be back for any further tire or mechanical needs.

name: Golden Chopstick Chinese Restaurant
text: We order here with uber eats and the food is fantastic every time. not drowned in sauce, great flavor.

name: Margaritaville - Nashville
text: Probably an amazing bar- I typically LOVE Margaritaville bars, but the security guard here was SO rude and SO disrespectful, even to those doing exactly what he asked. He put a huge damper on the day and the fun of the event. I'm so disappointed that the bar staff was so unreceptive to feedback from customers.

name: Pure Design
text: I called Pure Design based solely on their website and Yelp reviews on a Friday afternoon from Charlotte, NC to order flowers. I spoke with Scott who was helpful and personable. There were 2 arrangements I liked that were pictured on their website so I asked which one would be best based on the flowers he had in stock.  A decision was made. It was all very quick and easy. Saturday morning the recipient sent me a picture of the beautiful arrangement that arrived. Thank you Pure Design.

name: Swigwam Beach Bar on Corey
text: Just your typical bar with a variety of regulars and cheap drinks. Steve the bartender is great. Remembers your name, drink, and takes good care of everybody

name: Hughes Automobile Co
text: Got a great deal on the GMC 1/2 ton but their man who aligned my front end made a mess out my tires. I assumed they checked the front end alignment before I took possession of my 2011 GMC 1/2 ton, then again around 10 - 12000 i noticed the edges were wearing. They said it was out of warranty and had to pay $80. 7 to 10k later and the tires were wearing on the opposite side - they realigned it and at 26780 miles the inside edges are gone. I normally get 50k to 60k on a set of tires

name: Rita's Italian Ice
text: Great service. Awesome ice cream and water ice. Love going there. Staff is very pleasant and helpful with my family. Parking on site and that is great. Keep up the great job :-)

name: Skin Deep Spa
text: Went with a voucher and am now a regular.  As I can actually afford this place on my own.  Sure, at other places I might get more pampering, but I'd rather pay less, stick to business, get my face glowing, do extractions, etc.. No, I don't get a fancy robe & slippers or flavored water.  Whatever.  Everything is clean and professional and I'm treated with the right products for ME and no pressure to buy anything. So less fu fu but the facial itself is AWESOME!

name: Ted Drewes
text: The BEST! Great after Cards & Blues games. I've been here many times. Always friendly fast service no matter how long the lines. I recommend the Dutchman concrete! A MUST visit if you're in St. Louis.

name: Penske Truck Rental
text:
Went to rent 16 foot truck to help move my Dad. Chris, Alicia, Dylan and Tyson were awesome. They were not only very helpful, but extremely professional. 
They are very reasonable in price and the truck ran great. 
I will be moving soon and there is no doubt in my mind that I will rent from them again.
If you are planning to rent a truck, check these guys out over anyone else before you make a decision.  
As for truck rentals places, these guys are tops.

name: Village Pub & Beer Garden
text:
We went for happy hour as part of Yelp Drinks week and sat on the porch which is their designated smoking area--it was too nice to sit inside. After a few sips I did not even notice the smoke.

I had the Traditional Bratwurst Stuffed Pretzel and a Mexican Mule (tequila, ginger beer, and lime served in a pewter mug)--first time for both and I enjoyed them. Waitress was cute and friendly. The only thing I would like to see added is some happy hour specials on food. I wish I lived or worked closer, but then again it is probably good that I will need to drive a bit to get to the tequila...

name: 5th St. Bakehouse
text:
Fantastic food, great prices, great service. 

You can really tell this is a small restaurant that offers food at low prices when the baked goods counter is nearly empty by 11AM. Face it people, they can't afford to throw away food at the end of day just to ensure they have everything available in the afternoon. You get the feeling that Chef Dan really cares for the restaurant, and does his best to ensure everything is top notch.  

I've been here over a dozen times, and only once had a merely acceptable meal, where I got some gristle in a pulled pork sandwich. I've had that sandwich 4-5 times so I attribute it to a bad batch of meat from the supplier. Every other meal has been excellent, from the huge omlette's, to the thick and delicious french toast, to the breakfast cuban... 

Servers are friendly, although there are times when all the tables are full that you may end up waiting a few more minutes, but it's well worth it. I only hope that they get more space someday, but it's great the way it is now... low overhead means we get great food at low prices. This is definitely a hidden Gem in Reno...

They're going to start dinner service soon, can't wait.

name: HipCityVeg
text:
It is really hard to find a vegetarian restaurant around the Rittenhouse square area. If so, all I could get is a blackened black bean burger.One late afternoon, I found this joint near the Barnes & Noble. I ordered a Fajita wrap, sweet potato fries and ginger soda. 

The wrap was pretty good and so did the fries. The ginger soda went well with them. This would be my go to place, if I am roaming around this area.

name: Plaza Azteca - Kennett Square
text: This restaurant is always amazing!! The atmosphere is so great. Always get refilled on chips and salsa unlike other restaurants. Staff always dressed to the nines. Food is great too

name: Ninth Street Deli at Howards
text: I had the chicken salad sandwich the other day with an ice cold Stella and it was beautiful. Creation of beauty. Owner comes out and talks with you. Super nice and cool.

name: Elite Fireplace
text: Great work, great service! I am so grateful for Elite Fireplace - we had an emergency issue with our chimney liner that caused us to have to shut off our heat. I called over a dozen chimney places and Elite was one of the few to call me back, and was willing to prioritize my emergency faster than anyone else. They are professional, use high-quality materials, and have high standards for their work. They give a discount for payment by cash/check, and also offer payment plans. Thank you, Elite!

name: Edgehill Cafe
text: The old location was my favorite study spot. The new location is beautiful with the same great food and great customer service. The but: it feels strange sitting there for a few hours to do work since the new space has more of a restaurant feel and less of that nice coffee house vibe. But hey its probably better for business. I may now go there for brunch but not for studying.

name: Boiling Pot
text: The wings were so small and super salty. The wing size was about the side of two quarters laying side by side. Very disappointed.

name: Borrello's Pizza & Pastaria
text: I'm glad that Michael & Lucy found a way to open up another family restaurant after years at Tony's on Linden (now closed following an ugly family dispute). The food is good and the prices are reasonable (ask about the slice and salad special). The Tuscany design is pleasant as are the owners (Lucy is always sweet and friendly). They have local beer on tap (Figueroa, Island Brew and others), 3 HD sports TVs inside, one HD sports TV outside for patio diners, a TV dedicated to surf videos and a TV dedicated to kids shows (and a classic old family friendly Ms Pac-Man game that was a hit with 2 kids when I was there). It's a tough location but I hope they make it work. Santa Claus Lane seems to be having a bit of a Renaissance after many years of being known mostly for outdated kitschy roadside attractions. Good luck!

name: Brick & Mortar
text: I've never posted a review before, but I had to share our enthusiasm for this wonderful restaurant. The food and service were both outstanding! We had a salad special, the shrimp small plate (our favorite), the prosciutto and fig flatbread, the fat noodles, and the chocolate cake (amazing). We could barely move afterward but it was so worth it. We loved the fact that you could have a conversation eating outside. We appreciate Yelp's help with finding it.

name: Artmart
text: Amazing staff, great service, supports local businesses and community, wide variety of supplies, best art store ever!!!

name: So Good Jewelry
text: When I went in there, the sales people were chatting very openly about personal issues and it was just unprofessional.  Also, I wish I would have known about the return policy (aka, there isn't one!).  The earrings I bought were expensive, and when I got home to put them on, they didn't fit my ear.  The post was too short and so the back didn't stay on.  I called and they said I could exchange for the same item, but if they're all made the same, that wouldn't matter.  The only reason it gets one instead of two stars is that they did have some nice scarves on sale and had a "brass knuckles" ring that actually fit me (i've got bigger fingers).  I will not be coming back here.

name: Aqui Con El Nene
text:
I know food trucks have come a long way, but I was still a bit wary about eating here. Once I got a good look at the food though, that went right out the window! The place is a little hard to spot when driving, so just look for the 'Rusty Nail' sign that leads to a bar sharing the same parking lot. 

Recommend:
Sonoran dogs
Tortas (very buttery goodness!)
Tacos 
Burrito Jr.'s
...ALL were excellent!! 

I usually get a little irritated when a place receives a high rating for subpar Mexican food, but not this place. Everything was so flavorful, tender, and fresh. The employees are another asset to this place. They are very friendly, fast, and obviously do a great job of cooking. When we were done eating they wrapped up our food in little meat department packaging for us! I really appreciated that extra step. 

They play music in the seating area, and there is a flat screen TV. The open tent seating area is kept very clean after each table leaves, and they have an awesome salsa bar with just about every condiment you can think of. I usually drink my salsa before I start to gauge a restaurant's salsa making capabilities, and I must say, this place makes great hot and savory salsas! 

Drinks were soda out of a can (bottle Pepsi), and cash only~!!! I'm excited to have a new place to haunt.

name: Los Rancheros
text: My fiance and I come here pretty regularly as we live right down the road. We've always had good experiences. The servers are nice, the food is good and it's served pretty quickly. There are better Mexican restaurants in Indy, but this is one of the better in Avon/Brownsburg area.

name: Local Taco
text:
I've given this establishment three different shots to change my mind, each visit yields the same results. Terrible service accompanied with sub-par food and drink every single time. Tacos are always served very dry and cold, like they have been sitting out. Enchiladas are over cooked and dried to the plate upon serving. Margaritas are way too sweet with very little alcohol. The worst aspect of this place is the service. Each visit I've waited at least 30 minutes for another beer, more chips, or an opportunity to order anything. If visiting, allow for at least an hour and a half if you're going to eat there. 

Too many better options in this city to settle for this place.

name: Winners Bar and Grill Nashville
text: Not a half bad neighborhood bar. The patio was pretty nice, drinks were just alright though. Tables were hard to come by.

name: Eye Bar
text:
I have been doing business with the Eye Bar for years, largely because of Dr. Rick G'Sell. 

I placed an order last week for refills of my contacts. There was an error---not sure if it was them or me, so I called to complain on Friday. When I got back from an out of town on Sunday, (two days later) I found samples hand delivered to my door. It was a very satisfactory  solution to my problem. Thank you

name: MOD Pizza
text: Staff makes this place. I am here now. I REALLY love this place. Great pizza great atmosphere. GREAT staff. This place is the best. Haven't tried it, need to!

name: Pia Urban Cafe & Market
text: This review is only for the coffee! Fast service in the morning with no wait. The chai latte is super sweet and I like sweet. If you aren't into sweet, try something else. The owner was friendly and the interior is super cute! Parking on the side of the building. I'll be back to try the food!

name: Holiday Inn
text:
We did the "park and cruise" package as we needed a place to stay before our cruise left NOLA. Dude, it's $150 for 1 night and a week's parking in the garage. You'd pay that much for the parking alone! Totally worth it.

So even if the room weren't essentially free because of the parking, still a great deal! I found a room on Priceline at this hotel for like 70-80, but cruise package was worth it.

Prime location, right off canal & 1 block away from bourbon street. Indoor pool, friendly and VERY busy staff, restaurant/bar "in" the hotel...but technically next door to it. No need to go there though, as all the good places are within a 10 minute walk or closer.

Sure it's a holiday inn so you know what to expect from the rooms. But they were clean, comfortable, and decently roomy. Good bathroom too. Besides, who hangs out in their hotel room anyway in New Orleans? Great stay, totally recommended.

name: Spiro's Restaurant
text:
I was going back and forth over 4 or 5 stars.  As you can see I gave it a 5.  I went to lunch and ordered their luncheon special which included a soft drink Greek salad and main course of beef kabob, rice, vegetables, and a desert.

The Greek salad of course had feta cheese on it.  I have never tasted a milder feta in my life.  I like feta but it can be powerful and salty this feta was mild and was a total compliment to the salad.  The beef kabob was cooked to my request of medium rare and the rice and vegetable were fresh cooked great not mushy had a slight crunch.  
 So why was I thinking about 4 stars and not 5.  I guess a 5 should be just so outstanding it is a stand out meal.  Some gentleman ask me if my meal was good.  I said to him it is not good or very good it is excellent.  And I thought how can I tell him my food was outstanding and give the place 4 stars? 

This place has been around a long time and I have eaten here a few times.

 Good job Spiro's keep up the good work!

name: The Saint Hotel, Autograph Collection
text:
This review is for the bar inside of The Saint Hotel. I went there yesterday with a girlfriend to order a drink while waiting on a friend. The bartender (Megan) was rude, unprofessional, and unpleasant. My friend ordered a French 45 and I ordered one of the "Favorites" the Pimm's Cup. 

We both disliked our drinks very much. I'm not sure what went wrong, but they just weren't very good. We let Megan know that we disliked the drinks and she says "what's wrong them?" We tell her that they both just taste bad. She then says "well I made them the exact way the menu says" 

Then she sticks a straw in one of the drinks and says "that taste like it's suppose to" Then she says "since I already made the drinks, you'll have to pay for them" 

This is completely unacceptable and poor customer service. If a guest orders anything that they dislike, the right thing to do is ask what would they like instead. I work in the restaurant industry and so does my friend who was with me. So we know true hospitality and what Megan said was the opposite.
I ask to speak with the manager. Megan tells me that the manager isn't in until 5pm (it's almost 2pm at this point)

Megan then says, "I've worked here for 6 years so I know what I'm doing and what I'm talking about" I then ask for the hotel manager. Megan says "I'll get you something else and you just pay for the original two drinks that you disliked. 

Why on earth would we pay for the original two drinks in lieu of new ones? Why wouldn't she just comp the drinks, or void them, or separate them off for the manager to come later on? So I ask her those questions and she says she didn't have the authority to comp or void anything. 

Needless to say, we paid and left. But how horrible and rude of Megan to argue with us as guest, then tell us we have to pay for something that we disliked?!

What rude service all for two drinks!

name: Kuzina By Sofia
text:
I went back for dinner and was impressed again by the size of the portions.  There was live music performed on a Saturday night that was pleasant and upbeat.  

We shared the cold appetizer sampler (traditional hummus, eggplant and giant fava beans and dolmades - delicious and the dolmades are perfect) among 4 people, which was a good starter. 

I loved the special whole bronzino wrapped in grape leaves, but not as much as the whole dorado that I had at Kanella.

I did NOT love the grilled calamari, as it was probably too fresh from the sea for my taste.  I am not accustomed to this style.  I like mine cooked through and sliced in rings, rather than large, soft, tenderized whole pieces (there were 4).  This may be a traditional Greek style of grilled squid, but I wasn't open minded enough for its mushy texture.  

Personally, I thought the Horiatiki salad could have used more cucumbers and tomatoes and less green peppers and red onions, however it was refreshing and tasty all the same.  

Reservations for weekend dinners are probably a good idea: I was told that it was a "slow night" at Kuzina by Sofia because there was a famous Greek singer performing in AC that evening, yet there was but one table free at 7 PM!  

Though I enjoyed my  food from my first visit for lunch far better, Kuzina by Sofia still gets 4 stars from me for dinner based on the kind service, their welcoming accommodation to disabled persons, cleanliness, and the fact that Sofia smiled at me.

name: Jones
text:
JONES is one of my favorite dinner spots in the city because it offers something for everyone!
Always great service and yummy comfort food like mom makes. I really love the Turkey dinner especially when I am craving Thanksgiving meal in the middle of July.  I also recommend the Nachos if you are hungry or have a large party. Their specialty cocktails are unique, light, and refreshing so try one (or three)!
I've brought everyone here for dinner: my suburban family, my out of town guests, and my best friend! Like I said their menu has something for everyone and the decor is cool without being over the top trendy.
I almost forgot: ORDER DESSERT! They are fabulous!

name: Kopper Kitchen
text: We've been coming here for 5 years and absolutely love it. Sunrise skillet add chicken fried steak. Best chicken fried steak anywhere. And the service is always wonderful

name: Starbucks
text: This is a really good starbucks. One thing I like is that it had really quick service. All the drinks I have had have been on point

name: Andre Richard Salon
text:
I can't believe I've never written a review for Andre Richard Salon!  Andre has been doing my hair for a few years now, and he's the shizzle.  I live out in the 'burbs, but drive 45 minutes into the city every month to visit Andre because I won't let anyone else touch my head now.

My hair is a pain in the a** -- fine and curly, which means the wrong cut either leaves it weighed down and curl-less or looking like a frizzy mushroom.  I have had some cuts ove the years that have left me wanting to shave my head in frustration, so I am super picky.  Andre and his staff have had curly-hair mentoring with the DevaCurl folks, so they GET how to deal with curls.  My hair looks fantastic now, and I don't need to mess with it beyond washing it and throwing in some product.  No exaggeration, people stop me all the time and ask who does my hair.

Besides cuts and color, Andre and his staff are fantastic with dressier 'dos and makeup as well.  Andre has a performance background, and so he loves having fun with makeup and "evening" hair.  They provide styling services for a number of local fashion shows every year; I've been in the salon when it's been full of models getting made up before a show, and their work is superb.  Even with a short cut like mine, Andre has shown me little hints and tricks to funk it up a bit when I want a change.

If you're looking for a salon where people know their stuff, are fun to work with, and make sure you leave there looking awesome, you owe it to yourself to visit Andre Richard.

name: Deviate Brewing
text:
I have to be honest, I was a little hesitant about this place simply because of its location. This area is surrounded by big box stores and chains so I thought it was strange that a brewery would pick this location. I tried it because my boyfriend's coworkers raved about the place and I sure am happy I did.

I stopped in here after a workout at the nearby LA fitness.  I went in with low expectations but came out with only smiles.  First off, the staff is very friendly. You can tell the bartenders highly respect the passion the owners put in their beer and they are a good face to the brewery.

We tried the flight of 8, all their beers on tap. They were very generous pours! I took my time sampling all their beers and took my rest in between sampling as a chance to look around the place. They let you bring in your own food! Not only that, but they have a list of places near by and their flyers available to you if you decide you need some carbs to soak up all the beer you have been drinking. They also have GIANT containers of pretzels to also soak up all the beer you have been drinking, for free. The nicest touch is the water jug in the corner. You can fill up your water to your hearts content without having to wait for a waitress to come by. I appreciate that more than they know.

The atmosphere is very laid back, huge tables to line up your pours on, and televisions to watch the game. Happy I decided to stop by. This is brewery that Indy will probably start to see a lot of.

name: Apex Inspections
text: Howard Shanker did our home inspection prior to our buying a new home.  He didn't alert us to a couple of key problems.  He did not tell us about the consequences of us having a lead pipe bringing water into our home or even suggest we test the water because of the lead pipe. He also stated there was limited ability to view inside the chimneys which was not true. He didn't even try to open the damper which would have told him a lot that he could have shared with us. He would have seen a lot of debris fall down the chimney.

name: Foundation Room
text: As cool as it gets!! I was invited by a member who happened to run the Bed and Breakfast at which I was staying... It was quite amazing to be a part of what otherwise would seem like a very exclusive venue.. Im pretty sure its a big wig and locals only venue based on it's exclusivity, but if you're lucky enough to be invited... YOU MUST GO!

name: Watermark Restaurant
text:
One star, 185 dollars later.   Read on Yelpers...

Go to Mortons, or Ruths Chris - they are predictable and live up to that.  

The Watermark, should reinvent itself, perhaps as 'space for lease', or live up to its facade

Do Nashville a favor, move.  Allow someone else to succeed at what the Watermark is not.

Or, deliver what one should naturally expect from the facade..

Either course would benefit Nashville.  

Ill explain, and I completely hope 'Hughes' the manager replies. 

Disappoint me, I wont care much, it happens.  

Disappoint my wife after I tell her I was assured - by the manager, Hughes  'its handled'? - this is what happens 

Actually, I spoke to him on the phone, asking for a small favor - my wife and her friend were celebrating her birthday early - could he please place a small candle or something in their dessert?  He found their reservation - 'no problem, Ill be happy too'   He made a comment along the lines of 'theres a note for the server..'   

Wrong.  My wife was mildly disappointed when there was no candle. Nothing crazy, didnt want a circus, just a candle.  

Although I took it on faith, since I spoke directly to the manager and from him - it was handled  'it was done'.     

I thought the matter was handled.  Wrong.  Something fairly trivial, fumbled.  I learned this after the fact..

Great non attention to detail.  Wonder if the kitchen staff uses soap to wash their hands..

Feel free to pull the ticket for the evening of the 23rd, table for two...7:30pm...

James the server, was 'very nice', no complaint - perhaps it is he who merited the additional star..

The hostess?  Rather Gothic.  Looked more a bartender than hostess.  

Overall, the menu is terrific. 

Too bad the entrees were lukewarm, and the soup (lobster bisque) was 'room temperature'.

The Chocolate martinis were fine, dessert, fine as well - something went right.  

Pass on this restaurant, on the food temp AND the service.

name: Bar Louie - Carmel
text: Great place. Good atmosphere. Only seems to be busy during Burger Night. I've been to other locations around Indy and they have drink specials. (I.e. Greenwood has 1/2 bottles of wine on Thursdays and always draws a crowd ). Location like this would benefit from more frequent specials. Miller special in May was great! Wait staff and food is always great though.

name: Market Blooms
text: I love this stand so much. The flowers are so vibrant and will last much longer than the regular store bought bouquet you find in supermarket.  They have a wide variety of flowers and many ways they can be arranged. Very affordable and attention to detail. The staff are friendly and helpful. From holiday parties to life events they always have something eye catching and meaningful that can be made to leave a lasting impression.

name: Brick & Mortar
text: My fiance and I went here a couple months ago on a whim and were excited to try the food and experience what they had to offer. Sadly, not only were we not impressed with the food but we actually left hungry. I am not one to complain over the price of food or the portions if the food is exceptionally good. I've had very small portions of things that left me dreaming about it and wanting more and I will go back to those places to get it again. But this was not one of those experiences. We ordered a local seasonal picked vegetable plate with a rabbit pate. All the pickled veggies tasted the same, the rabbit was not that good. Very under seasoned and bland. We also had the onion and goat cheese tart with was literally the size of a round hostess snack cake. Super small. Ironically that was the only good thing we ate there. Next came our entree, which the waitress said would feed 2. It was 1, I repeat,  1 big ravioli with ricotta and egg in the middle over an oxtail ragu. The ravioli was under seasoned, the oxtail was over done and a bit tough and the sauce was one dimensional. It needed acidity or some heat. It's a cool looking restaurant with so much potential but just because you serve food and label it "local" or "artisanal" does not make it good. In my opinion this food is bland, pretentious, over priced and the portions are so tiny you will need to eat again directly after leaving. I wouldn't go back again.

name: HipCityVeg
text: Place was excellent. A little cramp'd but great. The employees were nice, polite and friendly which is rare these days. Food was excellent so was the green lemonade. I had the hipcity ranch "chicken" sandwich. Couldn't even tell it wasn't chicken. I will definitely be back. Worth the trip and the kinda high price.

name: Tony B's Pizzeria
text:
Visited on a Saturday night. The place was packed, mostly families with kids and a few large groups. The ambiance is non-existent, just your average run-of-the-mill pizza place. When we arrived, we were instructed to sit wherever we wanted. 

First of all, the service was terrible. Only saw our waitress to give our order, get our food and beg for boxes/check when we finally did see her again. No one ever asked if we wanted drink refills, etc. The table wasn't even clean when we sat down. 

The food itself was "meh.". I had the cannelloni which wasn't worth it. As someone else mentioned, the sauce is bland. Instead of having real mozzarella melted on top, it just had some processed shredded mozzarella. Plus I prefer cannelloni baked in a dish and this was just two noodles thrown on a plate. We also had a pizza, which wasn't terrible, but again as someone else mentioned, they clearly use canned mushrooms. I did see someone eating the pasta con broccoli and true to other reviews, it looked terrible. I couldn't even see sauce on it. 

I can see how this place is affordable and convenient for people with kids who aren't expecting a gourmet meal. As the pizza was not horrible and there are limited options in Fenton, I might return for carryout. But the service alone would keep me from dining in again. 

My suggestion would be to cut the number of entree and pasta options on the menu in half until they master those. The menu has too many options if they are all going to come out that poorly.

name: Lily of the Valley Cupcakery
text: I pass it on the way home everyday and decided to give it a try, and let me tell you I'm glad I did. The exterior is colorful and inviting and the interior is really cute. There is no place to sit and eat, it's more of a grab and go place. Anyway hands down the cupcakes are phenomenal! From the rich cake batter to the sweet, smooth icing, everything Rashida (owner and baker) puts on that cupcake makes sense and is absolutely delicious. My recommendation is to definitely try the Chicken and Waffles cupcake. So good! Just go!

name: Brew Brothers
text:
I brought my cousin here on Christmas night. The food/beers were great, and the waitress was friendly. 

Several hours after I left, I realized that I had left my phone on the table. I drove back and asked the security guard who was standing outside Brew Brothers if they had found a phone, "I haven't heard about any phone, I would check down stairs with security." 

The security office also denied having found a phone. I went home and used "find my iPhone". It was still in the casino. I put it on "lost mode" - setting my best friend's number as the call back. 

 My friend, Alex, went back the next morning to try and find it. (I was at work, but kept a close eye for any changes on the map via laptop). 

He went up to the brew brothers, and spoke to the manager (bald with a beard).

 "I was the manager that was on last night, and I assure you there was no phone found last night." My friend then walked down to security, they hadn't found it.

Meanwhile I was incessantly using the "play sound" function via my laptop. At some point Alex was called. Someone said "hello"... then hung up. 

Alex went back to brew brothers and was like "I know it's in there." 

"Ummmm... alright let me check". He came out with it in hand, and was acting sketchy. "It was making noise and scaring the employees so we turned it off."

name: Sky Cafe
text: Everything here is delish..I was catering with them once..but now they aren't do it no more..it used to be $7 and they delivered to your house everyday..around south philly..next time you come here try the crab noddle..and satay padang/beef tongue bbq on skewer ;)

name: Nordstrom The Plaza at King of Prussia
text:
Paul in the Chanel makeup counter was fabulous.  He is extremely knowledgeable and takes the time to give you exactly what you are looking for as far as colors etc. 
I highly recommend him.  I previously had bought items from Ruthie who seemed just as knowledgeable.  
You will not be disappointed.

name: Parada Maimon
text: traveled from New York City & was not disappointed. the service, the food and the vibe was amazing! The owners name is Jose and he treated us like we were his favorite customers although it was our first time. they have an outdoor seating area that made it a great place to enjoy the weather. can't wait to go back! :)

name: 3 Sisters Café
text:
This is hands down one of the only reasons I like living in Broad Ripple. There is of course a wait if you're going to brunch on the weekend, just like every other place in town, but especially due to popularity. Big deal. Totally worth the wait, quality, and genuine people on staff. It's such a cozy place if you like long, relaxed breakfasts with friends.

One of the best things about this place is the abundance of produce you get with your meals. Obviously vegetarian/vegan friendly. Thank god, something green on my plate! I hate having meals that are all starches, fried items, brown and yellow, meats AKA typical American breakfast joints. No. Give me something of nutritional value, thanks. This place does that, and the portions are generous. You WILL be full when you leave. The lemon corncakes with berry sauce featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives are incredible and I always get a side of the powerhouse potatoes (garlic,onions,cheddar,salsa,tofu.) Ugh, flavor explosion. I love it this place, dearly.

name: McKay's Mill Dental
text: First time we walked into the door, we got greeted with attitude by a lady who looks like a rat.  Yes we had trouble making our appointment, my wife is pregnant and there are things that come up all the time.  We made it to the appointment a bit late and the front desk lady pretty much made us seem like we don't matter. they shouldn't hire people that do not have regard  at all. get a job working under a rock and no one will miss your attitude.

name: Zorba's Taverna
text:
Spicy feta is da best. Get it, then get more. I swear I order three servings each time I visit from California. 

Entrees are also good, but not great. This rating is all about the spicy feta. Eat it.

name: Local Taco
text:
Atmosphere: 7/10 - It's retro-ish.  It isn't super clean, but it's comfortable and fun.
Noise: Pretty loud
Food: 8/10 - It's different, but the taste quality is great for such a casual place! Some foods are a bit too dry, but the great taste makes up for that. Great selection of unique food and drink choices.
Update: I have tried the enchiladas with mole and again with the red chile sauce. Both were 9/10!  I also tried the BBQ taco - also 9/10. So good!  White queso: 10/10!
Drinks: I only tried the Tamarind soda, and it was great. The selection I saw was pretty good though. I see that they have $4 margaritas on Mondays. 
Originality: 7/10 - It's not super different, but there are many unique drink and food selections. It's like a really good food truck planted in a building.
Service: 9/10 - Very nice cashier and very fast service.
Cleanliness: 7/10 - Clean, but the floors could be better. 
Price-Quality Ratio: Fair-ish.  Maybe a tiny bit over-priced. Good thing it tastes so good!
Overall: 9/10

name: Luke
text: Decent, consistent food. If you're in the CBD, they make solid food for a quick lunch or happy hour.

name: Center City Emergency Dentist
text:
I had a wisdom tooth that was in serious need of extraction. I called my regular dentist and they were unwilling to see me for another 3 months, even though I was in a lot of pain. I was lucky enough to find out about Center City Emergency dental from a billboard on my way home one evening. I gave them a call and they were so respectful and sympathetic to my needs. They were willing to book my appointment the very next day. 

My visit was absolutely awesome. The staff here is unlike anything I've experienced at any other dental office... They are courteous, caring, friendly and they make you feel at ease the entire time. I appreciate that they clearly explain what you need and how much it's going to cost. Dr. Cabrera was excellent with letting me know what to expect during and after the procedure and answering all my questions. 

Overall, I am so happy with my experience here that I think I will make this practice my full time dentist. Not too many places can make you smile after a tooth extraction.

name: Sun Diner
text:
Stopped in here after reading the other Yelp reviews, despite thoughts it would be a tourist trap.

We went for breakfast rather than "middle of the night drunk food post bar hopping down Broadway." We arrived around 0930 on a weekday and it was packed, but we found the last 2 available seats. It's an interesting setup with the 3 "sections" it's divided into. 

I got the chicken and waffles and my boyfriend got the short rib hash. I was skeptical about the gravy with syrup on the waffle, but I went for it anyway. I was mostly impressed. The chicken and gravy needed a fair amount of salt/pepper, but the waffle was hot and not soggy. I asked for a little side of gravy because I felt like it didn't come with enough. Our waitress brought me a bowl and then promptly charged me $2.50 extra for it. I could've done without if I had known it was going to be that much. You're already paying tourist prices, so careful there.

My boyfriend said the short rib hash was good, but there seemed to be more onions in it than actual hashbrowns. 

The service was good. They have the diner working like a well oiled machine and the head cook definitely keeps an eye on his plates he's making to ensure they get out to the customer ASAP. 

The atmosphere is great if you like 1950s/60s era music and a true diner like atmosphere. I'll likely go back on my next trip to Nashville.

name: Hardee's
text: I used to really really like going to this Hardees. I liked Hardees breakfast menu a lot.  I even came here and spent close to $30 on breakfast items for St. Patrick's day.  All of that came crashing down one Saturday afternoon when the window checker never gave my debit card back to me (as I was distracted in my vehicle) and bought $140 worth of gas.  Thankfully my bank was able to stop any further transactions before they started buying flat screens at Best Buy. I won't risk using the drive thru here again.

name: J's Seafood Dock
text: The oysters are fresh and amazing. The best oysters I have tried. We searched and searched and found this lovely small stand. Def does not disappoint.  I recomend the Oyster Creole. Its to die for. Its a fried oyster on a bed of creamy spinach type sauce. Add a spladh of hot sauce for a kick and voilà AMAZING. Did I mention its also a resonable price. MUST TRY

name: Cathey's Coffee Bar
text: Great coffee and cupcakes- a lot of variety- they'll make any kind of coffee you want - Cathey & Thais are very friendly- highly recommend the cupcakes.

name: Sculley's Waterfront Restaurant
text: I had dinner here on a holiday evening but there were plenty of tables indoors, although the outdoor seating was limited to tables with high chairs.  We had grouper and hogfish and both were very good.  They serve alcoholic beverages.  Prices were average for Gulf Coast.  I recommend this restaurant if you are in the Johns Pass area.

name: The Saint
text: Georgia is so welcoming! She helped me pick a few great choices of beer. Lovely atmosphere along with the best customer service!

name: Halcyon Floats
text:
Oh my goodness. The remodel is GORGEOUS. This place is so soothing, so clean and lovely!  I went for the first time in years recently, and was blown away by the new tank rooms-- high ceilings, music if that floats your boat, lights if you want them.  

I prefer the darkest of dark silent tanks and the room offered that too.  Amazing.

name: AT&T Store
text: After being talked into the AT&T Digital Life system last year, at this location, I came back in in May 2016 to cancel the service as we had to move.  I was told that the service would be cancelled on my closing date.  Yesterday (July 2016) I received a bill with a late payment and called AT&T today.  After an hour and a half I am still trying to get the bill corrected and the account canceled.  This is a huge waste of time with the process being more important than customer service.  I have been with AT&T for 15+ years.  This type of service makes me want to look elsewhere.

name: Jazmine
text: I had been waiting to go to Jazmine for what seemed like years, ever since we moved to the south meadows. My lovely wife straight up refuses to eat "Chinese food" and we take most meals together, therefore, no Jazmine. That was until I discovered that they have a sushi bar! Kristen loves sushi (as do I) so a date night (with no kids) finally came along and whammy!! Time for Jazmine. I had the Mongolian beef and crispy fried noodles with chicken, Kristen had all you can eat sushi. The food was good. Wasn't great, not revolutionary by any stretch, but if you dig Chinese food and sushi, you will not be disappointed with the food. The service however was weird. Basically we got a server who looked distraught, we asked, she said that she had messed a few things up at other tables and was in the "dog house" with the manager. (Your not supposed to use the "d" word at a Chinese restaurant). The rest of the night several servers and the head chef would come by and ask us  if everything was ok, as if the young lady couldn't handle taking care of us. She was great, and they treated her poorly right in front of us, it was just super awkward. Anyhow, there's not much good solid Chinese food in Reno, especially in the south meadows area. This place is pretty darn good. Also they have an all-you-can-eat sushi lunch that's pretty affordable.

name: Brick House Tavern + Tap
text: This place is outstanding! ! The food is amazing everytime. The beer selection is wonderful. The staff is always great and very accommodating. I come here at least once a week.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
text: like most high end steak places you most likely will get a  good and pricey meal. personally i prefer morton's just b/c i think ruth goes a bit crazy with the butter on their steak and an inferior key lime pie but everything else is pretty comparable. they run a 3 course for 2 special for 89- it might be 99 now?- a couple times a year,  well worth it for that price.

name: Ole Red
text:
Blake Shelton sure knows how to grill a good burger. My friend and I went here after a full evening of drinking and enjoyed some awesome music and delicious melt-in-your-mouth cheeseburgers. The house-made tater tots are just about the best thing you can put in your mouth then you add in a little beer cheese to dip them in and it's a life changing experience. Totally recommend this bar for food and music entertainment. 

Only con is that it is more contemporary than a true honky tonk should be in my opinion. Perhaps Blake is letting Gwen have too much say.

Also I found it ironic that the band was singing Miranda Lambert covers.

name: Caruso's
text: We yelped a good italian restaurant in the area of Tuscon and we came up with Caruso's, which ranked pretty high. We were psyched! We entered and were seated immediately. The restaurant wasn't super busy and we were greeted by our server pretty quickly. We ordered a bottle of wine and received it right away and were poured a pretty healthy glass. He also served us some garlic bread that was a little more than toasted, meaning you bit into it and it disintegrated into dust. Oh well. It's only bread, right? No biggie. Our waiter returned and we placed our order. Garlic and Oil. Two Italian staples, right? Nope, not here. We placed your typical italian restaurant order.I got the eggplant parm and my husband got the veal parm. My husband ordered a side of aglio ed olio- garlic and oil spaghetti. The waiter was a bit confused, so my husband explained, "You know, garlic, oil and butter sauteed, spaghetti thrown in?" The waiter acted like he knew what we were talking about and then retreated to the kitchen. A few moments later, he came scurrying back to our table and told us that there would be a $.75 charge for the garlic and butter. Say what? We were a bit perplexed, but we took it in stride. A few minutes later he arrives back again with our dinner that did not in anyway resemble eggplant or veal parm or garlic and oil spaghetti. The eggplant was cut into spears, like pickles, unbreaded, and was thrown into sauce with cheese broiled over the top. The veal was a bit stranger- more of a scallopini sliced very thin, unbreaded with same cheese and sauce broiled over the top. The spaghetti arrived with a literal pat of butter on the top, sprinkled with garlic salt. Yup, no kidding, garlic salt. It was so salty that it was  unedible. My husband expressed his displeasure to the waiter, who scurried away yet again, never to return... Until it was time for the bill, of course. Hysterically enough, they removed the $.75 charge for the unedible spaghetti, but there was no other explanation or apology made for the really substandard food or the resulting lack of customer service. I don't know what these other folks are eating at Caruso's, but we did not enjoy our meal at all.

name: Cafe Fiorello's
text: Good Italian food here. Staff is always very friendly and attentive. Usually not too much of a wait even though I am very lazy about making reservations. The atmosphere is warm, with a family feel. Each meal I've gotten here has been great, portions are good, and prices are fair. Good location just off 202 on route 3 so not too much traffic getting in and out since it's on the edge of West Chester.

name: Bourbon Orleans Hotel
text: Great French Quarter location, especially after dark when you walk out the door, turn to your left and see the giant shadow of Saint Louis (I presume--see photo) cast all the way up the backside of the St. Louis Cathedral. It's eerie and grand, and lends the perfect note of spookiness to the atmosphere of the Bourbon Orleans--which alegedly has ghosts. It's old, after all, and in the French Quarter. I reckon it's not so easy to find an unhaunted hotel in these parts, the city that is called--among other things--the most haunted city in America.  New Orleans also has some of the best food, music, art and people anywhere. But back to the hotel, there is a certain just-past-its-prime grandeur to the decor. I liked it. My room was spacious, clean and quiet; it overlooked the lovely pool area, and had a comfy King size bed. The staff was friendly and quick. While the French Quarter was not particularly damaged by the hurricane, many New Orleans neighborhoods were--and are far from full recovery post-Katrina. So go there and see the city and enjoy the fun of the Quarter. And don't forget the tragedy that befell the people of NOLA who love their town and are still fiercely working to rebuild, when much of the world has already moved on.

name: Henry's Coffee Bistro
text: Henry's on East Street is a great place to grab a bite to eat and chat with a friend.  It's a small coffee shop with sandwiches, bagels, baked goods, etc.  The coffee is real good and a real bargain compared to Starbucks down the street.  It's out of the way enough that most of the customers are locals.

name: Sandpiper Lodge
text:
This was not the best hotel I've ever stayed at.  But it certainly wasn't the worst.  We were there during the week, and found the accommodations perfectly acceptable.

The beds were a little firm for my taste, but we were able to get a two-room suite for under $200 a night on (upper) State St. in Santa Barbara, which is not bad, especially in summer. It's not pretty or fancy, but the TV works and it was pretty quiet

We would return again.

name: Ballyhoo Grill
text:
This is good food.  I like great fish and this is a fine place to get it.  It's a casual place with fresh plates and prices are reasonable for fresh seafood.  The service is great.  I've been here twice.  

The 1st time almost a month ago, I had seafood gumbo $4, fish spread $8, and shrimp/scallop special ($20).  The fish spread is excellent but I don't love cooked salmon.  It's good and a lot of people would like this though so you should consider it.  The gumbo had an excellent taste & spiciness.  Mine was a bit thick but maybe that was a one-time thing.  The shrimp and scallops were just excellent.  They are what you seek.  I will be back to order them again.

2nd time, Sunday I was just there.  I had the fish spread again- and had forgotten about the salmon.  Think I'll get gumbo next time.  This time I had the catch, which was triple-tail snapper.  I took a picture- unfortunately didn't think of it until I'd taken my first bite- sorry.  The snapper was so good that I was sad when it was all gone, lol.

So why not 5 stars?  Only a picky topic for me.   It's the beer selection.  I had the space dust, which is a pretty good tasting sipper.  But it's not that drinkable (8% alcohol) and I like beer with my fish.  I prefer easy drinking IPA's and pale ales with dinner.  There isn't really another great choice on the menu, which is surprising, considering the better breweries nowadays.  There are 3 kinds of Amber ale amongst 8 taps total, lol.  Blue point, big storm, and v-twin are all good beers.  Maybe this is overkill?

I'd highly recommend any restaurant replacing the sorry goose island with Lagunitas Pale Ale or Lagunitas IPA.  Or, Green Bench Sunshine City.  or Deep South Citra, or Ballast Point Even Keel & BP Grunion, or Stone Tangerine, or even Cycle Crank IPA.  A very light, fruity, hoppy brew with lower alcohol would pair so much better with such great seafood.  Please consider so I can change this to 5 stars!

name: Trophy Fish
text: Conceptually awesome! My wife and I popped in early Friday evening for our first visit. The environment left us feeling as though we were at a  beach bar & restaurant. We tried two appetizers: Grilled Shrimp and Smoked Fish Spread. Both were well prepared and delicious. For entrees, Emily had the grilled snapper tacos and I had the gag grouper dinner. Both meals were delicious! The issues the exist can easily be corrected. It is summer and this is an outdoor venue. You order your food at a hut located behind the bar. However, you have to stand in the HOT sun while ordering! A canopy needs to be installed. There is no pricing listed anywhere so you order and then get surprised by what you are asked to pay. What we ordered was well worth what we paid but it would be nice to know what you are spending before you order. The only menu is a series of high-end cocktails all of which sound delicious. However, the bartenders are not adept and creating these wonderful concoctions. So the delivery is not as great as the written word. Suggestion, cocktail napkins or coasters (they won't blow away) and ice. Alcohol melts the ice so load the glass up because the Florida summer heat melts the ice also. The plastic wear is fine and works well enough but the little piece of paper in the package is not sufficient to be called a napkin. Serve and extra "real" napkin with the utensils. One thing for sure we will be back but at this price point, a few additional steps need to be taken by management and crew. PS: Your "rocking" your idea Morgan - Smile and look less stressed (even if you are). Cheers,

name: Tijuana Flats
text: First time here. The service was awesome! The young ladies working today have clearly been trained well they were very professional, and always anticipated my needs I didn't have to ask for anything. Had a blackened chicken burrito which was great the chicken was a little dry which is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars.

name: Cha Cha Chow Food Truck
text:
First of all let's talk for a second about how awesome it is that you can rate a mobile restaurant, because the reality is, it could be ANYWHERE and it would be awesome.

Second the food truck is one of the greatest idea's man has ever had right behind electricity, the light bulb, and adding bacon to anything.  So 4th place is pretty good.

Cha Cha Chow pulled up to my office today, excitement and my mouth water almost overwhelmed me.

I walked down and ordered the fish tacos.  First of all ordering anything through a window increases the appeal of it.  Then probably the second best fish tacos I've had in St. Louis show up on some corn tortillas with some fresh slaw and delicious sauce.  2 in a basket, but I probably could have eaten 15.  They also had this delicious berry drink in tub in front of the truck which I also got and I highly recommend.

Let's recap.  Food truck, one of man's greatest ideas.  Cha Cha chow, epic fish tacos.  Mobile eats, can't beat it!

name: Black 13 Tattoo Parlor
text:
I have now gotten two tattoos done by Jon Ragoe here.  I moved down from Philly last summer and was a bit resistant to having to find a new artist down here.  After reading reviews I went to Black 13.  The studio is gorgeous.  Clean, new, just awesome.  Brittany is always very helpful.  I didn't know who exactly I wanted as I was just getting a short quote.  They set me up with Jon.  He was so nice and did an awesome job.  So I went back a couple months later for a larger piece from Jon.  Again, amazing.  I still can't get over how badass my trinacria turned out - even though my leg was twitching like mad, he handled it like a champ and gave me a beautiful tattoo.  I will be scheduling an appointment for my third tattoo from him soon.
I give this place more than 5 stars from my own personal experience.  However, I recently took my mom there to get a tattoo.  The artist she had (unfortunately not Jon) seemed to be very condescending and slightly rude.  I don't know if it was because she's older or that artist was tired or what, perhaps it was just an off day, but I was a bit put off by their attitude.
Overall though, awesome shop and would highly recommend, especially Jon!

name: Seasons Cafe & Bakery
text: Great food! I had ordered 4 for on the road and request the veggie in a different bag and in toasted it. This way you can toast it at home if you live 2 hours away like me! Had three there with a few friend. Must try the shaved ice it's amazing!!! Friendly and good service do not serve other people before you based on ethnicity like thuy cafe down the street.

name: Helena Avenue Bakery
text: The best chocolate croissant (petit pain au chocolat) I had in USA!  I like the atmosphere, very industrial look. The place is shared with a wine bar, so you can have an excellent sandwich made with a French baguette and a glass of wine. It was too early for me. I would recommend this place.

name: Silver Door Spa
text:
One of the best spas Northside of Indy. Personalized service and they provide you comfy robes. At the relaxation room, you'll be asked for what drinks you want (wine, tea, etc) and they have some warm booties. 

The room's ambiance can be changed with their LED lighting. You will need to sign off on a waiver by using their iPads too. 

This place is just a nice, little, trendy spa. The customized service sets them apart from competition.

name: Dewey's Pizza
text: Dewey's is always consistently good. We frequent it often. We usually get a Bronx bomber and a Hawaiin pizza and they have a great Caesar salad. We add chicken to the salad for a reasonable up charge. It's definitely more expensive than a national chain, but the ingredients taste fresh, and the crust is, simply put airy yet chewy. One thing I love is that it's not in the least bit greasy. I almost feel healthy eating it. Ha!  Its a very family friendly place so my husband tween, baby, and myself feel comfortable. We love Dewey's!

name: Wildflower Cafe
text: I want to give this place a 3.5 but settled with a 4. Presentation and decor were a bit above average. Food was good, but not excellent. Omelet was a bit runny.  The oj came from a bottle (saw them pouring it from a minute maid bottle).

name: Culver's
text: They always get the order wrong, not sure if it's on purpose that they leave out stuff or what. Every time I order a bacon burger with everything, I always get the meat with cheese only. This also happened to me while in the drive-through and I had my dog, the line was long, so I didn't argue it. But it's happened to me while dinning in, and the orders take forever to get ready, and then the bacon they gave me after I complained was very little. Not worth the money or hype.

name: In Riva
text:
This is the second time experiencing In Riva, but the first review. 

Went twice on one night so I was able to experience two aspects of the place. The first time was pre-game for an event we had at the Laurel Hill Cemetery. We stood at the bar. The bar itself is very small and I felt like I was crowding the people sitting at the high top table behind me. The bartender was very nice but could have used more knowledge of the beer selection. They didn't seem to know much about the style of the beer. 

The second time was after the event. We were running late and I called to let them know (we had reservations at 9) and they were very pleasant and accommodating. When we arrived we sat at a table. One of the first things you notice is the pizza oven with Pizza's constantly going in and out of it. So we had to order pizza and really it's the only thing I've ordered and all I can say is fantastic.  We split two pizza's and took the rest home. We got the Marcherita pizza with white anchovy. The anchovies weren't your typical little salty fish, no, they were large semi-salty fish and the pizza was delicious. The other pizza,which we liked alittle better was the Mushroom and Zucchini, really great mushroom taste. The waitress was very friendly and we enjoyed having her as our server, but again could use more knowledge of the bar.

name: Mazzaro's Italian Market
text: Wonderful little market. If you want great Italian products and good food, this is the place

name: Mr. B's Bistro
text: Food was delicious!! The wait staff seemed a little confused but all in all, it was a good experience.

name: TRiMM Salon Color Bar
text: Nolan is the man to see.. owner / operater the guy knows what he is doing ESPECIALLY with COLOR! I am a 40+ female who does blonde weaves and I was a salon jumper for years and years no one ever did my color just right- either made me too blonde or too dark.. Seriously Nolan nails it every time- even when it is time to add some low lights which is very hard to make right on a blond he gets it exactly how I like it. Yes it is nothing fancy, there will be no expresso machine brewing. Price is super reasonable.. everyone is just laid back- you dont feel silly sitting there with foil in your hair because it really doesnt matter! ha

name: Jazmine
text: YUM! I'd only eating at Sushi Pier and Sushi 7 but this place was much better. My sister and I each had the all you can eat sushi. The miso soup was great, as was the edamame. Moon raspberry sake was a great complement to the meal. I have to say the jasmine roll is delicious. Actually we ordered a few different rolls, everything was great, even the deep fried rolls which I don't usually care for. Nice atmosphere, too.

name: Smoke 'N Barrel BBQ Shack
text: tried them again after several months of staying away. their food graduated a few degrees to just above lukewarm. i will upgrade one star for that alone, BUT, the value has stayed the same as theyve apparently raised their prices. perhaps to make up for all the business their cold food lost them? i would only go back if i were desperate; the foods not worth what they charge.

name: Shere-E-Punjab
text:
This place was kind of hard to find.  The signage from the road wasn't fantastic and it's location is tucked in the back corner of the first building in the shopping center.  When you walk in, however, you're presented with a nicely decorated, well lit (sunlight) indian restaurant with a buffet waiting for you.

Having never been to India, I am unable to comment on the authenticity of the dishes presented.  What I can say was that I really enjoyed the preparations.  Everything I tasted had flavor and it seemed cooked very well.  Even dishes that are the american staples tasted better here than I've had at other places.

On my plate there was palak paneer (very delicious), a samosa, some sort of vegetable ball in a curry sauce and, of course, the ubiquitous chicken tikka masala.  I liked it all.  The masala, which I'm not normally a fan of had a surprising amount of flavor.  The palak paneer still had some of its green characteristic and had a little tang to it.  Nothing was very spicy here, and that doesn't surprise me since it's a buffet.

Service was fine, not thrilling but it got the job done.  At $10 for the lunch buffet I felt like it was well worth it.  My co-workers, who normally aren't adventurous at all even liked it.  I'll be back.

name: Best Buy Harahan
text: I am not a Best Buy fan.  I find the entire model to be a mess.  The employees are consistently rude, misinformed and lazy.  This is place I go to when I want to see stuff in person after doing extensive online research.  I feel forced to shop here because there are no other electronic/appliance stores to compete with this place.  I cannot tell you the thousands of times I have left here frustrated wishing I would've punched someone in the balls before leaving empty handed.  If you're self-sufficient and just need to complete a transaction, e.g., buy a phone charger, it's not too annoying, but expect a line when it's time to check out.  This place sucks.

name: IceMax
text: Literally walked in here. There were 4 patrons being helped. I looked at my watch and waited 18 minutes. No workers even looked in my direction to try to help nor acknowledge me in that time frame. After almost 20 minutes of being the only person in line, I walked right out. BYE!!

name: Heads & Tails Beauty Boutique
text:
I've been coming to Heads & Tails since they opened; I followed Jenne from her old salon because she is, hands down the best waxer I've ever found. I also love that Heads & Tails uses the hard wax. My skin is super sensitive and I've burned a couple times with regular wax (I actually have a scar to prove it).

I've also had my lashes tinted by Erin, and she did an amazing job!

The only problem I have with the salon is the difficulty with getting an appointment - not because they're busy, I understand that part - but because no one ever answers the phone! H&T doesn't have a dedicated receptionist, so usually I have to call 3-4 times for an appointment. It's getting to the point where it's really frustrating. They do have an answering machine, but I can't take callbacks at work.

name: Five Star Pizza
text: Went here with high hopes considering it's handmade and most of the reviews said it was good. It was worse than a little Ceasers Pizza. The sauce tasted like it was from a can like school lunch. The cheese was terrible quality, even though they advertise it's 100% real it,and really isn't. The garlic knots were okay, better than the pizza but was not fond of the chunks of garlic on top. There are so many better pizza places to spend your money.

name: Terance Cochran, OD-Cochrane Family Eyecare
text: Dr. Terance Cochrane has been my eye doctor for 15 continuous years now (I did see him as a teenager before moving out of state in the early 90's).  His service has been consistent and efficient every time.  He stays on top of new advances in eye treatment and is his own patient and an early adopter as well.  We both had Lasik done to our eyes in 2000 (it was hard to argue against Lasik if your own doctor is doing it!).  His staff is all friendly and there is a complete eye wear center on site.  His office also seems to be flexible with insurance carriers - mine has changed about 4 times in the last 5 years and he has accepted them all.

name: Please-U-Restaurant
text:
I make it a point to stop in this little diner every time I go to New Orleans. I wish there were places like this in Chicago - the prices, the food, the neighborhood folk make this a truly authentic New Orleans joint. It's also super easy to get to via the streetcar if you're in the area since it's on St. Charles :) 

That being said - no, don't come here if you wanna be wowed by the decor. This place is delicious, home style New Orleans food served by good New Orleans people and that's it. Go on down the street and pay triple the price for food that would never be up to even 1 compared to the 5 star food they have here.

If you need another reason to go other than the food - well, I absolutely love the owners, Nick and Helen (fellow Greeks :) ). Nick's had the restaurant for over 30 years in the family and even worked in the kitchen himself when he first came over from Greece in his 20s. He knows every recipe you can think of and his shrimp and corn chowder.. oh man, it's the best I've ever had. 

I could go on and on about how lovely this place is  - just go and check it out yourself. I mean, there's a reason it's been around since 1946 right?

name: Styles Brandywine Barber Shop
text:
Warning.  Do not go here unless you have an appointment.  They should just advertise as appointment only or walk-in if a barber knows you.  Sat for over an hour when the check-in system said there were only 2 people ahead of me.  A few people came in and checked in after me (appts don't check in, so these were walk-ins), they knew the barbers, so I got skipped.

I used to come here for my haircuts when I lived in Wilmington, about 2 years ago, but won't ever be back.  Unprofessional.

name: Em J's Cafe
text: Eh. Nothing to call home about. No, wait. There was this small thing... At 8 am this morning they only had one pancake left. Seriously? An establishment that serves breakfast and lunch should really stock up on pancake mix. The food was okay, I landed on French toast, but I'd much rather stick with Dixie Picnic down the street for a less expensive and seriously delicious breakfast or even Nudy's if I want something comparable in price and decor.

name: Mr. B's Bistro
text: Wow the pork chop was awesome and the scallops were cooked to perfection. Seriously those two items were awesome. Really is one of the best pork chops probably from anywhere. The duck egg rolls were good and the sauce is great.  Great stuff. The 201 drink was ok. Had some other drink that was too sweet and switched. Can't remember what it was. Still totally worth the price of scallops and chop.

name: Toyama Japanese Steak House
text:
I love Toyama!!!!!! One of my favorite places to eat in Tennessee. Clean kind and above all a fun atmosphere. The food is great and the bartenders know how to mix one hell of a drink! 
I took my friends 4 year old with me the last time I went all she will eat is chicken nuggets. So I ordered a few things off the menu and told her it was chicken. Now she asks me to take her for sushi every time I see her. Just writing this review makes me want sushi right now. 
Toyama is the best.

name: Federal Donuts
text: Hot donuts. Be careful. Its addictive. and yummy. I don't like the glazed ones though

name: 500 Degrees
text:
For a casual burger place, 500 degrees delivers on taste, quality, service and speed. You can get a 5 star burger in a 3 star amount of time. It's so impressive.

Their selection is truly outstanding. You have your choice of patties, cheeses, toppings and condiments to build whatever burger your heart desires. I believe there are some suggestions as well if you're not feeling particularly creative that day. 

The last time we were there, my boyfriend got the Kobe beef burger, thick cut applewood smoked bacon, a fried egg and Vermont cheddar cheese. He was knocked to the floor, and has been telling everyone about it ever since. I got a simple beef patty with cheese and BBQ sauce. Maybe I need to be a bit more adventurous next time! Nonetheless, I still loved my burger.

Another great thing about 500 Degrees is the option to get your fries with truffle oil. It's just a little extra flavor added to already spectacular crispy French fries. 

I've always had stellar service here. I loved joking around with the woman who served us last time about coming through hell and high water for an as yet undetermined burger since we had come in out of a torrential downpour and it took me 10 minutes to decide what I wanted off of the menu. I blame it on the rain brain.

My only gripe about 500 Degrees is that it can get a little pricey. For burgers, fries and drinks for 2, we paid about $28. That included one Kobe beef patty, but even without it, you're going to pay a sit-down price for what is really a take-out burger. The quality justifies this in many ways, so we'll definitely be back. Save your pennies and splurge!

name: Jazmine
text: Sweet and sour chicken and chicken chow mein were both excellent. I like the chicken cuts in the chow mein. Have also tried the sushi a few times and enjoyed it. A little pricey, but at least it's great food.

name: Fellini Cafe of Media
text: Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in Delaware County! Aside from never having had a bad meal here, I can also tell you their fried calamari is the best. I order it every time.

name: Peno
text:
I came here in a group and they were very nice about accommodating all of us. I loved their basil ginger lemonade, which had just the right amount of sugar.
We shared a bunch of appetizers and two pizzas and everything was rather tasty. I enjoyed the meatballs too! Nothing was particularly memorable but it was a pleasant time and the patio looks like a lovely place to chill on a spring/summer night.

name: Singha Thai Cafe
text:
I'm not about to say that Singha is among the best Thai restaurants, but if you are looking for tasty, inexpensive food in the CBD and have tired of po boys or "hot plate lunches", you could do much worse than to pop into this deceptively large little cafe.
    I don't mean to damn with faint praise-Singha is good, and if the food (the very inexpensive lunch specials in particular) is mostly watered down warhorses of the American-Thai repertoire, that owes more to their desire to stay in business, catering to the mobs of less adventurous office drones that spill out of the surrounding high rises every weekday between 11:30 & 1:00 like clockwork.
      The calamari appetizer is perfectly fried and i have a very warm place in my heart for the Carondelet shrimp. Otherwise, just order what you usually do at your fave Thai joint and ask for more chili paste if you need a more authentic kick.

name: Santa Barbara Shellfish Company
text:
This review is mostly about my friends' dishes and the general impressions I got more so than my own personal taste.

So for starters - I ordered the lobster roll. The dish was not to my liking, but that's because I'm not a fan of celery in lobster rolls. The celery was diced but it was too much and it overpowered the dish. I also found the lobster overdressed. But some of this is just a matter of taste so I won't ding them hard for that.

The rest of the food, given the price, was fantastic. The crab and lobster were all fresh, all cooked correctly, and all at a price that worked. 

It is rare to find a seafood restaurant these days that is reasonably priced and one that serves fresh good seafood. Most are either way too expensive or way too sucky. This is not one of them.

name: Tomo Japanese Steakhouse and Sushi Bar
text: Excellent price for sushi and I love their specialties sushi menu. Snow mountain and Volcano sushi are remarkable sushi!

name: J Gilbert's Wood-Fired Steaks & Seafood St Louis
text:
We live in the neighborhood so finally found the time to visit. I had a fillet mignon with spinach, potatoes and mushrooms. My wife had the lamb with rissotto. 

While the food was good, it wasn't great. My steak seemed not to have any seasoning and was unevenly cooked. Medium on one half while more rare on the other. They talk about the smoky flavor but I thought my wife's lamb looked a bit black. Her seasoned potatoes were OK but she thought the risotto was just so-so. My spinach and potatoes were very good but the mushrooms were nothing to talk about.

We also ordered tomato and mozarella salads and were good. 

Total bill was just under $100 but I was not wow'ed by the food at all.

Service was prompt but plastic. Our waitress might as well have worn a smiley mask and done just as well. I noticed the others seemed to be the same way.

name: Thorntons
text: Best gas station ever. I can't believe I actually have fun going to a gas station. The staff is amazing, and you would think they owned the place with how they keep it up. FREE STOK espresso shots for my coffee are you kidding me? Keep it coming. Rarely you see a great gas station market w/ the prices to match, but Thornton's is the exception to the rule. They always have some awesome promos going on, and staff is eager and ready to assist you. They've gave me a few good laughs. Good work.

name: Ratchada Thai Restaurant and Sushi Bar
text:
There are a few Thai places in DTSP and I would say Ratchada is the nicest. The staff is extremely polite and everything always comes out perfect and they check in to make sure you're doing well frequently. The atmosphere is relaxed and quiet, even when the place is packed. 

The menu features all the traditional Thai staples, I usually get pad thai and its always great. I really like their spring rolls and wonton soup, they both are really fresh and on some visits these are the only two items I've gotten and I was completely filled up. Thai tea is also awesome! 

Check out the crazy bathroom. It's like going into Wonderland.

name: Greek Sotir Grill
text: The service was excellent, extremely friendly.  The food was average, the hummus didn't taste fresh as of that day.  The gyro plate was also average.  For this immediate area, this is about as good as it gets.    Prices are reasonable.

name: Viet Pho
text: Ordered photai, just steak, and the broth is very very bland...had to add a lot of sriracha just to make it taste like anything.   Also, a large bowl is $10...stick to 777 unless you happen to be in the area...also ordered the pork sandwich which was was ok, but not enough meat.  I'm giving 3 stars just because of the service...

name: Foodery
text: Do you like good beer? If so, The Foodery is the best place in CC to buy beer to go. Whether you mix-a-six, buy a six pack of one beer, or buy a few singles, The Foodery has the best selection - you can find beers from all over the USA, Europe, Asia, and probably some places you didn't know exist. They don't have price tags on the beers or in the coolers, but they have a handy notebook that lists all their beers and prices so you won't be too shocked if your mix-a-six adds up to $20.
