text: Just had a very delicious breakfast watching multiple football games at the same time.  Great service, awesome bar, amazing good! We will be back!

name: DanceLine
text: I have a difficult-to-fit foot for dance shoes. Lauren and Sue made the whole process a pleasure. They kept coming out with different shoes and sizes until we found not one, but two, that were perfect. I highly recommend the selection, and wonderful owner and staff here.

name: The Love
text:
Finally made it here on an empty stomach and wasn't disappointed! 

I ordered the Parker house rolls (the bread was just okay but the chive butter was insane), torched broccoli (literally broccoli w hot sauce so felt odd for $8 but was tasty), and the pappardelle with brisket (amazing). 

Overall I left stuffed and pretty pleased with the quality of food. My wallet wasn't as ecstatic but eh, whatever.

name: Kuchi Sushi & Hibachi
text: The hibachi is delicious and everyone is friendly. There are HH specials Monday through Friday which makes it very reasonable (avg $16) and includes salad, soup, rice, noodles and your choice of meat and veggies. The hibachi chef is also entertaining.

name: Sabino Canyon
text: Sabino Canyon is beautiful and has trails suitable for any level of experience. They have picnic areas and decent bathrooms (for a mountain), and paved/unpaved trails. Parking is $5 a pop though, so if you plan on going more than 4 times in a year, just buy the year pass for $20. The year pass gets you into other park sites as well.

name: Henry's Coffee Bistro
text: Not gluten free even though it comes up on the gluten free site.  I ordered 3 egg whites and one whole egg scrambled with spinach. They got that wrong the first time.  Second time they got it right, but the microwave their eggs.  Runny on the outside and rubbery as a hockey puck.

name: Brixx Wood Fired Pizza
text:
We've been to Brixx three times in the last couple months. We really like the food, the people are friendly, they offer call to get in line which makes going convenient. There is also a parking garage next door so you can always find parking, 

I've been eating gluten free and I really like their crust, yummy and not weird at all.

name: 500 Degrees
text:
Checked out this place after seeing a post on uwishunu.com

Went with the 500 burger (lettuce, tomato, cheddar, bacon & special house sauce), truffle fries and a vanilla milkshake. I was starving by the time I'd gotten out of that line, almost a hour wait due to promos they were running with it being grand opening day and all, so I tasted a few of the fries as I walked back to the office, soooooo good! Wish I knew what the plain tasted like to compare not sure if I'm just in love with the truffle oil or if the fries as a whole are just that good either way the prices remain the same rather plain spicy or truffle. 

Then get back to my office and took a bite of the 500, it has bacon, real bacon on it!! Crispy salty in the right places chewy in the right places bacon. I don't know why but I have a hard time buying a good burger sandwich etc that has bacon on it and actually liking it so I was pleased. My burger was well done, and well seasoned, all around good burger. They did give me the wrong cheese however that may have been due to some order confusion so I let that slide and was still good. 

Lastly and my only real complaint is the milkshake. Very Very good no complaints there, the girl who made it however only filled my cup halfway and when I showed it to her, asking why it wasn't filled up she said because they don't have their correct cups yet so that is the actual serving. It looked like a serving for a kids meal so didn't sit right with me. Wasn't satisfied with that but walked away because I was hungry and needed to eat my food but saw that the guy in front of me was eating in and also ordered a milkshake so I asked to see his and there was a very small bit of space left at the very top, went back to let milkshake girl know this and asked the young lady next to me, also with a milkshake to be my witness LOL. She took my cup and put more in and don't think she was too happy about it but I got my reasonably portioned milkshake and it was goooood. And trust me I'm not that knit picky but  for money at that portion wasn't flying with me. Oh also with the milkshake it was more soupy than thick. I didn't mind that about it those that like shakes you need a spoon to actually eat not drink may not feel the same. 

They still get 5 stars from me for now because in the hustle of taking care of so many people, she may not have gotten a good look at my portion and she made up for it. AND they've filled a major burger void I'd been having so they're my new best friends right about now.

name: Meagan Q Macklin
text: Meagan is amazing! She fit me in last minute and gave me one of the best deep tissue massages I've ever had. I went in with lower back pain and discomfort and left feeling amazing. She makes it seem easy. She found every sore spot on me and just fixed it all within an hour appointment. She obviously knows her anatomy well. She also has a welcoming and genuine personality. Do yourself a favor and book with her. You won't be sorry.

name: Cafe Ponte
text: I've been coming here for many years now.   Always a 5 star restaurant to me - great food, and attention to detail.   No matter if you get something from the regular menu, tasting menu, etc. its always a treat.    I've learned to like some favorites, but welcome trying new things here!   Will recommend to anyone - and often do!

name: Clayton Nail Spa
text:
My. Nails. Look. Great. 
I asked for an appt via yelp and received a response in less than an hour. I had to amend my scheduled appointment and I was accommodated. 
I arrived at the new scheduled time and I was greeted and seated. I received an overlay from scratch along with shaping and new polish in less than an hour. 
Excellent customer service!

name: Fresh Gulf Seafood
text: Small, but quaint. Only two seating booths and a bar stool seating. I ordered the snow crab and shrimp steamed special for about $21. It's a good portion for two people and it comes with potatoes, broccoli, and one corn. The seasoning isn't too overpowering, and there's a nice bed of butter at the bottom of the tray to soak the seafood while you eat. They also sell small snacks and chips. Will definitely come again.

name: 1 Tippling Place
text:
Walking down Chestnut street, this place is easy to pass by so- just don't. Go on in (if there's a place to sit) and find a cute upholstered chair or spot on an old leather chair, or snag a spot on a vintage velvet seat next to the window.  Share a couch or sit at the bar and enjoy all that Tippling has to offer. 

Overall, I like and enjoy this place, like the decor, like the drinks and like the bartenders. However, the cocktail list can get a bit pricey.  Two drinks for $34.00? What did we order? The menu is quite fancy and there are a lot of offerings.  I only threw back one egg white whiskey sour (which was delightful) so I need to be sure to come back to check out the rest of the spirits. 

Service took a bit of time, which was odd, since when I was here it wasn't crowded. 

The speakeasy feel is a bit overthrown by the open windows, well lit space and open floor plan but this isn't the 1920's/1930's- prohibition era has ended at last!  Comfortable and perfect for a smaller group.  

Overall, decent place but nothing that left a lasting impression on me

name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
text: My boyfriend and I took his grandparents to Docs to celebrate his grandfathers 60th birthday. We regret going there and I wish we would've taken them to a different restaurant. I made a reservation 4 days in advance and when we showed up they said they didn't see the reservation. We still got a table but it was right up front near the door and it was very uncomfortable. We had trouble getting situated at our high table and his grandparents had an ever harder time. We ordered oysters and none of them were cut properly so we had to scrape them out with our forks before we could eat them. After our appetizers came my boyfriends grandfather had to use the restroom and when we came back he told us there wasn't any soap so he told one of the employees. He intended to go wash his hands when our meals came out so that they would have plenty of time to refill the soap. Our meals came and he went back in the bathroom and the soap still wasn't refilled. Luckily, we had our own bottle of hand sanitizer with us so he had to resort to using hand sanitizer before eating his meal. The worst part is that he ordered a lobster roll. So it wasn't like he was eating with silverware. He had to eat his birthday meal with his hands that he couldn't even get soap to wash. Our total bill was around $160 and I really do not think we should've had to pay $160 for a meal that we couldn't even wash our hands before we ate it. We will never go back to Docs. I actually feel embarrassed we took our guests there to celebrate.

name: Wings Over Broadway
text:
After a long day of riding up and down Mt lemmon, a group of friends and I decided to stop by here to get our beer and wings satisfaction. This was my first time here and I always hear the talk about this place so I was like "Heck Yes!" Let's give this a try. Let's get it, let's go!

This place was packed! It wasn't even Wing's night where they charge only 30 cents a wing! Interested, I was like this place has to be great! The staff members are pretty friendly and are always making sure our trash is taken away often along with getting our refills. Even with it being so busy, they still managed to keep up. 

I ordered a pitcher of blue moon and 2 different flavors of wings. One being Garlic Parmesan and the other being Lemon Pepper. To begin with they were pretty decent size wings. Not too small and puny like an anorexic chicken. The flavor was also delicious! I'd have to say it's one of the top wings here in town. I got my chicken wings naked with the sauce on the side to fully experience each sauce separately. With the right mixture of spice, garlic, pepper and lemon. OMGosh I was in heaven! If it wasn't for my diet I would have eaten a lot more. 

I'd definitely return here, but next time I'm coming when it's wing's night. 30 cents wings!!! You can't beat that!

name: O'Briens Irish Pub
text: Great crowd, cheap beers and not douchey. Most of the staff has been around for years and you can always count on a consistent experience here. This is a great place for live music or game days. Personally this is hands down the best place for St. Patrick's Day. They feature Irish dancers, bagpipes (maybe not traditionally Irish but still cool) and Irish bands (plus green beer). You will never have to fight to get to the bar and there are plenty of areas to sit down and eat/drink.

name: la Madeleine
text:
My wife and I tried this place for lunch and we loved it! You walk in and immediately see all the delicious looking pastries on display. Then, when you remember you came here for a somewhat healthy lunch, you can grab a tray to proceed down the line (grab a menu first if you don't know what you want to order) the first station is the special salads where you get things like a Chicken Caesar salad, etc. (if you get a caesar salad as a side with your sandwich then no need to stop here). Then comes the hot sandwiches/soup station (and finally you order any other food items (like the chicken salade croissant at the register). You pay for your meal and they give you a number to have your food delivered to your table (drinks are not delivered you get your own fountain drink if you choose to pay for a drink). To the side of the fountain drinks there is a complimentary bread station with butter and jelly as well.

I decided to order the infamous the Chicken salade croissant (delicious) w/ a side of tomato basil soup and caesar salad, my wife had the Turkey & Brie sandwich with a side caesar salad... They were both fantastic! We even tried the potato galette and it was extremely tasty. We only wish we had saved room for dessert!

The ambience is very rustic and appealing to the senses. The atmosphere at lunch was very inviting... good flow of traffic and nothing overwhelming, both the customers and employee's had an excellent vibe. We made sure to leave a tip for the food server/bus person even though it was limited service. We will be back!!!

name: Sun Diner
text: Amazing food! Service was fast and very sweet, if you're looking for some amazing breakfast in Nashville this is the place to go! Highly recommend!

name: Old World Coffee Lab - Midtown
text:
Pass. The 6th stop on our coffee quest was a huge disappointment. 
Pros: not busy, not expensive, friendly smile. 
Cons: slow service, messed up order, very limited pastry selection and no way to heat. Loud music. Barking dogs inside. There needs to be a sign on the door saying that dogs are welcome so that if you don't want to eat with someone else's dog you can skip it. 
Unimpressed and not recommended.

name: Cafe DeLuxe
text: I saw a article in the RGJ and decided to go there for lunch.  Very nice staff, odd mix of customers young and old and normal decor for most places now being built (exposed HVAC, not much attention to detail).  The counter seemed inviting for a single diner but behind the counter looked completely disorganized, lots of stuff no one would normally even leave on their counter at home, mostly in dis-array.  Asked a question about the BLT bacon being pre cooked but was assured the bacon was great.  30 minutes later the sandwich arrived, probably the worst BLT I have ever eaten, hard cold bacon, small portion, basically a lousy sandwich.  I had also ordered soup which was good and a side salad which was marginal.  Left the business after spending $14 including the tip hungry, lunch is my main meal of the day.  I think this place has potential, but they need to get rid of the BLT offering and concentrate on providing satisfying portions for people who are not complete vegans or health addicts.  Good luck.

name: Convivio Italian Artisan Cuisine
text: Awesome food, nice environment outside. Just a great experience. We will definitely be back!

name: Sam's Beach Bar
text:
Beachside bar fun.  Great. Ire of the Gulf.   Service is good.  Food is lack luster.   I had the stuffed mushrooms and they were burnt.   The Lobster Bisque was in the sweet side but okay. 

Second time coming to Sams.  The place requires you pay 2.00 to park as it is a state beach.

name: The Saint Hotel, Autograph Collection
text:
This review is overdue. I have stayed here a handful of times, written a review for its restaurant Tempt and forgot to share my experience at the hotel. Here goes: 

I agree with Patty S.. It does remind you of a Miami style hotel. The decor is funky, unique and great for photo ops. The rooms are decent enough.
Most have little sunlight or views. A few offer city or Canal Street views. 

It is located next door to The Ritz Carlton and in front of the Courtyard Iberville. Same building but it has separate entrances.  All three are Marriott affiliated. It is located on the corner of Burgundy and Canal. 2 blocks from Bourbon and a block from Rampart. 

Generally speaking, it is the quieter end of downtown/Canal street hotels but during peak season or during large area events, you will be unable to escape the hustle and bustle. 

There is a pool table, bar and restaurant on the first floor. Breakfast is free for Gold and Platinum members. Wifi is also free for Gold and Platinum members. 

The suites are all located on the second floor and no two suites are alike. The presidential suite is named Lucifer and has views of Canal Street, a pole, strobe light and three flat screen tvs and lots of dark colors throughout. The Raphael suite has a separate tub and shower, large light colored sectional sofa and two tvs, one of which pops up from of a piece of furniture. 

The turn down chocolates are from Sucre' and there are always at least two or three staff members greeting you in the lobby. Voss Sparking water is also given daily. 

Valet Parking is available too.

name: Complete Fitness Results
text:
I LOVE CFR!

After extensive online research, I was impressed by the number of reviews consistently highlighting the personalized, structured attention to each client and CFR's individualized approach to all levels of expertise and physical status - especially focusing on each person's specific needs while creating a streamlined workout that while a challenge (and worthy reward) to maintain and grow within, IS attainable by those with the drive to follow through and invest appropriate effort. Having experienced the failure of several mainstream workout options, including: CrossFit, "sheeple" gyms who thrive off of intimidation style motivation, plus a surplus of environments that failed to provide instruction that gave me a sense of ability to accomplish a goal, these were incredibly appealing attributes for a potential investment of both time and money. After an initial call regarding package and pricing structure, where I received  viable information with a welcoming vibe, and a personalized consultation where my goals were addressed, I was confident in furthering my relationship with a company who saw me not as another dollar sign (but as a long term client) who would take satisfaction not only out of my credit card, but out of pride in helping someone achieve their goals, due to their passion for helping people in a specific skill field.

I have been MORE than happy to continue investing my time here almost solely based on the fruition of the above reasons for joining in the first place. Having had such high expectations, I could have easily been let down once I had paid my fees and started my membership. Exactly the opposite has occurred. I am continually challenged in a way that both exceeds and respects my comfort levels and boundaries. My trainer has adjusted and acted in accordance to the challenges I experience physically and mentally. I have never felt pressured to exert more skill or power than I have available, while being healthily pushed to limits I did not know I possessed. This has resulted in workouts that prove satisfying and intimidating; yet challenging while channeling an inner energy to try harder. The flexibility and attentiveness of all staff members, especially the person focused on my success has strengthened and encouraged me to lengthen my journey and efforts to reach my goals. My relatives and loved ones can attest to my improved outlook and attitude about my physical appearance and abilities - as well as a more positive, relaxed approach and outlook to daily challenges. I can 100% contribute to my current feeling of success and drive to my trainer Mike, the staff, the gym atmosphere and the obvious effort placed in long-term success as opposed to short-term exhaustion and burnt out results.

This is not a "gym". The emphasis on safe, proper form for all exercises is something that has proved unique and appealing in an industry that generally promotes overnight, impossible results (even though my coordination continually embarrasses me!). They may not aim towards leaving you incapable of movement within three sessions, but they certainly instill a value of "quality over quantity" wins the race. Seeing myself and the fellow clientele continue to come back and without fail, further their success level is testimony to the structure and strategy of CFR. I am thankful to finally be achieving goals previously thought unattainable - especially now, newly engaged, I am even more thrilled with my decision to sign-on for additional sessions... going to have to rock that wedding dress somehow - and I know they'll help me get there!

name: The Saint Hotel, Autograph Collection
text:
We just finished our stay at The Saint and we couldn't get out of there fast enough!  We stayed 6 nights and I think this was the worst hotel we've ever stayed in. The  bed was rock hard and so uncomfortable that we had trouble sleeping. We asked for a different room and were told that the would sort it out and call us...they never did call. We followed up with the manager who said she would see what she could do for us. We never heard from her again either. I should say that she offered us a free breakfast buffet for that morning. It was 10:55 when she offered it and breakfast ended at 11. Total slap in the face. 

While our room was clean, we had to request shampoo, etc to be replenished.  They didn't automatically do that.  Our belongings were shoved around to make room for towels, etc and dirty face clothes were left hanging in the bathroom day after day. 

While the location of the hotel is fantastic, we will never stay here again. Stuff can happen during a stay so it becomes about how the staff deals with it. The staff at The Saint just didn't care.

name: Teavana
text:
If you are a tea drinker this is the place for you.   

Drinking tea is more then putting a bag in a cup of hot water.  There is a process and there are tons of choices of tea leaves. 

Plenty of KNOWLEGABLE staff to help assist.

Tea is a bit expensive but then again we never purchased tea leaves before so maybe it's reasonable.

There are free samples.

Since this chain is part of Starbucks you can use your star rewards to redeem tea leaves.  Definitely better then redeeming a cup of coffee.

name: Jack Dempsey's Restaurant & Bar
text:
Tucked in the far side of the Bywater, this place has delicious fried seafood and a quirky, old-timey atmosphere. I'm a huge fan of the catfish, the (towers) of onion rings, and the baked mac and cheese.

Definitely worth a trip if you have a hankering for fried-everything.

name: Grand Lux Cafe
text:
Let me start this review off by saying, after my research on this restaurant I would not have selected it for my Friday night dinner but since my son was celebrating a promotion (and he was footing the tab) Grand Lux it is. 
A step above the Cheesecake Factory with much nicer decor. Very spacious seating area and the open viewable kitchen is nice. 
Service was excellent as they even put up with me requesting to be moved twice. 
Now to the star of the show "The Food". 
Although I wasn't disappointed, neither was I impressed. Portions were big and food presentation was fair. Overall not bad but I've definetly had better.

name: Michael's Grill
text:
Really great service. 

And yes the onion soup is the best in Orlando.

name: Las Cazuelas Restaurant BYOB
text: Love this place! Second time here, but first time for brunch. WHAT A DEAL! Spent $16 on food for 2 people and HAD LEFTOVERS. Love the BYOT and got a pitcher of margaritas. I know dinner is a bit pricier but this is the perfect place for brunch with a bunch of friends looking for great food on a budget.

name: Queen Sushi
text: This place gets how to do it. Online ordering, with tip included! They show up when they say they will. The food! Great sushi for a perfect price. Just love this place.

name: Palladium Theatre
text:
Beautiful building. I've drove by the Palladium so many times and admired the way it looks. It is a smaller theatre with seats in front of the stage as well as an upper seating area.

We attended for an orchestra symphony and the sound was very good. Like others have said, you can sit pretty much anywhere in the theatre and have a good view of the stage. Seats are not too comfortable (wooden and hard). 

Appreciated the audience (no camera flashes or recording), I really enjoyed our night. Parking was a bit tricky, we ended parking about 3-4 blocks away as the garage near the theatre was closed the night we came. Had fun though! Would recommend checking it out. They have a lot of cool shows coming up.

name: The Barbary
text: Every night at The Barbary is a different experience. The general mood is "foggy" and depending on the night, there are a lot of hands in the air slapping the fog to the bass. Every time I would come here, I would see a classmate, Jay Blinsky. It was like it was his home, and I would feel comfortable knowing he was there. Jay wasn't there last night. That is my only complaint. If you get there early, you can get $1 PBRs. The music is always good.

name: Casino Del Sol
text:
I am reviewing the hotel and the conference/meeting rooms.

First, the staff everywhere throughout this whole building is NICE NICE NICE. Everyone was beyond gracious and accommodating. I have zero complaints about the staff. They would obviously go out of their way to help anyone. Every bartender, every catering staffer, every hotel desk person, all of them, were SO customer-service oriented. Excellent all around in this area.

The hotel rooms (standard room, paid $99 a night for a Fri. and Sat. in early August) look nice now because they are relatively new but I am not sure they will hold up over time. Very spacious for such a low price and the views are great. 

However, the room walls are paper-thin. I mean PAPER!! I heard everything (even the normal volume conversations -- in detail--- happening in the room next door). My neighbors also had a baby that cried for over 3 hours one day which made napping impossible. I have never heard so much through a hotel room wall before. This is a definite problem and I suspect they hear a lot about it from patrons.

Another review mentioned that the room lighting is bad. This is true. It was nearly impossible to put on makeup even though they had a nice magnification mirror in the bathroom. I tried every spot and couldnt find a place with lighting. I ended up sitting by the window because it was still daylight and holding up my tiny compact on the couch. This is a small but highly frustrating thing for a woman. 

The shower and bathrooms are very nice in the rooms. High quality and the water was warm. I really liked the bathroom. So clean, too!

The TVs are pretty neat because you can check-out on them. 
The free wi-fi was spotty and made me login again on their page over and over. 

The AV in the meeting rooms was cruddy. The mics went in and out and had a lot of interference. However the system is built-in rather than set up like most AV places, so I guess you get what you pay for.

The art in all the conference rooms was gorgeous but it was so cold in all of them that I left my meeting to go defrost. I am not an "always cold" person -- lots of other people were frosty too.

Conference room catering was good for the most part. Some things were high quality and delicious, others felt and tasted very mediocre chain-like. Hit and miss.

The pool was always crowded with families. Not a relaxing environment at all. 

Spa service menu was very reasonably priced but not a lot of options. No deep tissue massage?!

I would go back. I want to try the steakhouse.

name: Tabu Lounge & Sports Bar
text: As a resident of the United States who has lived here for 21 years, and as an adult, I was refused service today because my passport wasn't stamped. I am undocumented, which explains my unstamped passport, but my passport is a legitimate form of identification, government issued. The hipster bouncer (I wish I had his name) white, pale and an ego full of unfounded power told me that because I was undocumented, I needed to leave because he wouldn't take my passport. I just want to say that it's illegal to a) go through a passport as if you were homeland security, not even TSA can do that and b) he targeted me for identification, my white friend was told he didn't need to provide ID. So beyond whatever he says his intention is/was, what it seems to me is that this bar needs to educate its staff about diversity issues. I'm not an underage college kid trying to sneak in and get a drink, I am an adult trying to exercise my age-right to drink. This was unacceptable. I come from Texas where they understand these issues, it saddens me that I had to feel discriminated against as I'm in Philly to enjoy my research conference. Horrible experience.

name: ShopRite of Whitman Plaza
text: Always on the looko for manager's special at dessert section at front andc the back. I found Cheesecake Factory Brown baguette. You bake it at home for five minutes and you will get amazing two loaves of soft, light, and moist, warm bread. You can eat it the whole thing.

name: Pravda!
text: Interesting bar. It was empty when we went in but it had a very cozy atmosphere. The drinks were cheap and it's a great place to relax and have a chat with someone. The decor in this place was really interesting. Everything to creepy paintings to mismatched lamp shades made this place stand out.

name: Yah Mon
text: This place was by far the best food we had around Tampa. We were very pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere upon walking into the restaurant. The decorations and atmosphere were very fancy, but we still felt comfortable wearing jeans. The service we received was fantastic. Our waiter was able to help us with anything we needed, was very attentive, and had great recommendations. We started with the beef empanadas and chicken empanadas which were some of the best I have ever had. We also got the cheese bread which was delectable and so soft and moist. For my entree, I got their sampler plate which came with the chicken curry, which was out of this world tender and very tasty, the jerk chicken, which was way to spicy for my liking, and the brown stew which was also very good. Other than the spiciness of the jerk chick, which is how it is supposed to be, I have nothing I could even think to complain about this place. By far the most tender and tastiest curry chicken I have had. If I lived anywhere near this place, I would be a regular, and would order the curry chicken everytime.

name: BAP
text: Very small and casual. Counter walk up with sit down and take out options. Fast, kind service. If you are looking for solid, quick, cheap bibimbap, this is the place for you!

name: Creole House Restaurant & Oyster Bar
text: Food is tasty but service really bad. They had some poor guy in charge of preparing the char broiled oysters and bar tending. Just a bad set up and a management issue. The guy was a nice guy just poorly managed.  Very rude and incompetent manager Dorothy.

name: M.L.Rose Craft Beer & Burgers - Sylvan Park
text: ML Rose is the bee's knees! Nite owl burger was out of this world and we loved the bottle caps (fried pickles). Service was great, cant wait to go back

name: The Cuban Sandwich Shop
text: Absolutely amazing! We loved both sandwiches we ordered: the Pan con bistec and El Cubano. We opted out of any sides which was ok- the sandwiches are huge and well worth the price. Next time we are in Broad Ripple, we will be returning! The gals running the place were so nice and made the experience even better :)

name: Besito Mexican Restaurant
text: This is such an amazing place, great service, large list of cocktails & mescals and the food is as good as anyplace in Tampa Bay. Andreas has done such a great job and this place deserves all the wonderful reviews you see on Yelp. Highly recommend!!!

name: Emmanuelle
text: nice cozy place offering good cocktails...I wanted to try out the few of their single malt scotch, and bartender was very helpful and he poured little ounces of scotch on the glass and let me try out before ordering a full glass.   i will definitely hit up this place again, when i'm hanging out at northern liberties

name: Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen
text: Tried it because we have tried all the other chains in the area. Nothing new here. The service was horrible , food was ok. Typical for this area. When your competing against other average chain restaurants your standards don't have to be all that high. They met the minimum. Not much higher.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
text: I like to test places out during restaurant week. This Ruth's Chris in particular treated the restaurant week customers like a nuisance. The service was not attentive and the portions were laughable. Think I'll stick with Morton's when I'm in center city.

name: Tower Grove Farmers' Market
text: I love this farmers' market for the variety and the location. There is always a nice selection of produce, but there are also artisan breads and cheeses, herbs and sprouts, and plenty of homemade goodies. Prices are what you'd expect (you get what you pay for), and people are always friendly. I love their expanded hours, and Tower Grove Park is a beautiful spot to spend a couple of hours!

name: Americano - Freestyle Tapas Bar
text: Not worth it. There are so many great restaurants in Nashville I wouldn't waste your time here. The best party about this place is their shine-grias (moonshine, margarita, and sangria) but besides that our brunch had 9 guests and everyone's food was bland. Not to mention they messed up or checks too. Nice manager but not a spot is return to.

name: Al's Finger Licking Good Bar-B-Que
text: Oh my goodness...Definitely finger licking good! We live an hour away and would not hesitate to drive an hour to eat here. The staff is very pleasant and friendly too!

name: East Beach Grill
text: We had a great breakfast by the ocean here at East grill. The pancakes were great very tasty, the coffee was nice and strong, and the waitress checked often to see how we were. There was ample parking to the side, but don't park on the street that's 15 minutes only. We had a lot of overcast today but I can see this place being very popular on clear days. We are definitely coming back.

name: Wildflower Cafe
text: Thanks to yelp for helping us find this place!  It was amazing!!!  The food was delicious and the atmosphere perfect.  I had biscuits and gravy - so yummy!!  My husband had eggs, bacon and cheesy grits...  to die for!  When we are back in the area we will definitely return here.

name: Josef's Vienna Bakery & Cafe
text:
This is the second time my husband and I have come to Josef's - expressly to get an assortment of cookies - so I can't speak on behalf of the meals they serve.

Just before the holidays, we came in to get a dozen cookies. Since they were just for my husband and I, I thought even 12 cookies was extravagant. There was only one gal behind the cash register helping a short line of customers. The service was VERY slow. When our turn came, I mentioned that I wanted just an assortment of cookies. Immediately, the gal tried to HARD SELL me on the pre-made-up platters of cookies that were heaped on a large table in the entrance area. I kept saying "NO, that's too many!" But she just wouldn't listen, and kept telling me that this assortment was ready to go. 

When I *finally* got her to listen to me - the customer - I told her I wanted just one cookie from each line in the top two shelves of the display cabinet. Over and over and over and over I had to repeat this ridiculously simply request. Even my hubs was wondering if the gal understood English? She kept asking what we wanted, and then 15 min into putting some of the cookies into a box, I said, "So what have we got here?" And she said, I've got 5 cookies - what else did you want? Seriously, it was like some kind of skit on SNL. How difficult is it to grab ONE each of SIX different cookies on TWO shelves? We got the cookies and I have to admit: they were DELICIOUS! I think cookies (and probably cakes & pastries) baked at the holidays are bound to be good and fresh because of the turnover.

Flash forward to yesterday. We returned with a sweet tooth to get just six cookies for us. One gal behind the counter was on the phone as we approached the cash register. She remained on the phone a couple of minutes (with no greeting whatsoever), then hung up and disappeared in back. Um. OK. Anyone HOME? After waiting 5 minutes, a different gal came out to take our order. This time, we got the cookies we asked for and went home to try them. HORRIBLE! 

We took a bite from 4 of our 6 cookies purchased, and found they tasted like rock hard sawdust. I am not kidding. I bake cookies myself, and I know that when you bake them fresh - DAILY - they should be moist and tender. Yes, they look pretty all dolled up in frosting and daubs of jam, but the flavor is absolutely flat - not a hint of butter or sugar in them. I guess they use lard? I also suspect that the cookies stored under the hot lights of the display case are not only dried out beyond repair, but were probably baked a good week ago. I broke a Cary cookie in half and it just shattered like glass! The cookie was dry as a biscotti, and tasted like some kind of stale dog biscuit. 

These cookies are an insult to Josef (if he is even alive and cares what is baked and sold in his store). We will not be returning to Josef's again for ANY dessert of any kind ever. I was so mad about these stale biscuit cookies I chucked them all in the garbage. Money down the drain. 

You may as well get a small cookie or two at Whole Foods, or even a small box of infinitely fresher cookies at Trader Joe's! Josef's so-called Vienna Bakery is a total Fakery.

name: National Pizza Company
text: Update: We ordered their St. Louis-style pizza and the garlic knots last weekend and loved it! Next we're going to get the Chicago-style pie. Highly recommended!

name: Social Gastropub
text:
Should be a 2.25 total rating. Here is The Good The Bad The Ugly and Low Down Foo

The Good- I am struggling to find something amazing about it. I wouldn't say good but just ok the Cuban and Mac and cheese (needs salt and pepper). Our waiter rocked though.

The Bad- not sure I would classify this as a gastro pub based off 3 factors: 

1. the ambiance it's more of a sports bar/ banquet with white linens, weird wall paper, big screen tvs playing sports and a big wide open space, a true gastro pub should have a cozy or rustic vibe that makes you want to relax and enjoy it. 

2. Should have extensive craft beer and cellar beer list... I believe  they had 20 beers most were domestic bud, bud light and the like. 

3. The food should be out of the box or fun plays on food. But it was just ok those Blue Chips where very bad though...Very bland blue sauce that seemed to be mixed with whole milk and was watery and tasteless. They could make it  amazing with chunks of blue, thicker sauce and something more to cut the salt on salt flavor.

The Ugly- craft beer 101 don't bring me a beer with a frosted mug it makes you seem like you don't know what your doing. You do not ever ever ever bring a beer in a frosted glass it waters the beer down. Also live band outside was way to loud.

The Low Down Foo- I think this place has an identity crisis... It's called a gastro pub but does have any of the features of one... But looks like a sport bar / private even space. 

I wish them the best but they just don't have any reason to get us back... Out of the 3 categories we rate gastro pubs this one failed all 3.

name: Kanella
text:
My favourite BYOB has now also turned into my favourite place to lunch at! 

I finally made it down to Kanella in the daytime; thought the cozy dimly lit taverna style restaurant, with albeit consistently mouthwateringly delicious food, would loose some of its flare in the AM, but oh how I was wrong. 

I admit, I was more than a little suprised when I read Esquire's choice of best breakfast (does Kanella even do breakfast?). But when I arrived at Kanella around noon, sunlight was streaming through the giant windows, highlighting the lovely bouquets of flowers and potted plants, and upon glancing over the breakfast/brunch/or lunch menu, I saw the same simple sophiscation, and understood why Kanella had got the vote.

My party of three ate family style, sharing the Kanella platter (fantastic, and I mean the BEST stuffed grape leaves I have ever tried; light and fluffy zuccini fritters; a nicely dressed salad; and more) accompanied by the Yemen Pastry (fried yes, but utterly light, crisp, and savoury) with spicy tomato salad, and last but not least the Cypriote Breakfast, complete with grilled haloumi, perfectly fried eggs and lounza, a salty ham...wow was it all soooo very good! 

To top it off I indulged in my second cup of the day, and was amazed to find a restaurant that offers a strong cup of coffee! 

Moreover I finally met the other owner, and chef's other half, his very lovely wife who helped serve us, and was just as welcoming and warm as her husband.

As always I left Kanella, completely satiated, and already pondering my next return.

name: Fox Fitness
text: Becky is a down-to-earth trainer who makes you feel comfortable within yourself and your capacity to train. She is very conscientious of your limitations and works around them to ensure you get a great session. She has a realistic approach based on science and not fad, which makes her training easy to follow without feeling like a failure. The best trainer in town for sure!

name: Ham + Bone
text: This store moved to my boyfriend and Is neighborhood and we couldn't be more happy. It has such a cute selection of quality dog products. Not overstocked or overwhelming, but enough selection to keep even the pickiest dog owners coming back for new things. The owner is so nice, also! I  make up excuses to come in every few days and just look around because it's so cute inside! Highly recommend! My dog does too!!

name: Fort Ben Pub
text:
Heather was my waitress and a bartender.
Everything I tried was fabulous.
I had tenderloin sliders with the french fries oh my.
God I will be going back here as often as I possibly can

You will not regret trying this place

name: Akira
text: Had a dinner there with my family last night. Hibachi. The place is nice but loud, which is fine. The food was good. However, the service is the most horrible I have ever experienced. We were at the table at 7:40.  The waitress, who seemed to be serving about 6 hibachi tables by her self, didn't show up till 8.  Got the water and wine glasses and 8:15.  Soup at 8:30. Salads at 8:45.  Finally at 9:05 the chef showed up. The waitress seemed annoyed for most off the time.  Not helpfully with the menu. Not interested in her job and overworked.  The chef was not engaging with us and boring compare to some other hibachi Restaurants. At the end two people at our table were over charged had to argue with the manager. I think if this place won't change it's attitude about costumer service and do something about it they will go down very fast.

name: Tria Cafe Wash West
text:
I spent two years in Philadelphia for graduate school and Tria was by far my favorite place in the whole city!  I strongly suggest getting one of their membership cards, which offers rewards for frequenting the establishment (such as a $50 gift card). 

Tria has a great happy hour (5-7) which offers different lists of wine, beer, and cheese at discounted prices. My friends and I always ordered food from there menu and we loved EVERYTHING! I especially love the asparagus salad with white beans, beets with feta cheese, and their lavender pistachio honey drizzled bruschetta.  Their lemon square dessert is amazing as well!   Their menu does change seasonally throughout the year, which I think is nice.  Their variety of wine, beer, and food offers guests a chance to try new items every visit.

You cannot get reservations at Tria, but they have a decent turn over for smaller groups.  It is more difficult to go with a large group of people, but if you are willing to split up into smaller groups it is well-worth the wait!

name: Maynards
text: Had the house martini fab We were a group of 4 so had mushroom, frites,Mac and lobster.,pasta of the day and trout. Everything was great. My mom asked for tartar sauce  for trout embarrassing and did not need.Trout was a beauty on its own. Lovely dinner with great value. Would go back next week.Service wonderful one of the best restaurants we've been to $120 For 4 We will always go agai

name: 1911 Smoke House Barbeque
text: Amazing food, great service!  Just passing through town on Memorial Day and stopped here because my husband wanted baked beans. We ordered way too much food and everything was absolutely delicious. Never had such good bar food before. If we're ever back in Trenton, we will be stopping in to eat again!

name: Peppermill Reno
text:
Most Reno hotels are dumps, but this is not the case with the Peppermill. We stayed in the Tuscan Tower suite and it was very nice. Think comfy bed and large jetted tub!

I tagged along to my boyfriend's work event so I decided to go to the spa while he was at his conference. WOW! I loved it. It was so relaxing and tranquil. The staff was gracious. I had an hour long massage which granted me access to the spa all day. I enjoyed the indoor pool, sauna, and outdoor patio. You can order lunch and wine by the pool. I had a chicken wrap and chardonnay...=perfect day!

At night they have a small bar with live music...and the band was good! They also have an outdoor patio with fire pits off the dance club that is a fun place to have a drink.

Overall it was a nice trip. They often have specials on Amazon Local and Groupon for the Tuscan Tower suites. If you are going, spend a little extra and get one of these rooms vs. the regular rooms...its worth it.

name: Edley's Bar-B-Que - 12 South
text:
I love BBQ, and since moving to Nashville I have tried to find BBQ that I love as much as Dreamland or Full Moon. Edley's comes close. I got the pork plate with mac and cheese and green beans. The pork was tender and flavorful. It had smokey flavor with out going over board. The sauce is a good blend of sweet and spicy. The mac and cheese was baked and was made w/ real cheese. The green beans were flavorful but nothing special. 

My friend got the BBQ nachos. Of course, I had to have a taste and they were awesome. First of all the chips were house made potato chips instead of corn chips--awesome. The portion was huge and the toppings were very fresh and flavorful. 

We were there at lunch on Wednesday. They were steadily busy but service was prompt and attentive. 

I will definitely be returning to Edley's. There are a lot of other things on the menu I can't wait to try.

name: Tokai Sushi Hibachi Steakhouses
text: Very fun habachi location, the chefs are very animated and interactive. Great spot for birthdays especially if your looking to draw insane amounts of attention to the birthday guest. Food was also tasty.

name: Hellas Restaurant
text: Hellas is where I go to get  great Greek Food ,especially when they have there Greek Dining, Music and Dancing  outside by the marina ,   I like the atmosphere and there food is always consistent , which is very important to me , Sponge Docks is a great fun place to go out for the evening ,

name: The Buffet
text:
For the record let me state "I am not a buffet person" That said, we had comp tickets to the buffet and show. As far as buffets go all the major players i.e.: Atlantis, Peppermill, Harrah's, Eldorado all have good buffets. The Eldorado is the top of the heap though. 

Here's why. The Mushroom Ravioli is exactly the same as they serve in La Strada, if you went there for this alone, it's a hands down winner. 
They also had tender well seasoned beef brisket and baby back ribs, prime rib, wood fired oven pizza, gelato, all for $12.99, case closed. 

Here are some buffet dining tips, for out of towners. (These apply anywhere) Avoid things that spend a lot of time in the warming trays, and scoop from the back of the tray, always hit the carving stations and fresh made stations. 
I'm sure if you can wait 6 minutes a new pizza will be coming out.

name: Hendricks BBQ
text:
Food was bland. Potato salad, creamed spinach & cole slaw had no flavor. Ribs were tough and underdone. Veggie burgers were seasoned well but possibly not even cooked or barely heated up. At the least. Hush puppies & fries were good. Kids mac-n-cheese was OK. Wait staff was very friendly and did a great job. 
Expensive considering the poor quality.

name: Pho Voorhees
text: Only eaten here once, the food was good. Traditional menu with some stir fry items. Service was good also. I had the pho with all the variety of meats. The beef tendon was not what I was use to.

name: Provisions Coffee & Kitchen
text:
Today was our first visit.  My husband tried two different varieties of cold brew and enjoyed each.  I had the mango iced tea and the blueberry rooibos.  Both were flavorful and a nice size.  We also tried the peanut butter balls, which are incredible.

The service was friendly and fast, and the cafe had plenty of comfortable seating.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere and look forward to coming back.  I've never seen any cafe with as many cold brew coffee varieties.

name: Hendricks BBQ
text: It may be the best in STL, but there is much better Q 313 miles NE in Chicago. Try Smoque BBQ the next time you travel to the Windy City.

name: El Arado Mexican Grill
text: A largely forgettable mexican restaurant in fountain square.  It's cheap, it's decent, it's a pretty straight forward place to get a burrito. Nothing special here, but it will fill you up on the cheap.

name: Cycle Exchange
text: Horrible customer service and unprofessional. First time we came here nobody even greet us. So we said lets give it a second chance my brother in law was actually going to purchase a Yamaha r1 2012 he gave a deposit and very next day went to complete transaction. Well here's the issue it was like bait and switch when he originally went to see the bike he took a pic of the price tag and vin info the price was actually 9,299.00 but when we went the next day they had increase the price by 1000.00 they said it was a clerical error. Also the manager reference that online was the correct price. I"d say really "BS" For customer satisfaction to gain and retain business as I myself work in customer service sometimes we need to accept our mistakes. Para lo que no entienden son gente sin educacion y no tienen buen servicio de cliente le dicen un precio y cuando le van a cobrar es otro.

name: HipCityVeg
text: I'm a first timer and was excited to stop in here for lunch today. The nuggets and sweet potato fries were overly greasy and soggy. I will not be back.

name: Jhonnys Pest Control
text:
I had my condo tented a few weeks ago. We came home 2 days later to find dog poop was shoved in the cracks of the floor rocks in the back yard. The whole back yard smelled horrible!! 
We collect our dog poop for a week and put it in a bucket until trash day, we also add a little dirt to the bucket to keep the smell down. We forgot to through it out before the tenting and left the full bucket in the yard.  
I called Jhonny's and asked for someone to come out and explain why they did this and clean it up.
Two days later someone came over to look at it. They didn't bother cleaning it up and they lied, saying they got dirt from the ground and not the bucket. I told Jhonny's employee it was to much of a coincidence that the bucket of poop was entirely empty and the area where they had to add dirt smelled of poop. The employee continued to lie about where he got the dirt from, but agreed to have someone come by the following Monday and/or someone from there office would call me to set up an appt. 
As of today no one called, no one showed up.

name: Once Upon A Child
text: This place has the worst customer service! We were the 2nd in line to sell clothing, and by the time they get to ours they don't even look the just start throwing things to the side without even looking at them... They are rude!!! Take your time to drive elsewhere!!! It's worth it to use the gas and pass this place

name: Cafe DeLuxe
text: Great atmosphere,  service and food.  Love the menu, simple yet options are full of lots of flavor. Prices are great and food came out fresh and yummy. Very refreshing option from the local compition (from what I saw at least).

name: Tennessee Brew Works
text:
Atmosphere was top notch.
Beer was decent.
Kid friendly, modern decor, outdoor seating, kid-friendly.

name: Pet Supermarket
text:
My husband and I always stop in to look at the rabbits and enjoy the free petting zoo before subjecting ourselves to the drudgery that is shopping at Winco on the weekend... That's why you should always wash your produce folks!!! 
Well. 5 weeks ago my husband and I purchased our beloved Tzatziki Zeke, a 4 month old pineapple green cheek conure from this store. We were told that he came from a breeder here in town who hand raises them and that she is where they source all of their conures. I cannot speak highly enough about the dispositions of her birds! He had been in the store for just over a month and they admitted that he hadn't gotten much interaction due to the other larger birds in the store. We purchased him after going to see him 3 times over 4 days. The sun conure and parolettes of her's were also all really sweet! We were concerned it'd take a long time to earn Zeke's trust considering he had spent a quarter of his life in the petstore even if he was previously hand raised. From his first night home he has been an absolute dream. He has brought so much joy to our lives. We have even proclaimed him the best pet ever (just don't tell our cat and two dogs).  Honestly, you really don't know what you're missing out on until you've cuddled a bird! Anyhoo. Since acquiring our feathered friend we've spent a small fortune on various toys and other supplies and of all the places we've gone to look, we have found that when it comes to furnishing a birdie abode no other pet store offers more selection. I agree with the previous poster's comment regarding the cleanliness of the ferrets cage... I do see definite room for improvement there, but they are doing a lot of things right. If they focused on the animals enclosures a bit more and brought their pet presentation up to the level of their broad selection of well organized pet care products, I think they'd have the best pet store in town. We will definitely be back.

name: Margaritaville - Nashville
text:
Three stars is pretty much on the money. I don't understand a Margaritaville in Nashville but I also am probably not the actual target demographic of these places...see: my dad who sometimes makes me think he can't find anything else on his XM radio other than Margaritaville. 

So we've of course been to the one in the Caymans and on Key West. Since clearly these are out of the way places, I didn't get in the way of my parents having their experience here. 

I was kind of hoping to avoid listening to music...or at least if I was going to have to listen to covers, NOT "Call Me Maybe" gone country. It's somewhat loud in here and I imagine as the night goes on it's louder. We were here prior to a hockey game but it was still pretty busy. 

Since I procured my family a free app coupon I decided I was worthy of the 5 o'clock somewhere which is a take on a Hurricane, which somehow in five years of legal drinking I have never had before. It wasn't bad. I imagine it's one of those things where you're like "oh this barely tastes like alcohol, I'll have another" and then suddenly you're hitting on someone you shouldn't be hitting on. Wait what.

For that free app, we had the spinach artichoke dip. It wasn't bad, I certainly wouldn't have let anyone pay full price for it though. 

I wasn't feeling like having a full on sandwich or anything but there aren't really any smaller sized options. I guess a cup of soup but I had had soup for lunch and it was like obscenely hot for December so that was out of the question. I decided to just get the chicken quesadilla app and if I didn't finish it then whatever. The rest of my family had burgers or a chicken sandwich. The burgers were liked all around, although my brother got the diablo one and complained that it wasn't spicy enough. But I don't think he understands that poblanos aren't that hot.

The quesadilla wasn't bad, there were some spots though where the chicken was a bit tough. Nothing you can't fix with a good bit of salsa though. 

Even though like I said it was pretty busy, we were there only about an hour. Service was great. Would I come back on my own? Probably not. In my case it's really one of those places where once is enough for the experience but if I were asked to come again, I wouldn't say no.

name: The Irish Pol
text:
Many reasons why I love Irish Pol.

1. Beers on tap are of wide variety and bountiful!

2. Located in Olde City, within walking distance of everything you need.

3. First level has that smalltown cozy irish bar feeling that ignites a warm fuzzy sensation.

4. Second floor feels like your walking into a modern martini like bar, pinky fingers extended is a must.

5. Two words... Stoner...Platter.   Everything that is wrong for you but right when it's well past your bedtime and you've spent your entire night drinking. It's a huge platter of fried goodness!!! French fries, onion rings, mozzerella sticks, fried pierogies and thats naming just a few!

Yum

name: AM@FM
text:
Okay, where do I begin?  So much L O V E for Arnold Myint and his amazingly random and wonderful restaurants.  This one is my favorite spots in Nashville so far for casual, no-pressure dining.  Here's my top 5 as to why:

1. I got half of a turkey sandwich, a side of sesame-chili eggplant salad, freshly homemade potato chips, mint lemonade, and a perfect slice of a Mexican chocolate-coconut brownie to round off this most refreshing meal for under $10 with tax and tip.

2. I love the farmer's market relaxing, open atmosphere, and I love even more that am@fm has a "bar" style seating available where the staff waits on you.  Such a cute, well-decorated nook!

3. The options that they offer may SEEM limited upon first glance, but if you read the descriptions of each sandwich and salad, you soon realize that your options are in fact limitless.  The little refrigerator you see before you boasts such a fantastic variety of styles and flavors and sings to anyone who walks their way.  Vegan?  No problem!

4. I hate going to restaurants where I immediately think: "I could make this myself, only better."  That thought never crossed my mind here!  They play on very simple food items (sandwiches, salads, chips, brownies), and just pump up the volume on them by adding great flavors through savory/sweet spices, and an interesting new play on added ingredients.

5.  As an added bonus, they have an AWESOME touch pad to pay for your food (if you pay by credit card).  They check all of the items you purchased, and hand it over to you to add tip and sign.  Then it e-mails you your receipt!  Love the environment-friendliness of it all!

Hit up this spot for the freshest, most delicious under $10 well spent!

name: Northside Shoe Repair
text:
Despite reading these poor reviews, I still went by here because it was the only place I could find in SB. 

I can only repeat others recommendations not to go.

I went in on a Tues for new linings in my shoes. Was told to come back on Friday, and that it would be $25 (seemed a little high but I have little experience with shoe repairs).

Returned Monday to pick up the shoes - spent 10 mins waiting around while they randomly and idly perused the shop looking for my shoes. They had no idea where they were. Finally 10 mins later they found them, and they hadn't been touched. I took them back and walked out.

Nuff said.

name: Catrina's
text: Came here for lunch with my family. The queso dip is amazing. Margaritas are good and the burrito was delicious. Not only was the food fantastic but the staff here is very friendly and very fast service. We all agree we will definitely be coming back. Definitely our new go to Mexican restaurant.

name: Pure Design
text: Pure design is just fantastic and always exceeds my expectations. They are so creative with their floral arrangements. The flowers and greens are always so fresh and vibrant.  They also were able to meet a deadline delivery on short notice.  I highly recommend them

name: Yats
text: Unbelievable.  I moved away to the east coast a few years ago and I always make a point to eat here every day that I am back.  Simply the best.

name: Prep & Pastry
text: Best grilled cheese ever!! Go early or be prepared to wait for a table especially on a weekend. We went there on Memorial Day weekend and waited 45min for a table for two. I had the duck confit hash and hubby had the grilled cheese. The had a new pastry chef who messed up the dough for their famous dossant that day so obviously they were terrible. We went back a few weeks later and had their strawberry and maple bacon dossant. I liked the strawberry one better. Parking is limited so you may have to park on the street. Oh and their scones and monkey bread are pretty good too.

name: Mad Mex - Wynnewood
text: This place is lit my dude, the prices are great and so are the portions. The decor is cool and gives it a chill vibe with an open space so you don't feel suffocated. I'm definitely going to come here again.

name: Hellas Restaurant
text: We stopped in while exploring Tarpon Springs for the first time. We were seated immediately even though the restaurant was bustling. Our server, Soula, was very personable and gave us her genuine opinion when we asked. I ordered the Greek Style Scallops and they were very good. My friend ordered the combination plate which was really good if you have not had Greek food and want to try multiple things.

name: 101 Taiwanese Cuisine
text:
Best beef noodles in town, I love their beef noodle soup, fried tofu, chicken with basil, I think almost all their food on their menu are really authentic Taiwanese Cuisine and another great deal is their price are very reasonable and affordable.

Place and environment are always clean, I'm so happy for them that they expanded their place they have more tables now than before.

name: Cafe Envie & Espresso Bar
text: Good croissant, brie, egg sandwich!  Nice lattes, delicious hash browns (almost like a potato latkes).  We enjoyed the tables outside on the sidewalk.  I appreciated the accessible bathroom, but it needed a good scrubbing

name: JW Marriott Indianapolis
text:
Though top notch service is demanded at a JW, I was thoroughly impressed with the property, service, and staff. 

I only had two complaints. One was the noise level as there was an outdoor concert until 11pm. The other was the below average bartender at velocity during lunch. Nothing terrible, but lacked enthusiasm and desire to give good service. Obviously the concert wasn't the hotel's fault. The bartender issue wasn't worth dropping the rating a star. 

Overall, the GM of the hotel seems as though he/she has it together. Thanks to all the staff for a nice stay.

name: District Donuts Sliders Brew
text:
Can you say Amazing!! And how many languages can you say it in? I was extremely happy with everything from the service, to the cold brew (best ever), to the sliders, to the waffle fries, to the last but for sure not least the donuts! Yes, I tried everything! The cold brew coffee is perfection! Honestly of all the cold brew or other ice coffee I have had in the past, nothing comes close! The cold brew at District is full bodied & out of this world!!!! Order it!!  I enjoyed the burger slider, the chicken slider, and the Bulgogi slider. (Bulgogi = Korean BBQ beef tenderloin, Asian pear-rhubarb slaw, Kim chi mayo). The sliders were all perfectly crafted! I would suggest to everyone don't mess with the sliders. Meaning, order them how they are presented in the menu because they are well thought out. The fries were great just add salt and pepper or try with the cheese sauce. I did salt and pepper today. For the grand finale, donuts! The brown butter pistachio donut is wonderful! It's light and flavorful, and the best donut I've ever eaten!
I've eaten my fair share over the years. 
I will be recommending District to everyone I come across from now on, and I'll be back for more!!!

Extra note: District has off the street parking. It's easy to miss because the sign is covered up, but it's there. Parking lots are rare on Magazine street, and the meter maids are no joke here.

name: Bagger Dave's Burger Tavern
text: Giving it two stars because the food is actually pretty good, when you finally receive it. The service is slow and the food is way over priced. Don't waste your time calling ahead for a to go order, you will still wait for it.

name: The Smiling Elephant
text: Amazing pad thai!!! Fresh flavorful and oh so good!!! Massaman curry and fresh summer rolls are great too!!!

name: Peppermill Reno
text:
I absolutely cannot stand Reno. My HOT August Nights era is long gone and I have had no desire to come back to Reno ever since. Lucky for me I had two weddings to attend in Reno this year that I dreaded only because they were in Reno!

As much as Reno is not for me, I must say if you are going to have to come here you might as well stay at the nicest hotel/resort there is. Yes, the Peppermill. It's no Vegas hotel but it's the closest thing they have.

The suites are very nice. I highly recommend the Veranda suites in the Tuscany tower. They are huge suites with several amenities and a private patio. Do not stay in room T 320. We somehow got booked in that same room each time. It has the worst odor like chemicals. I had to have them bring a humidifier to help clear the stench and it really did not help. I truly became a fan of this hotel when I got a massage at the spa. Wow, this spa blew me away! It's 4 levels of pure bliss! Next to the massage itself, the relaxation room is heavenly. 

The pools are beautiful, they offer cabanas and poolside wait services for food and drinks. The restaurants are not that great - poor service. Room service was accurate and prompt each time. Make sure to get a player's card before gambling to rack up those points. We have not paid once for our stays due to comps.

name: Desi Village Indian Cuisine
text: Had one good experience here for dinner. On our 2nd visit my girlfriend found a small stone in the appetizer - almost like a piece of gravel.  What's really bad is that they didn't offer to take anything off the bill.  I had to ask for the app to be taken off, then they did.  Lamb was tender the first time, then tough the 2nd time.  There won't be a 3rd time.

name: Dierbergs Markets
text: I love Dierbergs, after moving to the city of St. Louis I was dissappointed there were no Dierbergs within the city limits this is the closest one (I think) to my place. I really like their Deli, they have the best cooked meals, meats, deli items etc. The store is always clean and staff is very helpful! Also love the little directories on the side of each isle!

name: Euro Grill
text:
Stopped here for lunch on the way to drop some people off at the airport. It's a bit unexpected and a tiny bit off the beaten path on a residential street just behind a business district.

I chose the vegetarian plate and a Greek salad. The salad was the absolute best I've ever had. The cheese was absolutely fresh, the vegetables were fresh and chopped just for the salad, and the dressing and seasoning was perfect. The salad was quite large on its own and could easily make a light lunch by itself.

The vegetarian plate came along with their fresh pita-like bread that is baked fresh every morning, seasoned, pan fried vegetables, rice, and a tzatziki-like sauce drizzled on top. The flavors were astounding, and despite a lack of desire to stuff myself silly, I did anyway. Plenty of food for lunch and very reasonably priced.

name: Crazy Sushi
text: Came in for lunch and had their 3-roll lunch special for $13.  This also comes with a choice of soup or salad (I went for the salad).  I also ordered the yellowtail/scallion, eel/cucumber, and red snapper rolls.  The red snapper and yellowtail were very good, with lots of fish.  However, there was just something missing from all three rolls.  Maybe it's because I really enjoy the bigger rolls with lots of fish combinations.  But, these were good enough that I will definitely come back for dinner one night to try their specialty rolls.

name: Savers
text: Best thrift store in Tucson! Lots of selection, and there's usually a particular color tag that's 50% off each day. The store is roomy and well-lit, though the last time I went it seemed a little dingy and chaotic. Overall, a great place to look for clothes you'll only use once (Halloween costumes, coats for trips out of town, etc.), rarely-used small appliances, and the like.

name: The Spice Corner
text:
I love the smell of this place! Any spice you need, they have it. The staff also makes great recommendations if you're unsure of what you're looking for. I have never gotten a "stale" spice here. I enjoy the smaller size portions- it keeps things fresh in your own kitchen.
Great for harder to find items, especially for Indian dishes. 
Cash only.

name: Katie's Restaurant & Bar
text: Another of my must haves whenever I come home to see my family. Amazing. I have not eaten anything here that I haven't throughly enjoyed. The crawfish beignets are cheesy and spicy. The stuffed poboy is rich and flavorful with lots of gravy. The redfish and grits is something I still crave. Get there early because they get very busy very quickly, I've even waited in line for them to open. Parking is always a struggle, but it's worth it.

name: Three Muses
text: Made reservation a over a week ago with request to be near band. On arrival they had no record of it. And we are stuck in the back next to the bathroom. 5 stars for cocktail,food, band and Atmosphere. 1 stars for utter lack of organization.  The woman who took it said she was new. Always call to confirm I guess. Completely disappointed esp since we've had such amazing experiences here in the past.  There open tables near front and were told they were for people with reservations

name: Lucy's Retired Surfers Bar & Restaurant
text: Great place for fun and good food.  I love the surfer concept.  Mahi tacos were done well!   My only gripe is that they don't include wine in happy hour prices.

name: Zoes Kitchen
text: 2nd visit. Tried all new items this visit and loved them all. Moroccan Chicken Piadina was delicious. Basil  Hummus was my fav. The icing on the cake is the lemon  cookies. Wow! Pro-tip: hummus is $3.99 at happy hour.

name: World Sports Grille
text:
This place is great if  only ambiance you crave is behind a joystick.  Wife and I brought in the kids for some games.  They had a blast!

Wife and I were bored out of our minds,  while paying resort prices for drinks at the most boring bar in Tucson.  We couldn't leave because we opted for the "All Day Pass" for the kids.

I felt like I was in jail.  No Windows, Dark, Quiet Boring Music: This place could be so much better.  I was thinking it would be like Dave and Busters....nope. Jail.

We ended up taking a loss on the Day Pass after 1.5 Hours because I could not take it any more.  (Also because our Alcohol tab was like 45 bucks and I had only had a few drinks.) 

Next time we are going to Peter Piper's.

name: Mad Dogs
text: Great place. Take advantage of their wonderful deals and food. I would come in for lunch and get the 6$ combo meal whenever I didn't pack a lunch. They have some of the best fries I have ever tasted. Also if you want to try their snowcones. Go for it. They are humongous. Great place I always like to swing by eery while.

name: Molldeli's Delicatessen
text:
Great place for a family to dine.  Where parents can have a beer after a long day and kids can play a game or two while waiting.

Food was excellant...pizza a must

The staff of friendly and props to a family business that is not a CHAIN in soco.

GO THERE ASAP

name: Tbar
text: As others have said, great place to set up with your laptop or books. Spacious clean interior. Bubble tea never tasted so good...

name: Bareburger - Midtown Village
text: Delicious organic burger, but a bit overpriced for the size. Sweet potato fries excellent, but also overpriced.  Service is good.

name: Hackett's Causeway Cafe and Creamery
text: Great little spot with fresh ice cream, pizzas, sandwiches, and beer! The ice cream was amazing and incredibly fresh. Locally owned so nice to support the community. Right off the Pinellas Trail with a nice sized patio so this it's really convenient lunch stop on a long ride.

name: Mamas Kitchen
text: We came here based on the recommendation we received and from the street it doesn't look like much. But when you sit down and you scan the menu you will come to realize that this place serves nothing but home-cooked comfort food. We had the BLT and it was packed full of flavor, they didn't scrimp on the bacon and the vegetables for very fresh. With the sandwiches came some of the best french fries that we've had, and some of the best coleslaw that I've had in the state of Florida. We took a couple of pies home and they were delicious. We will definitely come back.

name: Regrub
text:
Probably my favourite turkey burger I've ever had. So flavourful and delicious!

I'm lactose intolerant and took my lactose pills to have the milkshake. It was fantastic. I had the Nanaimo Square one. 

Left super full and very happy (with great Instagram pics to boot!)

name: The Bricks
text: Just went there yesterday for brunch...  I've had a ton of grilled cheese sandwiches but this makes my top five. Loved the atmosphere. So happy we gave this restaurant a chance.

name: Adolf Biecker Spa/Salon
text:
OOkay Adolf Bieker is officially the shit. I already come here regularly to get a brazilian with Suzanne. Actually I can rave on about this too seeing that I will never shave again because of her. Suzy is the best, really. If you worry about the pain just take some ibuprofen beforehand. She is quick, makes you feel totally comfortable, and your steez is glowing and beautiful in the end. You can thank me later.

Buut I've been cleansing this month and wanted her to give me this detoxing seaweed body masque treatment. My brain is so full of zen from last night I can't even put into words how a-may-zing this experience was. I pictured her like wrapping me in seaweed chilling in a bed for 10 minutes and voila. It's this seaweed mud mask cocoon wrapping heavenly facial/head massage deal. The best part in the end these shower heads that hang from the ceiling pour down on you as you get a rub down but these things are like massaging you too. You kind of feel like you're lying in pouring rain but not like Philadelphia street rain or anything more like Hawaiian island LOST kind of rain. Then you can chill in this steam sauna room after and shower off. My skin is glowing and I feel awesome. 95 dollars well spent.

name: Pacific Crest Hotel Santa Barbara
text:
It was my first time in Santa Barbara and it was the cheapest place I could find. It was a bit overpriced but it was Father's Day weekend and the weekend of the Summer Solstice Festival, which was understandable. 

Upon check-in, the gentleman at the office was very friendly and informational. He oriented us on great places to eat and what places we can go to that are nearby. No key cards, they use old school keys. Which I thought was pretty cool. 

Location is perfect! You can see the ocean from the Inn. The beach is literally just down the street. It's a mile away from State St. I was a little worried about what the rooms would look like judging from the outside of the Inn, but the room was simple and surprisingly very clean. Room comes with mini fridge, coffee maker (a little dirty), portable air-conditioner, cable with HBO, and wifi. Bathroom and shower were clean and came with mini shampoo and soap. Was not expecting cleaning service but it was a nice little surprise going back to the room with the bed made and fresh new towels. Pretty roomy for a queen sized bed room. 

Although it was pretty pricey, I had a great first experience in Santa Barbara and enjoyed my stay at the Inn.

name: R2L
text: Fantastic views, fantastic food, great service! Went here for brunch and it was truly decadent. Also, it was not very crowded, which was surprising, because the food was so reasonably priced (well, center city prices anyway). I'll definitely be back!

name: Kuchi Sushi & Hibachi
text: I love the kuchi for two deal!! Only $49! Ask for chef Andy he's funny and makes the best hibachi!

name: Fresco Pizzeria
text: I've been there a couple times now. Pasta is very good, great servings and their pizzas are excellent. The guy at the counter, Dusty or Dustin, is very friendly.

name: Ringletts
text: I love this salon!!! The staff is always friendly, and welcoming and it is always clean. You can book an appointment online as well. I'd recommend this salon to anyone. They offer facials, and arm and face waxing. My hair has a lot of texture and there is no place other than ringletts that can tame my hair.

name: Nashville Cleaners
text:
Been here a few times. Second time I used them, my sweater came back with a hole in it. I chalked it up to just bad luck and didn't blame them. It was a delicate sweater. 

Next time I used them, they stored my clothes under the wrong name and number ( quite a hard thing to do since I had picking up clothes at the same time I dropped those off, and they already had my name up in their system). Tip: Never lose your green slip or you may never see your clothes again!!

When I got home,  I inspected my black and white formal dress. They ruined it. The white had grey stains all over it. When I brought it back to show them, the blamed it on "dirt that got inside the lining of the dress". Apparently, I rolled around in the dirt in my formal dress so much that it got trapped between layers of sewn together fabric. This "dirt" conveniently was invisible to the naked eye until it was dry-cleaned. 

When I asked to speak to the owner, they said to call ahead the next day to make sure he's in before I come. I told them that I would come at noon and to let the owner know that. The next day I call at 11:30 to remind them. They tell me that there's no need to talk to the owner. He confirmed that it was dirt inside the dress and has left. They can fix it but that it will be hard and expensive. How convenient. Ruin my dress and then up-charge me clean it again, all the whole complaining about how hard it will be to clean. Now that's customer service. 

Off to find a new dry-cleaner

name: Brandon Bagels
text:
If you live in Brandon you know that it's a challenge to find a place to eat that is not a chain restaurant, or doesn't have a drive-through window. From the exterior you might think this place does back woods human organ removal late night, and the inside isn't going to blow you away either, but that's where the negativity ends with this story folks.
Not only are their bagels and other assorted delicacies ridiculously delicious, but every menu item is inexpensive and almost be hooves you to want to purchase more items. Get there early or your favorite bagels will be sold out before the clock strikes noon. Make sure you try the homemade cream cheeses as well, there is quite the assortment. The older couple that owns this place is old-school, so don't go in looking to be coddled. Get your food and get out you whiny hipsters, you will not be disappointed.

name: Seoul Garden
text:
Greg's Review for Korean tastes

Every dishes : normal
Side dishes : also normal
There are several rooms for guests.
Waitress need to be more kind.

I hope that there should be more large-scale korean restaurant like this. Even though its taste is normal, it is very popular.

name: Halcyon Floats
